story:
What is?

ArtTap has 2 functions: 

1. To expose the world to amazing video, art, and design.

2. To give great artists the exposure they deserve.

We’re a small team of artists seeking to make the world a better place through beauty and creativity. We scour the internet for the best possible artistic content we can find and deliver it to your eyeballs via TheArtTap.com. We’re different from most curated content sites because we always credit the original artist and we commit to fighting manipulative “click-bait” headlines.

As artists, we’re somewhat lacking in the money department. That’s why we need your help to bring as much beauty to the world as possible through the interwebs.

What We Need & What You Get

First, we need to pay our people, in this case, there are just two of us: Zach and Jordan. Zach is a published author and the former (first) content curator for the fastest growing website in the history of the internet. He makes electronic music in his spare time and is a lover of poetry. Jordan is a graphic designer and illustrator who’s worked for some pretty big-deal peoples including the US ARMY (imagine that). He also enjoys trivia and Saturday morning cartoons. In order to devote enough time to bringing you the best stuff that’s out there, we need a little moolah.

We also need to create the bones of the site in a way that allows us to put new stuff up all the time so you get the best, newest, creative content we can find! There’s a lot that goes into creating a website that can bear the load of what we’re talking about, so we need to pay some really smart people to make that for us.

And, last but not least, we want to take this to the corners of the earth (even though the earth is round). In short, we’re going to launch a massive marketing campaign so people everywhere know about what you helped us start.

Speaking of giving us money, we have tons of exciting perks for people who donate. These include custom art, expert marketing help, and a free download of the ever-growing ArtTap Soundtrack, which features a bunch of songs from indie artists (we’ll update you every so often on new artists who jump on board).

The Impact

First of all, ArtTap can make your life more beautiful (if you believe in the power of art) and keep you in the know about new movements in the art world. Plus, we don’t believe in Click Bait.

You’ve probably seen headlines like this: "This Video Will Restore Your Faith In Humanity" or "You Won’t Believe Your Eyes When…" (Whatever).
We don’t do that. If we genuinely think something is “The Best ________ Ever” we’ll tell you, but we want to be honest with you. Our headlines will be succinct, descriptive, and tell you exactly what you’re looking at. Who knows, maybe we’ll start a movement?

Second, we believe in giving credit where credit is due: to the original artist. Every. Time.

Risks & Challenges

Our main competition: there are a lot of sites that try to do what we’re talking about, but what we haven’t seen are 2 very important components to making any art site a success. 

1: Start by believing in and mobilizing awesome people (that’s you!). We like you and we want to keep you. You’re the kind of person that checks ArtTap every evening after school or work (or during) and you’re what it’s all about

2. Sharing the love with artists. We want to provide exposure to artists who don’t have much by hosting a “Tap of the Week” in our banner from artists who submit their work to us. We’ll include an exclusive written or video interview with a new artist each week and link back to their website.

Just because we have great ideas doesn’t mean we won’t have challenges. That’s why we’ve surrounded ourselves with smart businesspeople and experienced creatives who can help us navigate the shark-infested waters of curated and viral content sites.

Let’s be honest, there are tons of sites that are trying to do what we’re starting, but the key word is trying. We aim to succeed at doing something that’s never really been done.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are short on cash right now, don’t worry! We are, too! But if you care about the arts or just think we seem pretty cool, here are a couple of things you can do to help out:

·  Share about our campaign on Facebook and Twitter at least once a week! Tell your friends what you think is cool about this idea and how they can be involved for just $5!

·  Use Indiegogo sharing tools to get the word out!

Thanks so much for reading. Let's make the world more beautiful together.

Yours,

(and Zach and Jordan)

P.S. Check us out on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/TheArtTap

story:
SOUTHERN BELLES RAISIN' HELL!

There is no shortage of women, trans and gender non-conforming people doing impressive and important work all over this city. Since many spaces dedicated to art and music around Atlanta primarily serve and exhibit men’s works, we are ready to knock down doors to make the very first Ladyfest Atlanta happen. Since “Dudefest” is an internationally recognized event that can be found any time in any town, this one’s for the ladiezzz!

Ladyfest Atlanta will be a 3-day festival hosted by Mammal Gallery, Eyedrum, and The Big House On Ponce. It will kick off the weekend of March 20-22, 2015 including gallery exhibits, performances, workshops, lectures, music, and other activities!

We strive to create a space for woman-identified and gender non-conforming artists of all types to share their work. However, Ladyfest isn't just a music festival. Ladyfest is also a movement to create an intentional space where woman-identified and gender non-conforming artists of all types share their work and speak out on local issues. Our mission is to celebrate and encourage community while also precipitating dialogue and education around anti-oppression work and action in right here in Atlanta, especially as it relates to women’s rights.


SHORT HERSTORY OF LADYFEST

The first Ladyfest was organized by many of the well known Riot Grrrrrrls in 2000 in Olympia, WA. It was a 5 day festival where they fundraised for local women’s projects/organizations–over 2,000 people came out to be a part of it. The organizers explicitly told people to go organize in their own towns and now, Ladyfest has become a global event. Ladyfest South was the first Ladyfest in Atlanta. The first was held in 2002, and two subsequent Ladyfest Souths were held in 2004 and 2007. 

While each Ladyfest is intended to be distinctly unique to the local needs of each community where the event is held, they share the name and a general philosophy. They are all events put together by grass-roots, volunteer organizers to reflect each unique community with an array of arts, music, film, workshops and events. Ladyfests’ ideals of anti-sexism, anti-transphobia and anti-homophobia are addressed throughout the fests in various ways. Ladyfests are festivals to celebrate women’s contributions, raise awareness around anti-oppressive work, and to empower and inspire participants to continue to spread the spirit of Ladyfest anywhere they go.

THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN

Ladyfest Atlanta is a DIY, grassroots festival organized entirely by volunteers. In order to be as accessible as possible, all three days of Ladyfest Atlanta will be free and open to the public. We are now asking for monetary contributions to fund the following:

  • Promotional materials(posters, programs, printing costs)
  • Venue costs(logistical materials for the fest)
  • Workshop materials(we will be presenting several skill building and educational workshops and we need your help to make these as awesome and informative as possible!!)

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

So you want to get involved with Ladyfest Atlanta but can't contribute financially?
Here's how you can help:

  • Spread the word! Share this page with your friends, like us on Facebook, and encourage all the talented artist folks you know to submit to the fest(submissions close January 15th).

story:
IT’S BACON TIME!

Bacon. Bacon. Bacon! Who doesn’t love bacon? Even people who aren’t supposed to love bacon often secretly love bacon, or at least admire it from afar. The best way to eat bacon is, of course, the simplest: the bacon sandwich. We’ve decided to combine two of our passions in life, making art and making bacon sandwiches into the awesomeness that will be…


The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook.


Not just any cookbook, these 125 recipes are presented in diagrammatic format. Essentially, each recipe looks like a bunch of stripes. Each colour signifies an ingredient, and the width of the stripe tells you how much of the ingredient you should be using. Figure it all out using the colour chart at the back of the book. Work for your bacon sandwich.


Recipes in the cookbook range from ridiculously simple, your hangover-busting basic bacon sarnie, to sublimely intricate. To qualify as a bacon sandwich, each recipe must include bacon and a type of bread. Everything else is optional.


The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook is a cookbook and an art book. Right now, it’s in our minds, but very soon it will be a digital delight and a real live, stunning quality, printed book. iPad or coffee table, your choice. Art and bacon, a delicious combination, seriously what could be better? I’ll tell you one thing that could be better? This Visual Cookbook could include one of your recipes, credited to you, for your ultimate bacon sandwich!


Yes, 120 of the 125 recipes featured in the book can be submitted by backers of this campaign. All over the world, people have their own version of the ultimate bacon sandwich, it’s time they were compiled in one place, and also turned into an artwork while we are at it.


Sweet! We have an art project, and we have a plan. And we also have an ulterior motive for raising money right now. Today we are in New Zealand, but in one month we want to move home. Support our campaign and help us move back to the US to set up an art studio where we can live the dream of being working artists; making, teaching and thriving, while changing the world one piece of custom art, and one Visual Cookbook, at a time.



Hello there!



Hi, we are Helen and Lars. Helen is British, Lars is Danish, two of our kids are American and one is a Kiwi-born Brit. We are both installation artists and have been making work together under the name tectonic industries since 1999. We met at Edinburgh College of Art when we were both doing our MFA’s in Sculpture, and after one too many nights in the pub we decided to collaborate in art and life.


Fast forward almost 15 years and we are still making artwork and exhibiting around the world. We now have a houseful of three little girls and a slightly increased tolerance for utter chaos and non-stop noise. Our lives have followed a path dictated by employment. From Scotland to America to New Zealand. But now? We have a new plan.


*****


So, this is the thing. We borrowed a dream. We found a dream, it seemed like it could work, and we went after it.


A great job in New Zealand, that sounded like something we could do.  But pretty soon we realised that dreams are not interchangeable. Unfortunately, this was not our dream. But we didn’t know that for sure until we uprooted our four year old and six year old and took them and our selves and our almost-ready-to-be-born daughter all the way from America to New Zealand to start a new life in Auckland.


Within six weeks we had a place to live, a car (ok, yeah a minivan, whatever, details) a cat, a new school, a new job and a new baby. We were going to make this work. It was going to work. All the upheaval, it would be worth it, because we would make it work. We tried so hard, but when something is not your dream, you can’t force it to take root. Our lives were in New Zealand, but our hearts stayed in America.


Within six months we were acutely aware of what we had left behind to follow this dream. After a year, we knew that it was make or break time. We could stay here and keep plugging on, one foot in front of the other. Or we could make a change, a giant, radical change, one that requires leaving the safety net that we are tangled in, and jumping absolutely into the unknown.


We decided to leap.


We are moving back to the USA in January 2014 to settle down forever and set up an art studio where we can live the dream! Our dream, the dream of making artwork and consciously designing a happy, creative, fulfilling life for us and our three beautiful daughters.


We have been making artwork together for almost fifteen years, producing pieces for galleries and museums, but we have never set out to intentionally create artwork for people to have in their homes. Somewhere along the line we came up with this brilliant idea to make unique artworks with pride and thought and attention to detail, which people commission, love and want to have in their homes. Amazing! 


***


Lately, we have started making paintings which focus on the overlap between food and art. We have been translating recipes into visual diagrams, which we then paint with archival quality acrylics on canvas. 

We assign ingredients a shade from a colour chart, then turn each recipe into a striped image. Each colour represents an ingredient from the recipe, and the width of each stripe represents the amount of the ingredient used in the meal, in proportion to all the other ingredients. We then paint each image. Each shade is mixed by hand from the primary colours with white and black. The process of painting this way is reminiscent of cooking, a dash of red, a little more yellow, a touch of blue…


Initially, we made recipe painting layouts from every single recipe in Rachael Ray's book, 365 No Repeats: A Year of Deliciously Different Dinners, at the The Rachael Ray Project. We had previously cooked our way through the book, while blogging about it, over the course of a year, so it seemed a fitting way to bring the art project full circle. 

However, we wanted to create a system where anyone could commission a painting of their favourite or most poignant meal so we created The Recipe Painting Project. Everyone has a meal that means something to them, perhaps an old family recipe or the meal you ate night after night when you were a student, or the meal you had on a first date or just your ultimate comfort food.  We have created a massive database of almost two thousand ingredients, and assigned each one a shade from a Pantone colour chart. We have room to add in any ingredients that were overlooked or are super rare, so we can make a recipe painting of any meal. From beans on toast to a nine-course extravaganza, anything is possible! Each and every painting is unique and each one tells a story.


At the heart of this idea is the notion that each painting becomes a collaboration between the food lover and the artists. We work together to bring your meal to life in a completely different medium, so that you can constantly be reminded of the taste, smell, ritual and process of cooking, eating and enjoying the meal. Plus, you have a gorgeous piece of custom artwork to brighten your room and your life. It’s yours, from your recipe, and it’s unlike anything else in the world.



Our dream is to create recipe paintings to make people think and smile in houses and restaurants across the world. We can see the stripes on menus, in interiors, and even across the outside of buildings. Imagine if you wrote a cookery book and each recipe had it’s own stripe diagram? 

We’re so excited about making a visual cookbook, we’re creating our own dedicated entirely to the wonders of the bacon sandwich, and we need your help.




HOW WILL THE BACON SANDWICH VISUAL COOKBOOK WORK?


The vast majority of the recipes to be featured in the Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook are going to be crowdsourced. This means that 120 of the 125 recipes will come from members of the public, be they top chefs or bacon fanatics. The first five we are reserving for our own favourite bacon sarnies, plus one from my Mum and a couple from friends with exceptional bacon sarnie good taste.


Once we have all 125 recipes, we will set about making a colour scheme to be used exclusively for this project. We will compile a list of all the submitted ingredients and put them in alphabetical order. From there we will choose a colour chart with a similar amount of shades as there are ingredients, from the world of graphic design. Each ingredient will be allocated to a colour. We will then create the colour chart key for the back of the book, with each colour labelled with the corresponding ingredient.


Next up, we will create stripe layouts for all 125 recipes. Each recipe will be represented by a stripe picture. Each ingredient is a colour, and the width shows how much of the ingredient is needed, relative to all the other ingredients. From there, we design the book layout, with a digital version and a paper version. Every recipe will have a title and a stripe image, with credit given to the author of the recipe. At the back of the book is the colour chart key, allowing readers to work for their bacon sarnie.


The digital version of the book will be optimized for viewing on the iPad but can be viewed as a PDF on all digital devices. The print version of the book will be printed on high quality paper in gorgeous full colour. It’s a recipe book and an art book rolled into one. We are super excited about the project, we hope you are too!




* SO HOW CAN YOU SUBMIT A RECIPE FOR THE BACON SANDWICH VISUAL COOKBOOK?


Certain pledge levels allow you to submit a recipe for inclusion in The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook. There are a limited number of spots available at the Early Bird pledge level of $150, then at every level from $250 up to $5000.


Once you have made a pledge at a level which allows you to submit a recipe, we will email you with the next step. We will ask you to send us the recipe exactly as you would like it to appear, with ingredients plus amounts. The sooner you make a pledge and submit your recipe the better – there are no duplicates allowed!


The criteria for a successful recipe is twofold, firstly it must include some kind of bacon and some kind of bread. Bread can be interpreted widely – pretzel, croissant, rye bread, sourdough, sandwich bread etc. The second criteria is that there can be no duplicate recipes. There can, and will, be variations on a theme, but there can be no exact duplicates. If we receive two identical recipes, the first one submitted stays and the second one will need to be tweaked. You could add tomato slices, or take away the chutney and add mustard, whatever makes sense to you. If you can’t change the recipe at all, you will be given the opportunity to submit an entirely new bacon sandwich recipe.


Once we receive your recipe and approve it, we will email you to let you know and post the recipe here at the bottom of this page so no one else can choose the same recipe. We will credit your submission to you, or if you like you can remain anonymous. For reasons of fairness, we can only accept one recipe per person.




IN A NUTSHELL:


  • We are making The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook, in both digital and fancy-pants printed versions. You will be able to get your hands on this art-cookbook hybrid, and even contribute a recipe to the publication. Sweet! 
  • We will be mailing thank-you postcards to your door and sending out postcard sets and limited edition, archival-quality prints, all created and available exclusively for this Indiegogo campaign. 
  • For some super lucky peeps we will be painting recipe paintings and for a select few we will be painting really giant recipe paintings. 
  • Your job, if you feel inspired to contribute, is to pick a pledge level and await the awesome. 
  • Our job is to keep in touch with our fabulous backers, move half way round the world again, set up a studio, finish the cookbook, make your rewards, and be profoundly grateful and delighted with every single donation, no matter the size. 


WE'RE UP FOR IT.  ARE YOU?!



WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

OK folks, this is where we break it down.


WHAT WE NEED:

Initially we are looking to raise our airfares back to the USA. There are five of us, and flights from New Zealand are not exactly cheap.


For airfares we need to raise $8500 US Dollars.


As soon as we have found somewhere to live, we need to set up a studio. This will probably be a room in our house, with a plan to rent a space outside our home at some point down the line. We are pretty much starting from scratch again so we will need to purchase basic furniture, a printer, art supplies including canvases and paint, and a Mac to replace the “work computer”. As soon as we have a space we will set to work on this project, to develop the digital book and also print the book on paper. 

To turbocharge the studio setup + production work on The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook, we are looking to raise $5,500. 

So, our total goal is $14,000 US Dollars


THE FUNDING:

We are setting this campaign up as flexible funding which means that even if we don’t quite meet our goal, we will still receive everyone’s generous donation. We have chosen to do this because we are going back to the US come hell or high water and every single penny will help. Seriously, it all counts and we are tremendously grateful for every single donation no matter the size.



WHAT YOU GET: 

Aside from the sweet glow of satisfaction that you’re changing lives, you will get some pretty sweet original artwork to call your own. We are offering great perks at every level. For each level you get your name on the Thank You Wall of Gratitude and all pledges over $5 get access to private Indiegogo-supporters-only posts at our new blog, Designing a Happy*Life.


FOR PLEDGE DETAILS + PERKS PLEASE SEE THE COLUMN ON THE RIGHT

[*All submitted recipes must consist of bacon + bread, and must not be duplicates of already submitted recipes.]


***   GIFTING A PLEDGE?   ***

Shopping for that person who is almost impossible to buy for? Running out of time? Why not support The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook project IN THEIR NAME as the most amazing gift?? They will get their name on the Thank You Wall of Gratitute (if you like) plus they'll get some amazing perks. Where else can you get your recipe in a cookbook as a present? Nowhere else, that's where!!

Choose your pledge level and make a donation at the correct amount. After you have completed the payment process, you will be able to change the visibility status of your pledge and credit it to another name (more details here).

When your pledge comes through, we will send your lucky recipient a beautiful emailed gift card telling them that you have pledged in their name, and what they will be receiving for their gift in the New Year (delayed gratification is the best, something to look forward to once all the festivities are over!)

GOOD FOR THEM + GOOD FOR YOU!!

For every pledge over $25 gifted to a friend, you will get a giftee too! 

* If you gift-pledge over $25 your friend will get the perks and the glory, and you'll get a digital copy of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook when it is released.

* If you gift-pledge over $100 your friend will get the perks and the glory, and you'll get a limited edition archival print + a digital copy of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook when it is released.

* If you gift-pledge over $3000 your friend will get the perks and the glory, and you'll get a 15cm x 20cm custom recipe painting + a limited edition archival print + a digital copy of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook when it is released.




ALL ABOUT THE REWARDS: 

We are all about quality. Seriously, we might be two of the world’s pickiest people. This is a terrible affliction when it comes to choosing a new coffee table, but completely brilliant when it comes to making artwork. We both started art college way back in 1993, and we continue to make and exhibit art to this day. Since starting to make work together in 1999, our motto has always been, if we don’t both agree, then it doesn’t get made. So you can rest assured that we are extremely picky about all the things that matter in a project like this – layout, print quality, colour saturation, backer satisfaction, dotting the i’s and crossing the t’s… These are all things which matter to us, enormously.


POSTCARDS will be printed on heavyweight card stock with stunning vivid colour and a gloss finish. We will choose our ten favourite designs and have them printed for the set of ten stripe postcards. These are not your average postcards, they are simply gorgeous. Everyone who backs this project at the $10 and above level will be sent a random card from the set in the mail, with a thank you message just for you.


PRINTS will be limited edition, archival quality giclee prints on beautiful thick watercolour paper. Each print will be signed and packaged wonderfully for safe transit. These prints will only ever be available for our Indiegogo backers. We will produce a set of five limited edition prints which will be revealed after all of the recipe stripe images have been created. Everyone who pledges to this campaign at a level offering prints will be contacted with the option to choose which print(s) they would prefer.


PRINTS OF YOUR RECIPE will be extremely limited edition, archival quality giclee prints on beautiful thick watercolour paper. Each print will be signed and packaged wonderfully for safe transit.


THE PRINTED BOOK will be a cross between an art book and a cook book. Expect high quality print on luxury paper, in full glorious technicolour. The books will be created by a print-on-demand company, and we’re currently researching which option gives us the most breath-takingly awesome end result.


RECIPE PAINTINGS are absolutely brilliant acrylic paintings done on canvas by us in our studio, wherever that may be. Everyone has a meal that is special to them, whether it is fish and chips or your family recipe for Christmas cake. Not everyone has their recipe translated into coloured stripes and painted by two experienced artists. No one else in the world will have a painting like you, it will make you smile and it will be the beginning of many a happy conversation. For the smallest painting (at the $500 pledge level) you will get a painting done of your bacon sandwich recipe layout. For the small, medium and large paintings ($1000, $1500 and $3000 pledge levels), you can choose to have a painting done of your submitted bacon sandwich recipe or any other recipe. For the extra-large painting ($5000 pledge level) you can choose to have your bacon sandwich recipe or a different recipe or one of the available stripe paintings from the Rachael Ray Project website. Outside of this campaign, the stripe recipe paintings retail for up to 30% more than the pledge levels here, so now is a great time to order yours!



WHEN YOU WILL GET YOUR REWARDS: 

As soon as this fundraiser concludes, we need to get back to the US and find a space to call our own. Once we have a city to call home, we will start formatting the recipes in stripe diagrams. From there, we will prepare the digital and printed version of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook for production. As soon as we have our studio set up we will start producing The Recipe Paintings. It is our very best estimate that the digital version of the book will be emailed and all physical rewards will be in the actual mail to you by the end of March 2014. We will of course keep you updated on estimated times of arrival along the way. Recipe paintings will take a little longer but we will communicate with you regarding the time-scale of your work, and anticipate that all paintings will be done by the end of April 2014 at the latest.


SHIPPING:

When rewards are ready to ship, we will be in the US and so will offer free shipping within the USA. If you are pledging from a country outside the US, it would be wonderful if you could add the following to your pledge to help offset the costs of shipping:

  • $10 - Please add $1 
  • $25 - Please add $1
  • $50 - Please add $2
  • $75 - Please add $4
  • $100 - Please add $5
  • $125 - Please add $10
  • $150 - Please add $10
  • $200 - Please add $15
  • $250 - Please add $15
  • $500 - Please add $40
  • $1000 - Please add $60
  • $3000 - Please add $120
  • $5000 - Please add $200




WHY CONTRIBUTING TO THIS CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT:

By contributing to this campaign, you will get us back to the US so that we can set up our lives as working artists. We have so much to give the world, so much artwork to make, and so many lives that we can change by making people pause, think and smile. We believe in the power of changing the world with beautiful, thoughtful artwork which can change your day for the better.

We actually can’t make this work without your help, which is why we are asking for your contribution today. We believe that this can be absolutely amazing, but we also need people to believe in us. If you’ve ever considered walking away from something which looks good on paper but just doesn’t feel like the life you should be living, please consider helping us with this campaign. If you’ve ever decided to take the leap into the unknown and leave your safety net behind, please decide to contribute. If you’ve ever had a dream and the beginnings of a plan, please consider helping us to navigate this new path. 

We need a financial boost to get this underway, our airfares are a really essential part of getting back;  without them, we’re literally stranded. In return, you will get some amazing perks, our never-ending gratitude, and the satisfaction of knowing that you really are helping to change the world, starting right here with one immensely grateful family.


OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

We know that not everyone can contribute financially, but we would still really truly appreciate your assistance. Please help spread the word about this campaign, so other people can get in on the bacon cookbook action and possibly commission a recipe painting of their very own. The more virtual noise we make about this, the better it will be!


SPREAD THE BACON LOVE:

The Indiegogo share tools below the video are spectacularly easy to use. Click to share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter or Google +. You can email a link to your friend or get a fancy widget to embed the campaign on your website or blog. Anything is possible! It's all good!

We are on Twitter as @happydesignlife and would love to Tweet with you. 

If you want to Tweet your support of this campaign that would be extra-specially awesome. Below are some sample tweets that you can copy and paste, or feel free to make them your own!

  • I'm making bacon! A bacon sandwich cookbook that is! Check out @happydesignlife on @Indiegogo http://igg.me/at/mmmbacon
  • Spread the bacon love! I'm supporting @happydesignlife on @Indiegogo http://igg.me/at/mmmbacon
  • Your recipe in a bacon sandwich cookbook? I've submitted mine! http://igg.me/at/mmmbacon



WHERE ELSE YOU CAN FIND US:

You can find us writing about this big adventure on our new blog at Designing a Happy*Life

or take a look at our artwork at tectonic industries

or check out  The Recipe Painting Project 

or The Rachael Ray Project


THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!!!

Seriously, thank you. Thanks for reading this far, for considering a pledge and for sharing this with your friends. We can't do this without your help, we are eternally grateful to each and every one of your wonderful selves. 


NOW LET'S GO MAKE SOME BACON!




************ RECIPES SUBMITTED SO FAR ***************

We will add the recipes here as they are submitted. Please do not submit a duplicate! Get yours in fast!

HEATHER LAUER :    BACON / EGGS / CHEESE / SESAME HAMBURGER BUN

ANONYMOUS :           GRANARY BREAD / MARMITE / PEANUT BUTTER /          TOMATO /  BACON

EL EDWARDS :           PUMPKIN ROLL / BACON MEDALLIONS / BRIE / LAMBS LETTUCE

JANET BOE :              SCOTTISH MORNING ROLL / TATTIE SCONE / EGG / AYRSHIRE BACON / BUTTER / KETCHUP

JOHN EBLING :          SOURDOUGH BREAD / BACON / TOMATOES / ARUGULA / ROMAINE / BALSAMIC VINEGAR / OIL / RED ONION / HOP ALE / WORCESTERSHIRE SAUCE / CREAM / BLUE CHEESE / GORGONZOLA
story_txt:
IT’S BACON TIME!Bacon. Bacon. Bacon! Who doesn’t love bacon? Even people who aren’t supposed to love bacon often secretly love bacon, or at least admire it from afar. The best way to eat bacon is, of course, the simplest: the bacon sandwich. We’ve decided to combine two of our passions in life, making art and making bacon sandwiches into the awesomeness that will be…The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook.Not just any cookbook, these 125 recipes are presented in diagrammatic format. Essentially, each recipe looks like a bunch of stripes. Each colour signifies an ingredient, and the width of the stripe tells you how much of the ingredient you should be using. Figure it all out using the colour chart at the back of the book. Work for your bacon sandwich.Recipes in the cookbook range from ridiculously simple, your hangover-busting basic bacon sarnie, to sublimely intricate. To qualify as a bacon sandwich, each recipe must include bacon and a type of bread. Everything else is optional.The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook is a cookbook and an art book. Right now, it’s in our minds, but very soon it will be a digital delight and a real live, stunning quality, printed book. iPad or coffee table, your choice. Art and bacon, a delicious combination, seriously what could be better? I’ll tell you one thing that could be better? This Visual Cookbook could include one of your recipes, credited to you, for your ultimate bacon sandwich!Yes, 120 of the 125 recipes featured in the book can be submitted by backers of this campaign. All over the world, people have their own version of the ultimate bacon sandwich, it’s time they were compiled in one place, and also turned into an artwork while we are at it.Sweet! We have an art project, and we have a plan. And we also have an ulterior motive for raising money right now. Today we are in New Zealand, but in one month we want to move home. Support our campaign and help us move back to the US to set up an art studio where we can live the dream of being working artists; making, teaching and thriving, while changing the world one piece of custom art, and one Visual Cookbook, at a time.Hello there!Hi, we are Helen and Lars. Helen is British, Lars is Danish, two of our kids are American and one is a Kiwi-born Brit. We are both installation artists and have been making work together under the name tectonic industries since 1999. We met at Edinburgh College of Art when we were both doing our MFA’s in Sculpture, and after one too many nights in the pub we decided to collaborate in art and life.Fast forward almost 15 years and we are still making artwork and exhibiting around the world. We now have a houseful of three little girls and a slightly increased tolerance for utter chaos and non-stop noise. Our lives have followed a path dictated by employment. From Scotland to America to New Zealand. But now? We have a new plan.*****So, this is the thing. We borrowed a dream. We found a dream, it seemed like it could work, and we went after it.A great job in New Zealand, that sounded like something we could do.  But pretty soon we realised that dreams are not interchangeable. Unfortunately, this was not our dream. But we didn’t know that for sure until we uprooted our four year old and six year old and took them and our selves and our almost-ready-to-be-born daughter all the way from America to New Zealand to start a new life in Auckland.Within six weeks we had a place to live, a car (ok, yeah a minivan, whatever, details) a cat, a new school, a new job and a new baby. We were going to make this work. It was going to work. All the upheaval, it would be worth it, because we would make it work. We tried so hard, but when something is not your dream, you can’t force it to take root. Our lives were in New Zealand, but our hearts stayed in America.Within six months we were acutely aware of what we had left behind to follow this dream. After a year, we knew that it was make or break time. We could stay here and keep plugging on, one foot in front of the other. Or we could make a change, a giant, radical change, one that requires leaving the safety net that we are tangled in, and jumping absolutely into the unknown.We decided to leap.We are moving back to the USA in January 2014 to settle down forever and set up an art studio where we can live the dream! Our dream, the dream of making artwork and consciously designing a happy, creative, fulfilling life for us and our three beautiful daughters.We have been making artwork together for almost fifteen years, producing pieces for galleries and museums, but we have never set out to intentionally create artwork for people to have in their homes. Somewhere along the line we came up with this brilliant idea to make unique artworks with pride and thought and attention to detail, which people commission, love and want to have in their homes. Amazing! ***Lately, we have started making paintings which focus on the overlap between food and art. We have been translating recipes into visual diagrams, which we then paint with archival quality acrylics on canvas. We assign ingredients a shade from a colour chart, then turn each recipe into a striped image. Each colour represents an ingredient from the recipe, and the width of each stripe represents the amount of the ingredient used in the meal, in proportion to all the other ingredients. We then paint each image. Each shade is mixed by hand from the primary colours with white and black. The process of painting this way is reminiscent of cooking, a dash of red, a little more yellow, a touch of blue…Initially, we made recipe painting layouts from every single recipe in Rachael Ray's book, 365 No Repeats: A Year of Deliciously Different Dinners, at the The Rachael Ray Project. We had previously cooked our way through the book, while blogging about it, over the course of a year, so it seemed a fitting way to bring the art project full circle. However, we wanted to create a system where anyone could commission a painting of their favourite or most poignant meal so we created The Recipe Painting Project. Everyone has a meal that means something to them, perhaps an old family recipe or the meal you ate night after night when you were a student, or the meal you had on a first date or just your ultimate comfort food.  We have created a massive database of almost two thousand ingredients, and assigned each one a shade from a Pantone colour chart. We have room to add in any ingredients that were overlooked or are super rare, so we can make a recipe painting of any meal. From beans on toast to a nine-course extravaganza, anything is possible! Each and every painting is unique and each one tells a story.At the heart of this idea is the notion that each painting becomes a collaboration between the food lover and the artists. We work together to bring your meal to life in a completely different medium, so that you can constantly be reminded of the taste, smell, ritual and process of cooking, eating and enjoying the meal. Plus, you have a gorgeous piece of custom artwork to brighten your room and your life. It’s yours, from your recipe, and it’s unlike anything else in the world.Our dream is to create recipe paintings to make people think and smile in houses and restaurants across the world. We can see the stripes on menus, in interiors, and even across the outside of buildings. Imagine if you wrote a cookery book and each recipe had it’s own stripe diagram? We’re so excited about making a visual cookbook, we’re creating our own dedicated entirely to the wonders of the bacon sandwich, and we need your help.HOW WILL THE BACON SANDWICH VISUAL COOKBOOK WORK?The vast majority of the recipes to be featured in the Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook are going to be crowdsourced. This means that 120 of the 125 recipes will come from members of the public, be they top chefs or bacon fanatics. The first five we are reserving for our own favourite bacon sarnies, plus one from my Mum and a couple from friends with exceptional bacon sarnie good taste.Once we have all 125 recipes, we will set about making a colour scheme to be used exclusively for this project. We will compile a list of all the submitted ingredients and put them in alphabetical order. From there we will choose a colour chart with a similar amount of shades as there are ingredients, from the world of graphic design. Each ingredient will be allocated to a colour. We will then create the colour chart key for the back of the book, with each colour labelled with the corresponding ingredient.Next up, we will create stripe layouts for all 125 recipes. Each recipe will be represented by a stripe picture. Each ingredient is a colour, and the width shows how much of the ingredient is needed, relative to all the other ingredients. From there, we design the book layout, with a digital version and a paper version. Every recipe will have a title and a stripe image, with credit given to the author of the recipe. At the back of the book is the colour chart key, allowing readers to work for their bacon sarnie.The digital version of the book will be optimized for viewing on the iPad but can be viewed as a PDF on all digital devices. The print version of the book will be printed on high quality paper in gorgeous full colour. It’s a recipe book and an art book rolled into one. We are super excited about the project, we hope you are too!* SO HOW CAN YOU SUBMIT A RECIPE FOR THE BACON SANDWICH VISUAL COOKBOOK?Certain pledge levels allow you to submit a recipe for inclusion in The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook. There are a limited number of spots available at the Early Bird pledge level of $150, then at every level from $250 up to $5000.Once you have made a pledge at a level which allows you to submit a recipe, we will email you with the next step. We will ask you to send us the recipe exactly as you would like it to appear, with ingredients plus amounts. The sooner you make a pledge and submit your recipe the better – there are no duplicates allowed!The criteria for a successful recipe is twofold, firstly it must include some kind of bacon and some kind of bread. Bread can be interpreted widely – pretzel, croissant, rye bread, sourdough, sandwich bread etc. The second criteria is that there can be no duplicate recipes. There can, and will, be variations on a theme, but there can be no exact duplicates. If we receive two identical recipes, the first one submitted stays and the second one will need to be tweaked. You could add tomato slices, or take away the chutney and add mustard, whatever makes sense to you. If you can’t change the recipe at all, you will be given the opportunity to submit an entirely new bacon sandwich recipe.Once we receive your recipe and approve it, we will email you to let you know and post the recipe here at the bottom of this page so no one else can choose the same recipe. We will credit your submission to you, or if you like you can remain anonymous. For reasons of fairness, we can only accept one recipe per person.IN A NUTSHELL:
We are making The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook, in both digital and fancy-pants printed versions. You will be able to get your hands on this art-cookbook hybrid, and even contribute a recipe to the publication. Sweet! 

We will be mailing thank-you postcards to your door and sending out postcard sets and limited edition, archival-quality prints, all created and available exclusively for this Indiegogo campaign. 


For some super lucky peeps we will be painting recipe paintings and for a select few we will be painting really giant recipe paintings. 


Your job, if you feel inspired to contribute, is to pick a pledge level and await the awesome. 


Our job is to keep in touch with our fabulous backers, move half way round the world again, set up a studio, finish the cookbook, make your rewards, and be profoundly grateful and delighted with every single donation, no matter the size. 

WE'RE UP FOR IT.  ARE YOU?!WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET:OK folks, this is where we break it down.WHAT WE NEED:Initially we are looking to raise our airfares back to the USA. There are five of us, and flights from New Zealand are not exactly cheap.For airfares we need to raise $8500 US Dollars.As soon as we have found somewhere to live, we need to set up a studio. This will probably be a room in our house, with a plan to rent a space outside our home at some point down the line. We are pretty much starting from scratch again so we will need to purchase basic furniture, a printer, art supplies including canvases and paint, and a Mac to replace the “work computer”. As soon as we have a space we will set to work on this project, to develop the digital book and also print the book on paper. To turbocharge the studio setup + production work on The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook, we are looking to raise $5,500. So, our total goal is $14,000 US DollarsTHE FUNDING:We are setting this campaign up as flexible funding which means that even if we don’t quite meet our goal, we will still receive everyone’s generous donation. We have chosen to do this because we are going back to the US come hell or high water and every single penny will help. Seriously, it all counts and we are tremendously grateful for every single donation no matter the size.WHAT YOU GET: Aside from the sweet glow of satisfaction that you’re changing lives, you will get some pretty sweet original artwork to call your own. We are offering great perks at every level. For each level you get your name on the Thank You Wall of Gratitude and all pledges over $5 get access to private Indiegogo-supporters-only posts at our new blog, Designing a Happy*Life.FOR PLEDGE DETAILS + PERKS PLEASE SEE THE COLUMN ON THE RIGHT[*All submitted recipes must consist of bacon + bread, and must not be duplicates of already submitted recipes.]***   GIFTING A PLEDGE?   ***Shopping for that person who is almost impossible to buy for? Running out of time? Why not support The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook project IN THEIR NAME as the most amazing gift?? They will get their name on the Thank You Wall of Gratitute (if you like) plus they'll get some amazing perks. Where else can you get your recipe in a cookbook as a present? Nowhere else, that's where!!Choose your pledge level and make a donation at the correct amount. After you have completed the payment process, you will be able to change the visibility status of your pledge and credit it to another name (more details here).When your pledge comes through, we will send your lucky recipient a beautiful emailed gift card telling them that you have pledged in their name, and what they will be receiving for their gift in the New Year (delayed gratification is the best, something to look forward to once all the festivities are over!)GOOD FOR THEM + GOOD FOR YOU!!For every pledge over $25 gifted to a friend, you will get a giftee too! * If you gift-pledge over $25 your friend will get the perks and the glory, and you'll get a digital copy of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook when it is released.* If you gift-pledge over $100 your friend will get the perks and the glory, and you'll get a limited edition archival print + a digital copy of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook when it is released.* If you gift-pledge over $3000 your friend will get the perks and the glory, and you'll get a 15cm x 20cm custom recipe painting + a limited edition archival print + a digital copy of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook when it is released.ALL ABOUT THE REWARDS: We are all about quality. Seriously, we might be two of the world’s pickiest people. This is a terrible affliction when it comes to choosing a new coffee table, but completely brilliant when it comes to making artwork. We both started art college way back in 1993, and we continue to make and exhibit art to this day. Since starting to make work together in 1999, our motto has always been, if we don’t both agree, then it doesn’t get made. So you can rest assured that we are extremely picky about all the things that matter in a project like this – layout, print quality, colour saturation, backer satisfaction, dotting the i’s and crossing the t’s… These are all things which matter to us, enormously.POSTCARDS will be printed on heavyweight card stock with stunning vivid colour and a gloss finish. We will choose our ten favourite designs and have them printed for the set of ten stripe postcards. These are not your average postcards, they are simply gorgeous. Everyone who backs this project at the $10 and above level will be sent a random card from the set in the mail, with a thank you message just for you.PRINTS will be limited edition, archival quality giclee prints on beautiful thick watercolour paper. Each print will be signed and packaged wonderfully for safe transit. These prints will only ever be available for our Indiegogo backers. We will produce a set of five limited edition prints which will be revealed after all of the recipe stripe images have been created. Everyone who pledges to this campaign at a level offering prints will be contacted with the option to choose which print(s) they would prefer.PRINTS OF YOUR RECIPE will be extremely limited edition, archival quality giclee prints on beautiful thick watercolour paper. Each print will be signed and packaged wonderfully for safe transit.THE PRINTED BOOK will be a cross between an art book and a cook book. Expect high quality print on luxury paper, in full glorious technicolour. The books will be created by a print-on-demand company, and we’re currently researching which option gives us the most breath-takingly awesome end result.RECIPE PAINTINGS are absolutely brilliant acrylic paintings done on canvas by us in our studio, wherever that may be. Not everyone has their recipe translated into coloured stripes and painted by two experienced artists. For the extra-large painting ($5000 pledge level) you can choose to have your bacon sandwich recipe or a different recipe or one of the available stripe paintings from the Rachael Ray Project website. Outside of this campaign, the stripe recipe paintings retail for up to 30% more than the pledge levels here, so now is a great time to order yours!WHEN YOU WILL GET YOUR REWARDS: As soon as this fundraiser concludes, we need to get back to the US and find a space to call our own. Once we have a city to call home, we will start formatting the recipes in stripe diagrams. From there, we will prepare the digital and printed version of The Bacon Sandwich Visual Cookbook for production. As soon as we have our studio set up we will start producing The Recipe Paintings. It is our very best estimate that the digital version of the book will be emailed and all physical rewards will be in the actual mail to you by the end of March 2014. We will of course keep you updated on estimated times of arrival along the way. Recipe paintings will take a little longer but we will communicate with you regarding the time-scale of your work, and anticipate that all paintings will be done by the end of April 2014 at the latest.SHIPPING:When rewards are ready to ship, we will be in the US and so will offer free shipping within the USA. story:
Safiyatou, owner of Super Fly Hair Boutique, is renowned nationally and internationally for producing, coordinating, and being featured in the hair and fashion industry for many years.  Her phenomenal work has garnered her being recognized by Essence Magazine as one of the 50 top Hair Colorists in the nation.  From the Golden Scissors events, to Harlem Fashion Week, to the islands of the Carribbean, Safiyatou’s award winning work has wowed audiences and put her in demand with numerous high profile clients.  In the past, she has used her talents to raise money for breast cancer research. Her current 2014 project is called “BaltimoreGirls” Hair Exhibition.  It is an art collection showcasing photography and life sculpture from an eclectic group of Maryland women of varied backgrounds and social strata.  It will highlight the work of Safiyatou and some of Baltimore’s elite designers,performing artists and photographers. Safiyatou's own personal challenges including renal failure, which many may not know of, created a passion in her for increasing an awareness of the challenges women around the globe face and maintain so well no one would ever imagine!  A portion of the proceeds will benefit the National Kidney Foundation (NKF).  The National Kidney Foundation is the leading organization in the United States dedicated to the awareness, prevention and treatment of kidney disease for hundreds of thousands of healthcare professionals, millions of patients and their families, and the millions of Americans at risk. 

“BaltimoreGirls” is an anthology of the lives of approximately 7 women and their life experiences attempting to overcome many of the obstacles that women living in Baltimore face.  Each woman has a story dealing with loneliness, isolation, fear, self-esteem, family, suicidal thoughts, seeking love, identity, abandonment, choices, coming out, pregnancy, and pursuit of happiness – embodied by every woman’s tale.  They are the stories of real people finding their own beauty and identity and creating their own sense of self-empowerment and social development.  “BaltimoreGirls” is designed to educate and inspire those seeking to overcome obstacles in their own lives.  This thought provoking array of works will have you amazed and wanting more. 

The “Baltimore Girls” Exhibition is intended to become a travelling art collection and will tour venues locally and throughout the country.  We recognize we need the support of our community to make this vision a reality.  Won’t you please contribute to breathe life into this most important work of art?  We and the National Kidney Foundation need your support.  We have provided several incentives to encourage you to give and give generously.  Please review them and make your contribution as all contributions are appreciated.  Don’t forget to aid us by sharing this link with your friends, family, and organizations you think may have an interest in this most important work.  There is also a sponsorship package available to groups and organization that would like to partner with us to aid in making this event a success. The funds will be used for the venue, enlarging and printing pictures,video production,photgraphers,marketing and promotional materials,caterer, lighting/display,art suppies and more!.... Your support is greatly appreciated!!!

and internationally for producing, coordinating, and being featured in the hair
and fashion industry for many years.  Her
phenomenal work has garnered her being recognized by Essence Magazine as one of
the 50 top Hair Colorists in the nation. 
From the Golden Scissors events, to Harlem Fashion Week, to the islands
of the Carribbean, Safiyatou’s award winning work has wowed audiences and put
her in demand with numerous high profile clients.  In the past, she has used her talents to
raise money for breast cancer research. Her current 2014 project is called
“BaltimoreGirls” Hair Exhibition.  It is
an art collection showcasing photography and life sculpture from an eclectic
group of Maryland women of varied backgrounds and social strata.  It will highlight the work of Safiyatou and

story:
BURNAWAY, The Voice of Art in the South

You need to know about all the great art stuff going on in the South. BURNAWAY is an Atlanta-based nonprofit that promotes contemporary art in the South through our online magazine, which has been free since its launch in 2008. BURNAWAY offers news, reviews, interviews, essays, studio visits, profiles, in-depth reporting, a monthly Call for Artists, and a weekly To Do List of openings, events and exhibitions. We also teach people how to write about art through our Art Writers Mentorship Program and our Teen Art Writing Intensive, and we bring well-known national art critics to town to engage with the local art community. We pride ourselves on being the go-to source for coverage of contemporary art in the South.

The Lowdown

Want to know what's going on in Birmingham or Richmond this weekend? Remember that article about the mysterious sign on Moreland Avenue, or the one about the do's and don'ts of social media? You should be able to quickly and easily find these things so that you stay informed about your local art scene. Don't you agree?

We won't bore you with talk of taxonomies and user experience. That's the job of our talented new web developer, who knows how to make our site efficient, navigable, reliable, and more engaging. Big picture here: you want to stay informed about art from the region, our new website will do that for you!

The cost: TEN THOUSAND BUCKS!!

This is where you come in!

What's In It For Me?

  • Be a part of something big!  You are helping us bring awareness to art in the south and taking the contemporary arts to underserved areas of the South ... hero!
  • It’s like a one-year to subscription to your favorite magazine.
  • You’ll stay connected to artists working and exhibiting in the South.
  • Free entry to one of our upcoming parties, for $50 or more.
  • A warm fuzzy feeling inside.

I Want to Help But ...

Hey, we get it. Things are tight. Here's what you can do:

  • Give what you can! Seriously, even $25 will put us closer to our goal.
  • Spread the word! Encourage friends and family to contribute.
  • Share our campaign and some kind words on social media.
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

story:
Click the images for more information on our featured artists!

 

 

WTF is the OUROBOROS?

 

(oura) "tail" (boros) "eating". The snake eating its own tail - destroying its own world, trapped in its own greediness whilst simultaneously giving birth to itself.

 

“The living being had no need of eyes because there was nothing outside of him to be seen; nor of ears because there was nothing to be heard; and there was no surrounding atmosphere to be breathed; nor would there have been any use of organs by the help of which he might receive his food or get rid of what he had already digested, since there was nothing which went from him or came into him: for there was nothing beside him. Of design he created thus; his own waste providing his own food, and all that he did or suffered taking place in and by himself.

 

For the Creator conceived that a being which was self-sufficient would be far more excellent than one which lacked anything …”

 

- Plato

 

 

That isn't much clearer ...

 

Promoting diversity and harmony through the arts by bringing together a multidisciplinary selection of socially excluded artists, the OUROBOROS exhibition is a week exploring the relationship between creation/destruction and art/austerity.

From the perspective of the excluded, these artists with experiences of homelessness, being differently abled, addiction, sex work are working to generate dialogue about the current world crisis through visual art and performance.

Collectively,we believe art can help us to know and to tackle these overwhelming issues.

The exhibition aims for as diverse an audience as the artists, accessible for the Deaf, visually impaired, and socially excluded, creating a model of social cohesion through the arts.

The artworks and performances are geared towards a commentary on social as well as personal issues. We hope to highlight the connection between the two states, and together empower ourselves to create the personal and world vision we desire.

 

 

But who the hell are you people?

 

OUROBOROS is entirely run by a volunteer collective that aspires to create multicultural harmony and empower dialogue for social and personal transformation through the arts.

We use performances, exhibitions and workshops to support people who are denied their right to full, happy and active participation in society.

We collaborate with socially excluded artists to develop their experience and resume to allow them greater access to society and fulfilling their desires in the future.

We strive to create a harmonious, multicultural society where healthy and empassioned debate and dialogue can take place between diverse groups of people,

We believe art is a powerful tool for this.

It is fundamental to create bridges between the parallel worlds of the mainstream and the underground for discussion to take place upon, and the intention of OUROBOROS to do just that.

 

 

And you need £5000 to do this?


Through the generous support of our partner organisations and a grant from the Arts Council, we have covered our core costs, and the OUROBOROS is alive.

We want the events to be free for everyone and accessible for all.

At the moment, our budget requires that we have to ask for £10 for each person for our performance events NOISE CORRUPTION & THE CIRCUS RIOT.

We believe that art is for everyone, and that everyone can be an artist.

For every extra pound we raise here, we can give more tickets away to people normally excluded from galleries and performance events, creating a diverse and inclusive mixture of participants.

 

The Targets

£1000

We will be able to give 50 per night away tickets to persons from socially excluded groups

£2500

When we confirm this amount, we will be able to reduce the entry cost from £10 to £5 for both events!

£4000

With your love and support, meeting this target would allow us to distribute 100 tickets a night for free, and reduce the cost of entry to only £3

£5000

If we reach our crowdfunding target, then entry for both events will be free for all, with a minimum of 50% of the spaces distributed to socially-excluded groups

 

We wish OUROBOROS to be free to everyone, regardless of their economic background, and to cost no expense for the artists involved, as accessibility and inclusion are our primary objectives.

Your support can help make this possible.

 

 

Join us and help us to create a model of the world where socially-engaged artists from diverse and oppressed backgrounds are supported and included in a dialogue about our future.

Contribute now, and you can choose from our range of perks, including reserving spaces to the performance events and limited edition customised pieces created by our artists.

It's no joke that without support our artists literally will be struggling to feed, clothe and shelter themselves.

We need your support to honour the work and struggle of the artists' during their time in one of the most expensive cities in Europe.

Whether we raise that amount or not - we will not stop. We will channel all our energies and finances into continuing to critique, destroy and rebirth the world through our artworks and actions. OUROBOROS is the beginning and the end, and whatever we have we will direct into sustained and meaningful social and personal transformation through the arts.

 

 

Why would you do this?

'Art is made not to decorate apartments, art is an instrument of war' - P.Picasso.

Our aim is to create a bridge between the mainstream art scene and the 'underground', for excluded artists for the oppressed to advance across.

Our aim is to provide gallery access to artists, whose initial aspiration is to be free to create a noncommercially driven artistic reflection of contemporary issues such as housing, the environment, mental health, gender and capitalism's crisis.​

We are creators - not sellouts.

There are barely any exhibitions or events happening in UK where groups of artists like us would be provided access to a gallery space because though we shout out loud, we don't sell.

We don't carry meaningless concepts about abstract non existing problems. Our work is a direct mirror which every single person can look into and understand the reflection - not just gallerists and crowds educated in art.

OUROBOROS  is an opportunity for us to present our ideas to a wider public, to inspire others to become political, to talk about social problems, to share a view of the world in our way - not his way.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The impending global apocalypse

The rise of a society divided against itself

Hunger, homelessness, oppression

The looming spectre of the Arts Council audit

Sobriety

 

 

By the gargantuan effort of imprisoning one of our volunteers in a tower for six weeks, we managed to convince the Arts Council to give us 30% of our budget.

From this, we booked the venue and paid for the artists to travel to it.

We need more.

 

 

What else can I do?

 

What we pay attention to creates the world.

More than anything - we need you to look at what is happening and get involved in creating the future you desire.

We are artists and organisers, but this is only our path in attacking what we see as wrong in the world.

 

 

JOIN US.

Come to the show.

Share our and your creations.

Tell people about what is happening.

Make small changes in your life that will have a big impact.

Destroy what destroys you.

 

Reserve your space at the performance events now!

 

There are limited spaces for both the performance nights, so get in touch now to reserve yours at oneslutriot@gmail.com and  george@reboottheroots.org.uk

 

OUROBOROS will be at the Underdog Gallery, 6 Crucifix Ln, London SE1 3JW, from 17th to 22nd February 2017.

FOR YOUR DIARY!

NOISE CORRUPTION (Fri 17th February)
A night of demented DIY noise performances and sound sculptures, featuring horrorcore visionaries RANCID OPERA (IT) and a spread of the UK's most innovative and challenging performers and artists.

THE CIRCUS RIOT (Sat 18th February)
A circus of the unheard. Bringing together Pyratrix Circus and Alleyway Radical Theatre for a night of acabarave, occult and orgy.

 

Check out our perks below!

OUROBOROS is organised in collaboration with Reboot The Roots. Check out more of their work at www.reboottheroots.org.uk

story:
With your support Kristal will furnish and equip Studio Northwest, a new photo studio and event space, providing affordable long-term monthly memberships to a collective of photographers as well as hourly rentals for photo shoots and creative workshops.

Studio Northwest will:

  • Provide hourly & monthly rentals for shoots, client meetings and workspace. 
  • Serve as a community space for workshops, artist presentations & networking events.
  • Support creative expression, inspiration and skill development.
  • Enable Kristal to offer her healing art portrait sessions

With your contribution Kristal will be able to purchase the items necessary to support studio members and provide a much-needed professional space for local photographers.

In order to get this small business running, we need your SUPPORT.

After 6 years of renting at different studios, I have learned the challenges that freelance photographers face on a daily basis.  Common issues are transporting heavy equipment without a loading elevator, lack of parking availability nearby, and locations in unsafe neighborhoods. As a woman photographer, I want to provide solutions to these common issues so that both photographers and their clients benefit.

Studio Northwest is in a secure building, has a convenient loading elevator, and parking spaces are easily available in a well-lit lot on the ground floor of the building. In addition, the studio is newly remodeled with locked storage for members, a well-designed dressing and seating area, backdrops, basic equipment and desk space for photo retouching. For me, creating a comfortable, inspiring and affordable studio for photographers will be a dream come true!

The Goal

I need to raise $5,000 to complete the studio. These funds will cover the expenses for buying the materials and equipment needed to furnish a professional photography workspace. With these funds, I will be able to purchase backdrops for portraits, posing stools and benches, curtains to cover and diffuse the window light, basic photo equipment for renters, as well as other furnishings for the dressing and waiting areas. 

Your donation will go towards making this studio a productive photostudio. Here are some of the items needed…Commercial set of black-out curtains - colored backdrops + holders - 2 large storage racks-sink - posing stools, benches & desks - photography light stands - mirrors - small couch - rugs - storage cabinets -  coffee table - make-up table, etc.

Why support photography? 

Photography is an important tool for visual communication, personal expression and awareness. Photographs create authentic reflections of our humanity and remind us of the miracle of life. Studio portraiture is especially unique because it creates a comfortable environment to share important life moments and personal truths. 

Risks & Challenges

Living one's dreams takes courage. It feels risky to bet on my abilities and potential, yet it is through believing in myself that I have evolved into the professional woman I am. I know that the work is not just in the action steps, but also in my ability to receive and feel worthy of living my dream. I feel challenged by the many tasks I have to complete, but welcome this process as an opportunity to learn, grow, and be an empowered woman, artist, and community member. I believe that showing-up, learning new skills, and confronting what scares me is the way to live a wholehearted, happy life.

For your support

I wanted all the rewards to not only gift you for your generosity, but also give some of you an opportunity to experience a photo shoot in the new studio space. These gifts are my way of sharing my passion for photography and thanking you for helping me realize my dream. Check out these wonderful perks below.

Donation Perks

$15  - Thank you note

$25 - Photo card & Thank you (5x7)

$50 - Photo print (5x5) & Thank you 

$75 - Photography print (8x10) & Thank-you card

$100 – Photography print (11X14)

$200 – 4 square prints + photo print (11x14)

$200 – Photography session ~$250 value

Includes up to two hours in the studio w/ 10 digital photo files for download. Additional photos in gallery available at cost. 

$350 – Photography Session ~$500 value

Up to 3 hours in studio w/ 20 retouched photo files. Additional photos in gallery available at cost. 

$350  - Collection of photo prints

Two unframed Fine Art photo prints, one 16x20 and the other 11x14 and a set of 10 printed flower photo cards.

$500 – Photography session with prints

With this donation you will receive a professional photography session that includes up to 3 hours on location or in the studio, 20 digital files and (1) 11x14, (2) 8x10, (5) 5x7's prints. You will also receive a beautiful photo thank you card.

$500 - Fine Art photograph + card set

With this donation you get to select a photograph of your choice from my online gallery  http://www.kristalpassy.com/print-shop. Options include the popular "Dreaming Tree" photograph or any other of my photos. As additional thanks you will receive a set of (10) flower photo cards.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have any extra money to donate?  There are other ways you can help:

  • Post this campaign on your Facebook, Linkedin or blog pages 

Link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/create-a-new-studio-for-a-photography-collective/x/15547581#/​

  •  Share with your email contacts
  • "Like" Studio Northwest at https://www.facebook.com/studionorthwestphotographers/
  • Join the mailing list: http://www.studio-northwest.com/
  • Are you good at lifting or assembling and want to lend a helping hand? Join a work party to help install the new furnishings and equipment. Contact info@studio-northwest.com

Gratitude

For many years I wished to have a studio like this. With your help, this space will become a place to create beautiful memories, build community and support freelance photographers. Watching this dream become real fills my heart with tremendous joy! Accompanying each step has been a mix of fear and excitement. I am grateful for my supportive family and friends, whose love and encouragement gave me the determination to put myself out there and take on this project. Thank you for watching and sharing my video, and for helping me to reach my goal! 

THANK YOU!

These funds will cover the expenses for buying the materials and equipment needed to furnish a professional photography workspace. With these funds, I will be able to purchase backdrops for portraits, posing stools and benches, curtains to cover and diffuse the window light, basic photo equipment for renters, as well as other furnishings for the dressing and waiting areas. Your donation will go towards making this studio a productive photostudio. Here are some of the items needed…Commercial set of black-out curtains - colored backdrops + holders - 2 large storage racks-sink - posing stools, benches & desks - photography light stands - mirrors - small couch - rugs - storage cabinets -  coffee table - make-up table, etc.Why support photography? Photography is an important tool for visual communication, personal expression and awareness. Photographs create authentic reflections of our humanity and remind us of the miracle of life. Studio portraiture is especially unique because it creates a comfortable environment to share important life moments and personal truths. Risks & ChallengesLiving one's dreams takes courage. It feels risky to bet on my abilities and potential, yet it is through believing in myself that I have evolved into the professional woman I am. I know that the work is not just in the action steps, but also in my ability to receive and feel worthy of living my dream. I feel challenged by the many tasks I have to complete, but welcome this process as an opportunity to learn, grow, and be an empowered woman, artist, and community member. I believe that showing-up, learning new skills, and confronting what scares me is the way to live a wholehearted, happy life.For your support I wanted all the rewards to not only gift you for your generosity, but also give some of you an opportunity to experience a photo shoot in the new studio space. These gifts are my way of sharing my passion for photography and thanking you for helping me realize my dream. Check out these wonderful perks below.Donation Perks$15  - Thank you note$25 - Photo card & Thank you (5x7)$50 - Photo print (5x5) & Thank you $75 - Photography print (8x10) & Thank-you card$100 – Photography print (11X14)$200 – 4 square prints + photo print (11x14)$200 – Photography session ~$250 valueIncludes up to two hours in the studio w/ 10 digital photo files for download. Additional photos in gallery available at cost. $350 – Photography Session ~$500 valueUp to 3 hours in studio w/ 20 retouched photo files. Additional photos in gallery available at cost. $350  - Collection of photo printsTwo unframed Fine Art photo prints, one 16x20 and the other 11x14 and a set of 10 printed flower photo cards.$500 – Photography session with printsWith this donation you will receive a professional photography session that includes up to 3 hours on location or in the studio, 20 digital files and (1) 11x14, (2) 8x10, (5) 5x7's prints. You will also receive a beautiful photo thank you card.$500 - Fine Art photograph + card setWith this donation you get to select a photograph of your choice from my online gallery  http://www.kristalpassy.com/print-shop. Options include the popular "Dreaming Tree" photograph or any other of my photos. As additional thanks you will receive a set of (10) flower photo cards.Other Ways You Can HelpDon't have any extra money to donate?  There are other ways you can help:Post this campaign on your Facebook, Linkedin or blog pages Link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/create-a-new-studio-for-a-photography-collective/x/15547581#/​
 Share with your email contacts
"Like" Studio Northwest at https://www.facebook.com/studionorthwestphotographers/

Join the mailing list: http://www.studio-northwest.com/

Are you good at lifting or assembling and want to lend a helping hand? Join a work party to help install the new furnishings and equipment. Contact info@studio-northwest.com
GratitudeFor many years I wished to have a studio like this. With your help, this space will become a place to create beautiful memories, build community and support freelance photographers. Watching this dream become real fills my heart with tremendous joy! Accompanying each step has been a mix of fear and excitement. I am grateful for my supportive family and friends, whose love and encouragement gave me the determination to put myself out there and take on this project. Thank you for watching and sharing my video, and for helping me to reach my goal! THANK YOU!

story:
ABOUT ME

I am a German-born artist and live and work in the UK. Having studied sculpture at Kingston University and the Wimbledon School of Art, my current work is primarily concerned with the processes of mark making and how to challenge the concept of drawing.

My work has been extensively exhibited in London and across the UK, Germany, Belgium, Canada, Brazil and Australia. I have curated major exhibitions and am a founding member of WhiteNoise Projects, a collaborative artist initiative based in London.

My work has been published nationally and internationally in  Artmaze Mag, Aesthetica magazine and featured in several blogposts.

I recently exhibited my work in a solo show at One Paved Court in Richmond and for further details and my CV visit my website. 

 

WHY I NEED YOUR SUPPORT 

Being asked to be part of Venice Biennale is every artist's dream and being invited by GAA Foundation is a wonderful opportunity to be a part of this major contemporary art exhibition, which takes place once every two years in Venice, Italy. My work will be shown as part of 'Personal Structures'  for a six-month period from 9 May through to 23 November 2019 with an anticipated audience of  more than half a million.

I need to raise a minimum 15,000 Euro to cover my share of the participation fee. 

Entry to the exhibition will be free to visitors, and I hope many supporters will be able to visit. As a more immediate thank you I have created a selection of rewards. These range from postcards to original paintings made especially for this occasion.

Every donation, no matter how small, is greatly appreciated.

Click here for a video of the 2017 edition of 'Personal Structures'

 

THE IMPACT

The excitement of being offered a chance to exhibit as part of the 2019 Venice Biennale was immediately followed by dread at the prospect of having to raise such a large sum of money, and I was tempted to decline the invitation.

It is never easy to ask for help, especially of the financial kind. But the encouragement I have had from friends and family has been overwhelming and I now feel I would let them all down if I wasn't giving this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity my best shot.

If you know me, or if you follow me on social media you know how passionate I feel about gender disparity in the contemporary art world. While women artists make up the majority of graduates and practicing artists, the proportions are reversed when it comes to exhibitions, commissions or auctions.

Women artists are increasingly recognised for their contributions, often posthumously or well past official retirement age. This is why an important aspect of my campaign is raising awareness for more equality across all ages and genders, with my presence at Venice a small contribution towards closing the gap. 

Please join the conversation on social media and #supportwomenartists
