story:
History-Art-Child Development

We would like to present you two wooden toys that reinterpret the monumental sculptures The Silent Table and The Endless Column made by Constantin Brâncuşi, one of the fathers of modern sculptures. The works, along with The Gate of Kiss and The Chairs Alley, are part of the Sculptural Ensemble from Târgu Jiu / Romania which was commissioned by the National League of Gorj Women to honor the Romanian soldiers of the WWI, yet they are works of art that have nothing militaristic in them. Instead Brâncuşi talks about love, time and space.

These wooden toys bring together “history-art-and child development” as Sarah Airhart, founder and director of West Seattle School Community, described them after introducing them to 3 and 4 year old kids:

«They are climbing, running, singing, playing and engaging each other constantly. We introduced these beautiful blocks as an individual or a 2 person material in a space with a small table with just 1 chair tucked away in the classroom. This kind of space is important to provide, so children can find the solace they still require/desire. Having time to oneself to slow down, think, take a break, reflect, work on something hard or just to sit and doodle or read is important because it provides some balance to the child's busy and sometimes hectic day.

These blocks are the perfect material for such an area because they allow a child to be absorbed into their beauty, their texture, color and multiple opportunities in which they can be used. And while the history of how and why these blocks were made may be slightly lofty for their development they can still appreciate that these blocks are formed because of the inspiration of an artist's work.

We have also printed and posted the picture of the actual statues in the classroom so the children have some perspective for their own work. I love that the children can be introduced to the idea that what they are doing with these blocks is also something an artist and an architect does, it's 'real' work».

Sarah Airhart, founder and director of West Seattle School Community 

Shapes and Colors

We decided not to make exclusive art-objects, but to multiply them in order to reach as many kids and adults as possible. We managed to produce a few sets and with the helpful support of our friends from Magma Gallery/Saint George, it was also possible to organize a workshop with children of all ages which aimed to establish an intimate relationship with Constantin Brâncuşi. We proposed a short biographic presentation of the artist and offered the children the possibility to experience forms and colors and to appropriate these objects by investing them with their creativity.

Why do we need your help

It's been a long way from the first prototype (February 2012) to the final version and, despite of their apparent simplicity, they involve a great deal of energy and time. It also implies an expensive manufacturing process, that for the moment is accomplished in a small rudimentary workshop (including the artist's kitchen and storeroom), with a limited production capacity that also affect the final price.

The Little Table of Silence contains 12 chairs, made out of two easily interchangeable pieces and The Little Endless Column contains a flat support with 15 holes and 15 elements so one can build the column one wishes to have. Right now they are made out of beech-wood, partly mechanical - cutting and drilling and partly manual - multiple stages of hand sanding and polishing for smoothness and exact dimensions. They are manually paint brushed by the artists themselves with great care. We use only kids friendly materials such as water-based non-toxic colors and 100% organic protective lake.

Raising funds would allow us to negotiate a larger production series and to keep on-going a project that receive nothing but positive feedback. We need at least 500 units/order, for each model, in order to to apply for a production process and ease the production costs. We exclude China and instead we will try to find a production line in EU or in US (Or even both).

Also, if we raise enough money we would like to complete the Brâncuşi Series, with a reinterpretation of The Gate of Kiss, in form of The Ring of Kiss– a dental ring for babies.

Our intention is also to organize more workshops and with special discounts for educational institutes, to develop a more consistent pedagogical component.

«Children should be surrounded by the most beautiful of things, pieces of exotic fabric, good coloring pencils, vases of fresh flowers, different textures of wood, marbles etc... they don't have to be expensive nor mechanical but should specifically be touchable.

This way they develop a deep appreciation for the work of an artisan and the materials/mediums they use. Children will take care of this material for many many years and in turn will also see all the beauty the world has to offer. As Froebel described his materials, these are GIFTS and I truly believe they are.»    Sarah Airhart, founder and director of West Seattle School Community

We would like to celebrate thus the original works and the biography of a great artist who only wanted to offer us “pure joy”.

____________________________________________________________________________________

About Constantin Brâncuşi 

(1876-1957 )

There is a large bibliography on Constantin Brâncuşi, hundreds of books, essays and articles written about his life and his work. Also MoMA, Museum of Metropolitan Art, Guggenheim, Tate Modern, Center Georges Pompidou, etc, contain both information about his life and his works. Here we'll present him very briefly.

He was born in a small village in Romania, and like most of the children at that time he didn't have a proper childhood. He started to work at an early age as a shepperd and later on as a carpenter apprentice. Since he had a remarkable talent, with hard work and some help he started to study Arts and Craft in Craiova, and finally, he managed to study the rules of the 19th-century sculpture at the School of Fine Arts in Bucharest. One of his works the “Ecorché”, became very popular in medicine schools around Romania, since it reproduced exactly the muscular parts of the body.

At the age of 28, and after one year of journey (a 1600 miles long distance made almost entirely by foot) he reached Paris where he settled and began his artistic career. For a short period of time, he became one of the August Rodin's alumni, but he leaved his atelier claiming that “at the shade of great trees, nothing grows”.

Even if he had friends among the most popular artists in Paris, he didn’t belong to any cultural trend or “ism”, preferring instead to look and search for his own path, that was basically the “direct carving” in the pursuing of “the essence of things”.

At the top of his career, he was invited in Romania to build what it became the Monumental Ensemble from Târgu Jiu. Later on, communist authorities tried to demolish the Endless Column with the help of a Russian tractor. The Column won.

____________________________________________________________________________________


About us

Minitremu is an Romanian NGO whose purpose is to bring art and understanding of art to a very tangible and accessible dimension for kids.

http://minitremu.tumblr.com/

story:
_________________________________

SEE BELOW AND PERKS SECTION FOR SPECIAL OPPORTUNITY TO BE SCULPTED FOR THE R-EVOLUTION INSTALLATION!

__________________________________________________________________

ARE YOU READY?  

IT'S TIME FOR R-EVOLUTION!

But First a Brief Recap...

Wow what a year we had!  With all of your help, we were able to raise enough money to complete Truth is Beauty and bring her to Burning Man in 2013.  We are so gratified by the response she received on the Playa - even we were amazed at how she looked from different angles, at different times a day, and OH! the light shows - 6 different shows thanks to Ka-Ping Yee, our uber-talented lighting engineer!!  Take a look at fire night here:

 

We felt awe witnessing the impact on people as they read the inscription around her base: "What Would the World be Like if Women Were Safe?"  There was Playa magic when Truth is Beauty replaced the "I" in BELIEVE after it fell down in the pre-event windstorms and when she held a rainbow or the sun.  There were the hundreds of people who stopped us to tell us their own personal stories of how they were affected when they saw her, and thousands who wrote their feelings and opinions down in the books we provided.  We handed out nearly 10,000 "Together We Stand" wristbands, calling on those who wore them to take active responsibility for the safety of their sisters; each a unique opportunity for a personal connection and conversation.  It was such a success, we are working on how to bring this campaign to the wider world!

Here is one of our favorite photos from the night of our event:

 

Thank you...Thank you...Thank You...for opening your hearts and minds to the messenger and the meaning!!

  

 What's Next?

 

 

I have started work on R-Evolution, the third sculpture in the Bliss Project series.  I recently finished the 15 foot clay sculpture  - the first stage in the process - and plan to start the mold to cast the pieces from which the steel structure will be built in the next week or so.

Our plan is to debut her at Burning Man 2015.  Why not this year?  These sculptures take thousands of hours to build and cost hundreds of thousands of dollars.  It simply cannot be done in one year.  So, we embark on another two-year build, but we really need your help because we not only need time, we need funds as well!  Through a combination of this campaign, grants and generous individual donors and foundations we hope to be able to raise all of the money we need this year to get R-Evolution where she needs to be so that we can complete her in time for her planned debut.

To meet our goal, we will need to have her torso and calves complete by August.  To do this, we need to be able to purchase the steel, and all of the ancillary welding materials as well as the rust-treatment on these pieces.  Of course we will also have to cover operating costs such as rent, utilities, insurance, certified welders, engineering and labor for those who will be working full-time.

What is R-Evolution?

Another collaboration with Deja Solis , R-Evolution is different than Bliss Dance and Truth is Beauty. There is no overt action in her expression; she is not dancing in the face of danger, she is not reaching to meet herself and find her own truth.  In R-Evolution, Deja explores and expresses what she feels like when she can just be...a whole person... a woman, radiating her energy into the world. 

As this energy radiates from R-Evolution, we plan to reinforce and sustain it with the help from some of our sisters.  I plan to sculpt ten women of all different shapes, sizes, ethnicities, etc., in the R-Evolution pose (lifesize sketches) over the coming year and a half.  These sculptures will be cast in plaster to be displayed with R-Evolution at Burning Man and beyond.  Right here, right now we are offering the very first opportunity to be a part of R-Evolution as a perk for donation to this Indiegogo campaign.  If you are interested, please see perks for more information on this opportunity.

Of course, this won't solve everything, but we think a world where women are free to just be is an essential first step.  It's R-Evolution it's...

                     What the world will be like when women are safe.


My Inspiration

The story of R-Evolution and The Bliss Project began when I was 7-years old and my best friend was a 9-year old little girl.  One day I was told, in way too much detail for a little boy, that she had been raped right outside of my house.  It was incomprehensible, horrible, I never forgot, I never understood...it still haunts me.  I thought...that man couldn't have realized my friend was a person...if he really could see her, this wouldn't have happened.

I grew up in the Bay Area in the 60's and 70's, in the philosophical revolution and turbulence of those times.  I learned to deeply appreciate feminine energy, influence and strength…and realized that the objectification of women imprisoned women and also men.  I also saw first-hand that one person, or a small group of people, can start a movement that can make a difference and change the course of history.

In my 20s I discovered sculpting, and in particular, the joy of seeing and then sculpting women; of the healing energy and power that I saw when women were not afraid...when they could be present, when they could be themselves, speak their minds...and the heroism it takes to do this in the face of real danger in their daily lives.  For more than 25 years I have been sculpting women.  At first glance, they appear to be classical figurative nudes, but they are not.  They are radically modern...revolutionary.  These women are safe, present. Look at them. They have chosen their own expression, so you will see the actual woman, the person, her energy and spirit.  It is my intent that these sculptures exude this healing energy and inspire us to take action; to finally say enough is enough.

Watch this video about the Bliss Project:

The Bottom Line

Art can illuminate the human condition and be a catalyst to social change ...My hope is to expand human consciousness and inspire men and women to take action to end violence against women, beginning a healing process that will make room for women’s voices, thus allowing all of us to live fully and thrive! I am asking you to stand with us!

Thank you to everyone for the incredible support you have provided in the past, and to everyone who is considering supporting R-Evolution. There is just no way projects like this could happen without you!

Marco and the Bliss Dance Crew

Please Join Us in Making R-evolution a Reality, Donate Now, Spread the Word!

P.S.  We have some great perks, including pendants, mini-sculptures  - 6 inch versions - experiences., etc.  Plus, everyone get's a Together We Stand Wristband.  Check it out!

P.P.S We can't resist sharing a photo of Bliss Dance!  Visit her now on Treasure Island, San Francisco ; )
story_txt:
_________________________________SEE BELOW AND PERKS SECTION FOR SPECIAL OPPORTUNITY TO BE SCULPTED FOR THE R-EVOLUTION INSTALLATION!__________________________________________________________________ARE YOU READY?  IT'S TIME FOR R-EVOLUTION!But First a Brief Recap...Wow what a year we had!  With all of your help, we were able to raise enough money to complete Truth is Beauty and bring her to Burning Man in 2013.  We are so gratified by the response she received on the Playa - even we were amazed at how she looked from different angles, at different times a day, and OH! the light shows - 6 different shows thanks to Ka-Ping Yee, our uber-talented lighting engineer!!  Take a look at fire night here: We felt awe witnessing the impact on people as they read the inscription around her base: "What Would the World be Like if Women Were Safe?"  There was Playa magic when Truth is Beauty replaced the "I" in BELIEVE after it fell down in the pre-event windstorms and when she held a rainbow or the sun.  There were the hundreds of people who stopped us to tell us their own personal stories of how they were affected when they saw her, and thousands who wrote their feelings and opinions down in the books we provided.  We handed out nearly 10,000 "Together We Stand" wristbands, calling on those who wore them to take active responsibility for the safety of their sisters; each a unique opportunity for a personal connection and conversation.  It was such a success, we are working on how to bring this campaign to the wider world!Here is one of our favorite photos from the night of our event: Thank you...Thank you...Thank You...for opening your hearts and minds to the messenger and the meaning!!   What's Next?   I have started work on R-Evolution, the third sculpture in the Bliss Project series.  I recently finished the 15 foot clay sculpture  - the first stage in the process - and plan to start the mold to cast the pieces from which the steel structure will be built in the next week or so.Our plan is to debut her at Burning Man 2015.  Why not this year?  These sculptures take thousands of hours to build and cost hundreds of thousands of dollars.  It simply cannot be done in one year.  So, we embark on another two-year build, but we really need your help because we not only need time, we need funds as well!  Through a combination of this campaign, grants and generous individual donors and foundations we hope to be able to raise all of the money we need this year to get R-Evolution where she needs to be so that we can complete her in time for her planned debut.To meet our goal, we will need to have her torso and calves complete by August.  To do this, we need to be able to purchase the steel, and all of the ancillary welding materials as well as the rust-treatment on these pieces.  Of course we will also have to cover operating costs such as rent, utilities, insurance, certified welders, engineering and labor for those who will be working full-time.What is R-Evolution?Another collaboration with Deja Solis , R-Evolution is different than Bliss Dance and Truth is Beauty. There is no overt action in her expression; she is not dancing in the face of danger, she is not reaching to meet herself and find her own truth.  In R-Evolution, Deja explores and expresses what she feels like when she can just be...a whole person... a woman, radiating her energy into the world.  

As this energy radiates from R-Evolution, we plan to
reinforce and sustain it with the help from some of our sisters.  I plan to sculpt ten women of all
different shapes, sizes, ethnicities, etc., in the R-Evolution pose (lifesize
sketches) over the coming year and a half. 
These sculptures will be cast in plaster to be displayed with
R-Evolution at Burning Man and beyond. 
Right here, right now we are offering the very first opportunity to be a
part of R-Evolution as a perk for donation to this Indiegogo campaign.  If you are interested, please see perks for
more information on this opportunity.

Of course, this won't solve everything, but we think a world where women are free to just be is an essential first step.  It's R-Evolution it's...                     What the world will be like when women are safe.

My InspirationThe story of R-Evolution and The Bliss Project began when I was 7-years old and my best friend was a 9-year old little girl.  One day I was told, in way too much detail for a little boy, that she had been raped right outside of my house.  It was incomprehensible, horrible, I never forgot, I never understood...it still haunts me.  I thought...that man couldn't have realized my friend was a person...if he really could see her, this wouldn't have happened.I grew up in the Bay Area in the 60's and 70's, in the philosophical revolution and turbulence of those times.  I learned to deeply appreciate feminine energy, influence and strength…and realized that the objectification of women imprisoned women and also men.  I also saw first-hand that one person, or a small group of people, can start a movement that can make a difference and change the course of history.In my 20s I discovered sculpting, and in particular, the joy of seeing and then sculpting women; of the healing energy and power that I saw when women were not afraid...when they could be present, when they could be themselves, speak their minds...and the heroism it takes to do this in the face of real danger in their daily lives.  For more than 25 years I have been sculpting women.  At first glance, they appear to be classical figurative nudes, but they are not.  They are radically modern...revolutionary.  These women are safe, present. Look at them. They have chosen their own expression, so you will see the actual woman, the person, her energy and spirit.  It is my intent that these sculptures exude this healing energy and inspire us to take action; to finally say enough is enough.Watch this video about the Bliss Project: The Bottom LineArt can illuminate the human condition and be a catalyst to social change ...My hope is to expand human consciousness and inspire men and women to take action to end violence against women, beginning a healing process that will make room for women’s voices, thus allowing all of us to live fully and thrive! I am asking you to stand with us!Thank you to everyone for the incredible support you have provided in the past, and to everyone who is considering supporting R-Evolution. There is just no way projects like this could happen without you!Marco and the Bliss Dance CrewPlease Join Us in Making R-evolution a Reality, Donate Now, Spread the Word! story:
Jaume I is an entirely crowdfunded, noncommercial, multi-curatorial popup micro-space for the furthering of visual, sound, performing arts and film on the fringes of experimentation. 

Jaume I is a limited space with unlimited options. It will begin with a handful of curators, one or more performances per week and weekly gallery hours to host a diverse program of visual and sound art exhibitions. 

Funding is needed for 4 months rent, utilities and liability insurance. 
Exhibitions at the space will run in a standard DIY fashion.  All door money collected at concerts will go towards the artists.  Collections from screenings will go towards concessions (coffee, tea, snacks) available at the space for free during gallery hours.  Visual artists will receive 100% of revenue from paintings sold. 

If the space is properly funded it will run May 15 - September 15, 2016. Any additional funding acquired will be used to keep the space open longer. We hope YOU will support Jaume I !

story:
Stick your neck out for this giraffe.

Join our efforts to support the restoration of an American folk art masterpiece.

What is this piece of art?

Felipe Archuleta created this giraffe in December, 1973. It is one of his first large scale exotic animals. It was donated to the Museum of International Folk Arts collection by Atrium Orbis Gallery Corporation of Santa Fe in 1973, and has since brought smiles to thousands of museum visitors.

Who is Felipe Archuleta?
(From the Smithsonian American Art Museum)

Felipe Archuleta, who spent most of his life in Tesuque, New Mexico, worked as a carpenter for over thirty years. In 1967, unable to find work, he prayed to God to alleviate his poverty and desperation. His subsequent religious awakening led to his work as a carver of animals, for which he has been justly celebrated.

Felipe Archuleta made his sculptures out of wood and other materials he found himself or obtains from his neighbors. His first sculptures depicted those animals he knew best—sheep, rabbits, burros, and cats. He soon began to make larger, sometimes life-size, animal sculptures, expanding his repertoire to include giraffes, elephants, monkeys, and others based on pictures he found in children's books and natural history magazines.

How will my donation help bring back the giraffe?

Now, more than forty years after the giraffe’s creation, the wear and tear of exhibitions and travel have left their mark on this important sculpture. In conjunction with the Museum of New Mexico Foundation, the Museum of International Folk Art is raising funds to assemble a team of eminent conservators and to consult with Felipe Archuleta’s descendants, including sculptor Ron Archuleta Rodríguez, so that our giraffe can stand tall again. With your help, we can fund the restoration of this cultural treasure.

Where is the rest of it?

When the giraffe was built, Archuleta purposely crafted the piece in two parts for easier transportation. As time brought wear and tear to this piece, the base of the giraffe was no longer sturdy for it to stand tall in the museum. Right now, the giraffe is outside the to the Wooden Menagerie exhibit, showcasing many various pieces of Archuleta’s work.

story:
EL RESIDENCIAL 2014: September 9 - 19th, 2014

Location: patio taller - Carolina, PR

Participating Artists:

Ching-In Chen (Wisconsin)

Christoff Colón (Puerto Rico/Springfield)

Jomary Ortega (Puerto Rico)

Valincy-Jean Patelli (New York)

Vreni Michelini Castillo (Mexico/California) 

Zuleira Soto- Román (Puerto Rico)


El Residencial (The Residency) is a 10 day residency for local and international self-directed artists. The goal is to provide artists with an optimal space with resources for research, creativity and the opportunity to produce individual creative proposals while engaging in a cultural and creative exchange.

El Residencial provides a communal home, workshop space, a yard of approximately 700 meters with fruit trees and garden and the opportunity to share with local and international artists while coexisting with the community of San Antón (Carolina, PR). This neighborhood is surrounded by: water springs, edible tropical fruit trees, garden and a diverse community. During the residency we hope that each artist will focus on their own practice while flowing with what the space and community has to offer. We believe that we are our best teachers, so we strongly encourage the exchange of tools, techniques and methodologies for creating artistic work with participating artists and community members of San Anton. The artists will also have the opportunity to share their work and also participate in cultural events that will be happening in Puerto Rico during the time of the residency.

During last year’s residency, El Residencial 2013, we had the opportunity to share and create with the following artists: Sunny Drake (Australia-Canada), Nisha Ahuja (Canada), Roxanna Vahed (Rep. Dom.-Canada), Awilda Rodríguez Lora, Lydela Leonor y Michelle Nonó (Puerto Rico). From that process the following projects where conceived: Manual del Bestiario Doméstico de Las Nietas de Nonó and  La Mujer Maravilla de Awilda Rodriguez Lora. 

Patio Taller is a creative space for artist and community members to meet and share located in the neighborhood of San Anton, Carolina. Nonó’s granddaughters opened the space so it can become a meeting place for members of the community of San Anton. It is a place where the artist and the community can create and exchange while embracing sustainability and solidarity.

The vision of Patio Taller is to promote a social/cultural exchange between community members and artist by having conversations, workshops, residencies and a creative practice that allows for an exchange of skills, stories and art. The space is open for artist that are already active in the community of San Anton and  artists in the island and abroad. www.patiotaller.org

What We Need & What You Get

This is an independent project that is funded by each individual artist with the support of some local business.

Each artist will be covering their traveling expenses, food and transportation, patio taller will support with lodging, spaces/events for creating and exchanging work.

Our funding goal of $2,000 which will support the artists and patio taller with the cost of hosting the residency. Our estimated budget is a total of $3,015. This budget does not include production and services fees that are being donated by the artists and patio taller.

The Impact

- Artistic and Cultural Exchange as a way of building support and a network for artists in Puerto Rico and abroad

- Exchange of skills and methodologies for the exploration and creation of artistic work.

- Community Conversations to learn from each other: How we are supporting our artistry in Puerto Rico and abroad? We have already to open events scheduled for the general public.

- Create and support a community/network of artists that are using their creative practice as a tool for social justice in their community and abroad.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can tell your friends, family and the world.

Patio taller is a non-profit organization that works all year round providing workshops, services and space to members of the community in San Anton Carolina and are always grateful of any support you or your organization can provide.

story:
Short Summary

The mere thought of being able to ride a bicycle made from such an unlikely material immediately filled me with excitement and enthusiasm.

Despite the fact that wood is less rigid than metal, with proper treatment it may be used in bicycle frames. Combining different types of wood and composites relative stiffness or smoothness can be achieved. 

Before achieving this result, I've tested different types of frames (completely made from plywood, partly made from plywood) and focused on this type of frame, because it includes both: rigid construction and aesthetic appearance.

What We Need & What You Get

After making calculations I've concluded the amount of founding - 7000 Euro. The amount comprises from:

* purchase of wood turning lathe;

* purchase of tools;

* lease of premises for first three months;

* purchase of materials for the manufacture of the first set of bikes;

The Impact

Replacing metal by wood in parts of bicycle frame which are not subjected to high loads makes bicycle more eco-friendly. Also I'm planning to produce stylish bicycle accessories.

story:
SHADOWMANN/AN ART OPERA


Shadowmann | An Art Opera employs an unusual synergy of visual arts, music, dance, theatre and film in creating a new form. Though not an opera in the ordinary sense, the work follows main character Eric Shadowmann (fictional), rise from obscurity to international art star. His journey creates the context for a multi-faceted exploration of the shadow and it's potential for transformation.  

MORE:

1. Shadowmann | An Art Opera is an artistic exploration of the shadows which haunt. The work will pull no punches in it's examination of the dark side of our nature.  At the same time it cultivates an ongoing belief in beauty. It is about the ability to transform and the constant course of light which pulls us there.

2. It is an allegorical journey through the life of our main character Eric Shadowman.  The exhibit will be presented as a retrospective of Shadowmann's work through a series of 5 rooms, reflecting upon his journey and the subject at hand. The piece also presents an abstracted, audio/visual construct, incorporating multiple art forms into an unusually rendered, sometimes performative environment.

3. There will be live performers integrated into the installation. They will include two singers, one shadow dancer and an acrobat.  One of the main components of Shadowmann is that the music contributes to the experience of the visual art.  The other performers lend a purposeful context, as well as lines of abstraction.  Viewers will experience the exhibit in daily performances, with everything at hand, including the viewers, forming that experience. The exhibit has also been designed to exist outside of performances, standing as a modular installation with it's own particular logic and ouvre.

4. Speaking to the particular synergy of artistic disciplines which encompasses this work, Shadowmann will also represent an abstraction of the energy createad between those disciplines.  It will reveal, through a series of artistic devices, the palpable connections which exist in invisible spaces. 

5. The installation will be concerned with original invention at every turn, sometimes combining the languages of multiple disciplines in rapid progression to convey a point; or set the stage for extended moments of contemplative viewing.  Eric Shadowmann's work evolves from his dark and seminal Flourescent Series I (1979),  to his late life explorations via his "Unified Field Theory of Art and Music."  Along the way work will include imaginative, multimedia sculpture like, "The Fun House."  A 60‘ stainless steel construction, which will exist at angles, just large enough in its interior to allow one person to pass through. The interior will reflect a very different experience, mirrored in sculptural constructions, echoing a ‘house of horrors' typical of Mexican traveling carnivals of the late 70's and early 80's. 

SHADOWMANN/AN ART OPERA will be created by myself and a few extraordinary collaborators.  Past collaborators have included artists as varied as Kiki Smith, Terry Allen, George Romero, Bill Frisell and Ed Harris. The exhibition will reflect not only Eric Shadowmann's personal journey, but the significant impact he had on the art world during the course of his career. 

Shadowmann | An Art Opera is intended to premiere in either Autumn 2015, or Spring 2016.

There are WONDERFUL PERKS offered for your support!

I intend to create a work which will offer a new experience for the 21st century. It want to give this work to delight and inspire, from my soul to yours. 

Thank you,

Donald Rubinstein

What we have accomplished thus far 

1.  A new art form.

2. Created over 130 works of visual art, some of which will be seen in my upcoming one-person exhibition in Santa Fe, NM. 

3. Written and recorded basic tracks for 7 new songs.

4.  I am composing a new operatic, musical composition, which will include creative re-imaginings from my score to the feature film, “Martin.” (One of the top one hundred coolest film scores of all time” Mojo). 

5.  A room by room synopsis is in process.

6.  Conceived plans for three unique, large-scale, multimedia sculptures, with drawings in process. 

7.  A  computer rendering of the entire installation.

7. In talks with some very exciting collaborators and finalizing commitments.

We are less than one year away from making Shadowmann | An Art Opera, a sparkling reality.  Please support us.  This work will reflect not only my own dreams, but I intend yours as well.  

Thank you very much,

Donald Rubinstein

See additional images drawn from SHADOWMANN,

http://donaldrubinsteinart.com

MUSIC

SHADOWMANN's music is in part a re-imagining of excerpts from my 1977 score for George Romero’s “Martin,” including improvisations and cracked off bits of the recorded score.  That music will be combined with a new set of original songs, two of which I am including here in the form of basic, unmastered tracks.

Please find links to the songs, as well as the original main theme from “Martin” below. 

Little Boy, Little Man https://soundcloud.com/drdonaldrubinsteincom/little-boy-little-man-copyright-2014-donald-rubinstein

Martin https://soundcloud.com/drdonaldrubinsteincom/shadowmann-aka-martin-copyright-1977-donald-rubinstein

The Famous Singer https://soundcloud.com/drdonaldrubinsteincom/the-famous-singer

________

I have been working full-time on SHADOWMANN for over a year, though it’s concepts have been at the root of my artistic exploration  for over thirty.  I am  creating what I believe will be a compelling experience for both art, theater and opera patrons alike.  If you are unfamiliar with my work please refer to the website’s bio/press link and Wikipedia page, below.  

http://donaldrubinstein.com/still/bio/   

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Rubinstein

Thank you for your vision and support.

Donald Rubinstein

Santa Fe, New Mexico

July 4, 2014


HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE USED


1. To complete a series of art works for my upcoming, one-person exhibit at Cloud 5 Project in Santa Fe, NM.  This work represents an integral step in the complex visual components of SHADOWMANN.

2. The completion of plans for three newly conceived, multimedia sculptures.

3. A written synopsis and computer modeling of the entire, four room, installation. 

4. We are finalizing commitments from a few key collaborators. An investment prospectus will be completed and offered to waiting investors by January, 2015. 

SHADOWMANN’s third and final funding phase will be completed in partnership with a museum or art space, investors and a fiscal partnership with a yet to be designated non-profit.  The response thus far has been VERY encouraging.  I have worked on my own for over a year, as well as via the generous support of The Robert Rauschenberg Foundation, where as a resident fellow in February/March 2014, The Art Opera revealed itself.  

Will it happen without your support?  Yes, it will.  I will make it happen in some manner of form, no matter what. However, with your support it will be shared with a joy and largess that will create a vision for our time, and one to be reckoned with. 

Thank you for your vision, faith, and support. 

True appreciation,

Donald Rubinstein

All Images and text by Donald Rubinstein,except where noted.  May not be reproduced without permission.  Copyright 2014 Donald Rubinstein. 


PERKS

That first picture I took at The Whitney, He became Eric Shadowmann's dad, Alex Finermann, pictured here in 1952, the year Eric was born.

story_txt:
SHADOWMANN/AN ART OPERAShadowmann | An Art Opera employs an unusual synergy of visual arts, music, dance, theatre and film in creating a new form. Though not an opera in the ordinary sense, the work follows main character Eric Shadowmann (fictional), rise from obscurity to international art star. His journey creates the context for a multi-faceted exploration of the shadow and it's potential for transformation.  MORE:
1. Shadowmann | An Art Opera is an artistic exploration of the shadows which haunt. The work will pull no punches in it's examination of the dark side of our nature.  At the same time it cultivates an ongoing belief in beauty. It is about the ability to transform and the constant course of light which pulls us there.
2. It is an allegorical journey through the life of our main character Eric Shadowman.  The exhibit will be presented as a retrospective of Shadowmann's work through a series of 5 rooms, reflecting upon his journey and the subject at hand. The piece also presents an abstracted, audio/visual construct, incorporating multiple art forms into an unusually rendered, sometimes performative environment.
3. There will be live performers integrated into the installation. They will include two singers, one shadow dancer and an acrobat.  One of the main components of Shadowmann is that the music contributes to the experience of the visual art.  The other performers lend a purposeful context, as well as lines of abstraction.  Viewers will experience the exhibit in daily performances, with everything at hand, including the viewers, forming that experience. The exhibit has also been designed to exist outside of performances, standing as a modular installation with it's own particular logic and ouvre.
4. Speaking to the particular synergy of artistic disciplines which encompasses this work, Shadowmann will also represent an abstraction of the energy createad between those disciplines.  It will reveal, through a series of artistic devices, the palpable connections which exist in invisible spaces. 
5. The installation will be concerned with original invention at every turn, sometimes combining the languages of multiple disciplines in rapid progression to convey a point; or set the stage for extended moments of contemplative viewing.  Eric Shadowmann's work evolves from his dark and seminal Flourescent Series I (1979),  to his late life explorations via his "Unified Field Theory of Art and Music."  Along the way work will include imaginative, multimedia sculpture like, "The Fun House."  A 60‘ stainless steel construction, which will exist at angles, just large enough in its interior to allow one person to pass through. The interior will reflect a very different experience, mirrored in sculptural constructions, echoing a ‘house of horrors' typical of Mexican traveling carnivals of the late 70's and early 80's. 
SHADOWMANN/AN ART OPERA will be created by myself and a few extraordinary collaborators.  Past collaborators have included artists as varied as Kiki Smith, Terry Allen, George Romero, Bill Frisell and Ed Harris. The exhibition will reflect not only Eric Shadowmann's personal journey, but the significant impact he had on the art world during the course of his career. 
Shadowmann | An Art Opera is intended to premiere in either Autumn 2015, or Spring 2016.
There are WONDERFUL PERKS offered for your support!
I intend to create a work which will offer a new experience for the 21st century. It want to give this work to delight and inspire, from my soul to yours. Thank you,
Donald Rubinstein
What we have accomplished thus far 
1.  A new art form.
2. Created over 130 works of visual art, some of which will be seen in my upcoming one-person exhibition in Santa Fe, NM. 
3. Written and recorded basic tracks for 7 new songs.
4.  I am composing a new operatic, musical composition, which will include creative re-imaginings from my score to the feature film, “Martin.” (One of the top one hundred coolest film scores of all time” Mojo). 
5.  A room by room synopsis is in process.
6.  Conceived plans for three unique, large-scale, multimedia sculptures, with drawings in process. 
7.  A  computer rendering of the entire installation.
7. In talks with some very exciting collaborators and finalizing commitments.
We are less than one year away from making Shadowmann | An Art Opera, a sparkling reality.  Please support us.  This work will reflect not only my own dreams, but I intend yours as well.  
Thank you very much,
Donald RubinsteinSee additional images drawn from SHADOWMANN,http://donaldrubinsteinart.comMUSIC
SHADOWMANN's music is in part a re-imagining of excerpts from my 1977 score for George Romero’s “Martin,” including improvisations and cracked off bits of the recorded score.  That music will be combined with a new set of original songs, two of which I am including here in the form of basic, unmastered tracks.
Please find links to the songs, as well as the original main theme from “Martin” below. 
Little Boy, Little Man https://soundcloud.com/drdonaldrubinsteincom/little-boy-little-man-copyright-2014-donald-rubinstein
Martin https://soundcloud.com/drdonaldrubinsteincom/shadowmann-aka-martin-copyright-1977-donald-rubinstein
The Famous Singer https://soundcloud.com/drdonaldrubinsteincom/the-famous-singer________
I have been working full-time on SHADOWMANN for over a year, though it’s concepts have been at the root of my artistic exploration  for over thirty.  I am  creating what I believe will be a compelling experience for both art, theater and opera patrons alike.  If you are unfamiliar with my work please refer to the website’s bio/press link and Wikipedia page, below.  
http://donaldrubinstein.com/still/bio/   
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_RubinsteinThank you for your vision and support.
Donald Rubinstein
Santa Fe, New Mexico
July 4, 2014HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL BE USED1. To complete a series of art works for my upcoming, one-person exhibit at Cloud 5 Project in Santa Fe, NM.  This work represents an integral step in the complex visual components of SHADOWMANN.
2. The completion of plans for three newly conceived, multimedia sculptures.
3. A written synopsis and computer modeling of the entire, four room, installation. 4. We are finalizing commitments from a few key collaborators. An investment prospectus will be completed and offered to waiting investors by January, 2015. SHADOWMANN’s third and final funding phase will be completed in partnership with a museum or art space, investors and a fiscal partnership with a yet to be designated non-profit.  The response thus far has been VERY encouraging.  I have worked on my own for over a year, as well as via the generous support of The Robert Rauschenberg Foundation, where as a resident fellow in February/March 2014, The Art Opera revealed itself.  Will it happen without your support?  Yes, it will.  I will make it happen in some manner of form, no matter what. However, with your support it will be shared with a joy and largess that will create a vision for our time, and one to be reckoned with. Thank you for your vision, faith, and support. 
True appreciation,
Donald RubinsteinAll Images and text by Donald Rubinstein,except where noted.  May not be reproduced without permission.  Copyright 2014 Donald Rubinstein. PERKSThat first picture I took at The Whitney, He became Eric Shadowmann's dad, Alex Finermann, pictured here in 1952, the year Eric was born.____5 x 7's, luck of the drawrain___Martin _____The T Shirt_____Jokes by E. Shadowmann (choose one)Best DrawingDolphin Gone BadVaporvilleSinatra________Waiting Room_______Knightriders_________Time Again (Donald Rubinstein/Bill Frisell)When She Kisses The Ship On His ArmUntitled from the Portfolio Seed (Donald Rubinstein/Kiki Smith)Untitled from the portfolio SEED  (2003) (Donald Rubinstein/Kiki Smith)Untitled from the portfolio SEED  (2003) (Donald Rubinstein/Kiki Smith)

story:
With the HEADTOOTH Pro, we’ve eliminated the inconveniences such as unstable connections, poor sound quality, and restricted range that come with other wireless helmet communication devices.

Use the HEADTOOTH Pro during your next adventure and enjoy uninterrupted connections, crystal clear surround sound audio thanks to the 2 HiFi HD Speakers & Vibration Woofer speaker, and a long distance connectivity range of up to 3.1mi(5km).

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The MUC (Multilateral Frequency Used Communication System) is a system built on the well known communication technology behind walkie-talkies. Compared to the Node(B/T) Network which is typically used in other helmet communication devices, the MUC system allows for uninterrupted long range communication from 1.2mi(2km) up to 3.1mi(5km).

Best of all, we’ve made sure that an unlimited number of users can be active in the group call without having to go through a complicated pairing process.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The MUC is an area-based system of communication with a strong connection levels regardless of the number of users.

On the other hand, with Node (B/T) Network, the larger the distance between each user, the more unstable the connection.

 

 

 

 

Because the MUC system uses UHF (Ultra High Frequency), long distance communication of up to 3.1mi(5km) is possible with a minimum of two users.

 

 

 

The MUC system is less susceptible to distortion or interference from environmental obstacles so that strong connections can be upheld even in dense urban areas.

 

 

 

 

 

 

The HEADTOOTH Pro isn’t limited to just motorcycle enthusiasts. Whether you’re cycling, snowboarding, skiing, ATV riding, the HEADTOOTH Pro will take care of all of your communication needs.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The HEADTOOTH Pro has been designed to be both dustproof AND waterproof so that you can consistently have high levels of communication in rain, snow, mud, or sunshine.

And with the high-quality surround audio and group communication function that is offered in the HEADTOOTH Pro, you can enjoy any outdoor activity solo or with multiple people.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Maximize the benefits that come with the UHF wavelength that allows for maximum communication range. Stay in touch with your fellow riders and other athletes for up to 3.1mi(5km).

 

 

 

MUC systems are highly resistant to distortion or interference from external radio waves. We conducted a Field Stress Test at a busy downtown intersection and discovered that while B/T intercom devices were only able to maintain a stable connection up to 0.3mi(500m), our HEADTOOTH Pro was able to up that to 1.2mi(2km).

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The FREE LICENSE frequency that is available in each established country allowed us to create a commssystem that lets people to hop in or out of group calls without having to go through a pairing process. As long as the channels between each user are the same, group communication is possible for an unlimited number of users within the given range. If someone from your group happens to roam outside of the range, they can simply pop in back into the group automatically when they do enter the given range.

 

 

Regardless of the numbers of users in a group call, the stability of the connection will not be compromised thanks to the MUC system that is built into each HEADTOOTH Pro.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The HEADTOOTH Pro comes with a built-in vibration woofer speaker that utilizes bone conduction technology for richer bass sounds. The 2 slim HD speakers allow you to enjoy fantastic surround sound audio with detailed acoustics for an unrivaled audio experience.

 

 

 

A wide selection of equalizer settings allow you to enjoy your audio in an optimized sound environment based on your music tastes.

 

 

 

 

Each HEADTOOTH Pro also has a built-in noise cancellation chip that blocks out ambient sounds so that it picks up only your voice. Your fellow riders will thank you for the clear comms.

 

Different helmet types require different types of mics which is why two mics are included with a single HEADTOOTH Pro. Select and attach the appropriate mic that fits your helmet.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Attach the remote control to your bike handle, ski pole, wrist, bag strap, or any other accessory with the included Velcro band. Now you can customize the placement of the remote to control the HEADTOOTH Pro the way you want to.

 

The remote controller showcases a simple and intuitive design that makes device control an absolute breeze.

 

 

 

 

Pair the HEADTOOTH Pro with your phone and speak into the mic to get started with any voice recognition assistant like Siri, Google Assistant, Bixby and other Voice assistant service! This gives you even a greater level of safety while still being able to control your phone.

 

 

 

 

 

 

While the HEADTOOTH Pro features the MUC system, it also supports the widely used B/T intercom system. This means that you can still hold group calls with people who use other helmet communication devices as long as the same settings are selected.

(*Some devices may not support B/T intercom connection with third-party products)

 

 

 

 

Since the MUC system was designed based on the walkie-talkie’s PTT technology, communication with other walkie-talkie like devices is also possible. Communicate easily with HEADTOOTH Pro in designated areas where radio is required.

 

 

 

The HEADTOOTH Pro which also operates similarly to push-to-talk (PTT) functions makes it compatible with commercially available PPT apps as well! Enjoy communicating with people from all around the world with this function.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If you remove the main HEADTOOTH Pro unit, it can be used as a portable Vibration speaker so that you can enjoy your music anytime, anywhere.

 

 

 

We’ve also developed an app that will allow users to conveniently operate the HEADTOOTH Pro and control all of the device functions such as the MUC comms system, B/T Intercom comms,  sound equalizer settings, vibration woofer on/off functions, and switching between radio frequencies.

 

 

 

The 1000mAh battery allows HEADTOOTH Pro users to play music continuously for up to 10 hours when fully charged. It also comes with a C-Type port and cable so that you can charge it anytime, anywhere.

 

 

 

 

 

 

The HEADTOOTH Pro can be easily attached or detached from not only bike helmets, but also various types of helmets for other activities such as skiing, snowboarding, cycling, and more. Try using the group call function while enjoying any outdoor activity of your choice!

 

 

 

1. Assemble the parts 

 

2. Mount the HEADTOOTH Pro

 

3. Mount the speakers

 

4-1. Mount the microphone(wired)

 

4-2. Mount the microphone(Boom)

 

 

5. Wire connection and cleanup 

 

 
 
 
 
 
 

 

The actual device itself also contains several buttons that allow you to directly control the HEADTOOTH Pro. Each button has been placed so that it feels intuitive to the user.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Yeil Electronics is a company that specializes in the development of more than 100 original technologies that utilize vibration features. 

We have been creating various wearable devices that have been equipped with bone conduction elements and have also created the vibration motors that have been installed in Samsung Electronics smartphones. 

 

Based on our company's 15 years of experience in vibration technology, we created the 'HEADTOOTH Pro' to create a rich, harmonizing balance of effects between the Vibration Woofer and the 2 HD Slim Speakers.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Product design is typically biased towards engineering efficiency which makes it difficult at times to satisfy the needs of the user. To overcome this, we collaborated with a product design company to come up with a beautiful design that also highlights engineering efficiency and a user intuitive interface.

 

Since then, we’ve continued to discover how we can make the HEADTOOTH Pro more easy and fun to use so that each user can enjoy the absolute best audio quality. Through different rounds of adjustments, we’ve at times almost started again from scratch. '

story:
*O1 Series product experience night event!
 

*Fresh unboxing from our CPO Will Wang!

 
*How O1 keeps you company at home
 

*Reviews from Tech Youtubers! 

*Check how O1 empowers virtual learning

 

User Generated Content:

Enjoy a true cinematic experience at home. Get a bigger screen and better view with JMGO O1 Pro. Thanks to the ultra-short throw design, this FHD 4k compatible projector provides a massive 70” to 110” screen size when placed just 9 inches away from the wall or projection surface. Set JMGO O1 Pro on the tabletop and enjoy your favorite TV shows, sports & games bigger than ever! 

With JMGO O1 Pro, you will no longer suffer the casting shadows when walking across anymore. Get a smooth and uninterrupted view with JMGO O1 Pro.


 

With JMGO O1 Pro, large distances are not required to enjoy a stunning big-screen experience so it can be used anywhere. Co-engineered with Leica, the world’s premium manufacturer of cameras and sports optics, together elevates the home cinema experience with Full High Definition (FHD) at 1920x1080P resolution, dynamic contrast ratio up to 6000:1 and enhanced brightness to 1400ANSI for sharp and vivid multimedia that redefines your home cinema experience.  

JMGO O1 Pro’s 110’’ giant screen delivers the wide color gamut as Laser TV,  displaying a cinema-like picture full vibrant colors that provides more true-to-life images from the LED light source.

 

JMGO 01 Pro is powered by a MediaTek MT9669 chip, the current top-of-the-line flagship chip in the smart TV and projection industry. This advanced chip lets JMGO O1 Pro realize intelligent noise reduction while supporting high dynamic range imaging and motion compensation.  Fast-moving images are always smooth and clear with JMGO O1 Pro for incredible detail.

Get cinematic stereo sound to match the stunning display. Co-created with the leading producer of loudspeakers - Dynaudio, the specially tuned and enhanced audio is powerful, immersive and surrounds you with stereo sound.

Wall Color Calibration

JMGO O1 Pro is a pioneer in wall color calibration, which allows automatic adaptation to display color and brightness settings in real-time. No matter what level of ambient lighting, it accurately displays colors for optimal viewing.  

Zero Perception Intelligent System & Super-Fast Picture Correction

JMGO O1 Pro has a powerful three-dimensional space perception ability, thanks to a multi-point TOF sensor. Equipped with the self-developed Zero Perception Intelligent System, it will perform Auto Keystone Correction to adjust display shape and use its Auto-Focus Algorithm to instantly and subtly correct images without user input.

Eye Protection System

JMGO O1 Pro features enhanced intelligent anti-glare with diffuse reflection to eliminate spotlighting and a Low Blue Light mode that automatically activates when the corresponding content is played. The Eye Protection System protects your eyes and maximizes your home entertainment experience.

 

Movie Mode

Play TV series, movies, games, sports and music in classic mode. JMGO O1 Pro elevates your entertainment and boosts your multimedia content.

 

Smart 24/7 Companion with Luna OS

JMGO O1 Pro features Luna OS for your 24/7 companion, including music visualizer, message board, weather dashboard and more. Any wall of the room can be turned into an information hub, an art exhibition.

By clicking the Luna OS button on the remote control, you can freely switch between Companion Mode and Movie Mode, opening up a world of art and imagination with just one click.

Alexa Built-in

Live a smart and convenient life with JMGO O1 Pro. With Alexa built-in, simply speak voice commands into the remote control and tell JMGO O1 Pro to  control your music, smart home devices, news, weather and more.

Ultra-long 45,000 Hours Lifespan

JMGO O1 Pro is built with long-term reliability using an industry leading chipset and advanced LED light source that has a lifespan of 45,000 hours. It’s made to provide years of service and power your entertainment all day, every day.


 

Universal Compatibility

JMGO O1 Series is versatile and works across all your device ecosystems.  With universal input and output ports including 2*USB, 2*HDMI, 1*Optical and 1*Lan, JMGO is conveniently compatible with your phones, tablets, laptops, and desktops, making it possible to unify all the gadgets you have and display all multimedia content.


 

JMGO was established in 2011 and we’re celebrating our 10th anniversary in China this year. Our founder, Mr. Eric Hu, has envisioned the future home entertainment space with projector and laser TV as early as a decade ago and since then has been determined to revolutionize the landscape of consumer electronics. Over the years, we’ve had many exciting R&D breakthroughs on screen size, resolution, industrial design, and this time with O1 & O1 Pro, we aspire to democratize the UST to everyone at an affordable price. Especially during this pandemic, everyone is spending more time at home. We want to contribute by providing more bang for buck innovative home entertainment options that will enhance everyone’s quality of life.

*Please have a look at our production line now for O1 series.

Where we ship?

We offer free shipping worldwide! However, VAT and GST are not included in price listed and will be determined by country on delivery. Backers are responsible for these costs (VAT, GST, duties, taxes, etc) on delivery.

Warranty:

JMGO offers a one year international warranty for O1 Series from the Date of Delivery. If you have any questions about claiming your warranty, please contact us at after-services@jmgo.com with the following information for verification:

-       Serial number at bottom of the projector body, or "Settings"

-       Proof of purchase

-       Detailed problem description

Please note that more types of proof of purchase and problems may be required such as videos or pictures for identifying the problem.

 

Return:

【Undamaged or faulty/defective products】may be returned for a full refund for any reason within 【30】days of the date the item was delivered to the designated shipping address. Buyers are responsible of return shipping costs. 

Please contact after-sales@jmgo.com for detailed guidance and requirements of return. Once the returned item arrives back in the JMGO warehouse for inspection, the refund process will begin.

Eligible conditions under the return policy：
