story:
Meet °Grid (offGrid), a palm-sized MIDI controller that lets you make music anywhere. 
°Grid gives your apps the natural feel of a traditional instrument using motion, gesture, touch and velocity-sensitivity.
 
 

 

Make beats, play keys, launch clips - °Grid fits any style and skill level. It’s instantly compatible with all of your existing devices - just pair & play.

 


°Grid employs LED-backlit, velocity-sensitive silicone pads and a unique multi-directional modulation Joystick. Think of it as a pocket, MPC-style Drumpad, Keyboard and haptic controller in one.

 


The lightweight, responsive design will help capture your creative ideas wherever you are. °Grid will keep running all day long on a single charge, so you can go from sketch to masterpiece without skipping a beat.

 


A free, companion editor app (iOS / Android) lets you store any configuration as a preset and recall on-the-fly.

 

Whether you’re looking for the lightest, hassle-free way to sketch out an idea on the go, want to add depth and expression to your performance, control your hardware hands-on, learn an exciting new instrument in no time, or jam with your friends and share the awesomeness with your feed.

— realizing your creative potential has never been more fun or instantly rewarding! 

 

 

°Grid will change the way you capture your creative ideas and bring your vision to life — it's the ultimate, take-anywhere, play-anything companion.

 

 
 
 

°Grid pairs with any iOS / Android / macOS & Windows PC device via Bluetooth® LE or USB Type-C in a matter of seconds. It maps MIDI (MPE) parameters to its minimalist interface to control and play any compatible App or external Hardware.

 

 

°Grid is compatible with hundreds of iOS and Android apps as well as DAW's (Digital Audio Workstations) out of the box.

Whatever you want to do, there’s an App for that — and the coolest thing about it: °Grid probably already made friends with yours. But that's not all —it is also fully customizable and adapts to any use-case, whether you're a pro or just starting out. 

 

 

°Grid lets you switch between freely customizable configurations (presets) on-the-fly, mid-performance.

 

 

 

°Grid transcends your digital experience through the versatility, responsiveness, and fun of playing a real instrument but with the amazing capabilities and comfort of a pocket-sized mobile device.

 

 

To put it simply: °Grid offers the most immediate, expressive and versatile way to bring your creative ideas to life. If you can dream it - °Grid can play it. 
 

 

A truly expressive instrument becomes an extension of your personality.
 

 

 

 

Shake it, bend it, dance with it — °Grid will translate every movement, touch, and gesture with precision and fluidity.

 

 

A built-in iNEMO™ Ultra-low-power, inertial module with an AI Machine Learning Core combines the power of a 3D accelerometer and a 3D gyroscope to map any gesture to any parameter — to put it simply: °Grid becomes a natural extension of your body.

 

 

 

 
 
One of °Grid most prominent features is a unique multi-directional Made-in-Japan modulation Joystick.
 

 

 

Now you can use your digits, thumbs or paws — there can never be enough YOU in the flow.

 

 

You can assign any of the User-Interface elements to any  MIDI (MPE) parameter of your choice, using the free companion editor (iOS/Android)

  • Multidirectional Modulation Joystick (continuous data stream).
  • 2x2 Transport pad-Grid (Velocity-sensitive, LED-backlit, color-customizable).
  • 4x4 Performance pad-Grid (Velocity-sensitive, LED-backlit).
  • Accelerometer (continuous data stream).
  • Gyroscope (continuous data stream).
  • Gestural Machine Learning (AI) Core.
 

 

Mapping parameters is as easy as drag & drop and will let you control far more than just Music Apps. You can build and animate 3D visuals, control hardware, launch clips, like something out of Minority Report. 

 
Any configuration can be saved as a preset, with 16 banks allowing for 16 presets each - that's a total of 256 individual presets that can be switched on-the-fly, standalone, mid-performance.
 

 

 
 
Think globally, act locally — is not just a motto.  From PCB through Enclosure to biodegradable packaging, °Grid is proudly designed and made in Austria, Europe.
 
 
 

Being an instrument by nature, we ensure the long-lasting °Grid usage through lightweight but extraordinarily durable materials — sourced and produced locally and with a clean conscience.

 

 

Reusability and recyclability

At birdkids, we focus on using recyclable plastics, bio-degradable packaging, low-emission PCB manufacturing and RoHS components as well as UN 38.3 and equivalent certified cells.

 

 

Sustainable materials

We aim to use biodegradable or recyclable packaging to reduce cost, waste, and emissions and of course provide online instructions for °Grid and the companion App instead of hard-copies.

 

 

Environmentally friendly factories

We work closely with local manufacturers who strive for the best CSR practices. Our local PCB manufacturers have ISO 9001:2015 certificates and full implementation of ultra-low emission measures as well as responsible, EU-certified decomposition.

 

 

 

°Grid lets you capture and express your creative ideas by combining the responsiveness and versatility of a real instrument with the total integration, capability and ease of use of a wireless, mobile device.

 

 

All °Grid units will ship with a rechargeable Li-Ion battery.

  • 4x4 grid of RGB LED-backlit, velocity-sensitive pads.
  • 2x2 grid of color-customizable, RGB  LED-backlit, velocity-sensitive pads.
  • Shift / secondary function Toggle.
  • Multi-directional, modulation Joystick.
  • USB Type-C plug.
  • Bluetooth BLE (5.0)  - Ultra-low latency MIDI optimization.
  • Machine Learning Core, low-power optimized 3D Accelerometer.
  • Machine Learning Core, low-power optimized 3D Gyroscope 
  • Free companion editor App (iOS/Android).

 

 

 

For fulfilment of the campaign, we're partnering up with BackerKit. This way you will be able to customize your order after the campaign, as well as pay shipping custom-tailored to your area. We ship worldwide and aim for a fulfilment of °Grid in December 2020.

 

°Grid is available in 3 color options. 

 


An exclusive °Grid Special Edition Case Kit is available in limited quantities to keep your unit safe and sound with a custom, hand-manufactured in EU, ultra-durable, water-resistant, Protective Soft Case made in collaboration with BRAASI INDUSTRY.

 

 

The shipping rates for the following international zones are estimates at the highest, your individual rate will be met at or below:

  • USA - approx. €20 / 22$
  • EU - approx. €15
  • Rest of the World - €25 / 27$

 

 

 

The main design challenge of °Grid was to bring ease-of-use and cutting-edge technology together in an affordable, pocket-size instrument. Our team went through countless iterations of form and function to arrive at the absolute essence of the product.

 

To achieve the elegant simplicity of our design, we needed the highest level of precision in prototyping made possible with the aid of our collaboration partner, Formlabs. Their expertise and tireless support enabled us to always prototype as close as possible to the actual properties and intricate details of the final product.

 

 

Simplicity is our core principle, it’s in everything we do - how you use a tool most efficiently, how it improves your life, what it feels like in your hands and how it integrates into your surroundings. We carefully eliminate anything that isn't related to functionality — what's left is honest, pure and strives to become an essential continuation of the individual's extraordinary narrative, style, and view of the world.

 

 

 

birdkids is a CreativeTech company based in Vienna, Austria. Our mission is to design the instruments to help and inspire people to express themselves and share their vision with the world.

 

 

°Grid is a part of a forward-thinking series of essential objects that focus on enriching tactile & kinesthetic expression in the 21st Century to interact intuitively & learn skill-sets through playing hands-on. Learning is possible by augmenting Mobile-computing platforms with haptic Human-Machine-Interfaces.

 

After a successful launch of our first modular product line TheBateleur in 2016, we’ve steadily asserted our position as one of the leading brands of premium quality Modular Synthesizers worldwide — with synthesizers being an essential part of music production our client list includes some of the biggest Names in Electronic Music, Film and TV.

 

 
 

In 2018, we’ve successfully reached out to the community to kickstart RAVEN a 100% Analog, modular synthesizer voice. By 2019 we've fulfilled all products worldwide including all stretch goals - but above all, we’ve proven that the brand’s core-values resonate emotionally on a scale beyond a niché segment.

 

 

We are Engineers, Designers, Architects, Illustrators, Developers, DJs, VJs and perpetually curious kids who are madly in love with Arts & Technology

— we are birdkids.

 

 

 

Disclaimer

As wonderfully outlined by IndieGoGo: "Crowdfunding is not shopping, it's better".

Though backers who plepdge for any of the physical perks - will get the same physical entity as would at a later point be available in some form of commercial retail, meaning an actual fully functional °Grid unit (or Kit). °Grid units and rewards offered through the campaign are NOT for commercial sale, and definitely NOT for any type of re-sale.

Backers might choose to give their units away as gifts or pass them on to family members. The customer service and any type of warranty that birdkids will grant post campaign, is tied to the backer and shipping address provided for dispatch only.

Via IndieGoGo: "With crowdfunding, you’re not simply exchanging money for a product. Crowdfunding is a way to make a bigger impact in the world with how your money gets spent. When you back a campaign, you’re helping to foster innovation and allowing a more diverse set of companies to thrive. "

We aim to make °Grid the world's smartest, mobile controller for Music and Audiovisual applications. A huge part of understanding the requirements for those specific applications - would be to get to know you, on a granular level at the earliest possible stage. 

As a  bigThank You, we are prioritizing your perk before any retail chain, as well as extending the courtesy of Early Adopter pricing  and inviting you to be part of the Beta-Program family on this revolutionary journey.

story:
LivingRoom Upright Piano

Complete & Intermediate Editions

Making a vintage character upright piano come to life in a virtual piano instrument for Mac & PC.
 

 

WHAT IS the
LivingRoom Upright Piano?

The LivingRoom Upright Piano - Complete Edition is a software model of a vintage character upright piano from the south of Sweden. The core of this software was made by recording the original piece thousands of times, in multiple ways and with multiple microphone recording positions to make a versatile, accurate and detailed virtual model of the real piano.

 


 

What makes it special?

A few years ago I, Anders Eklöv, had a vision for making a software model of a piano that sounds like an upright piano does when used for a few years after tuning. When some of the strings in each key become slightly out of tune. A classic home piano sound, or if you will, a "living room upright piano" sound. So, prior to recording the sounds for this product, I had the piano tuned to that specific point and the result is a recorded piano with a very high sense of realism. Not nearly as out of whack to resemble a honky-tonk piano, nor as perfect as a pristine grand piano, which come in great supply on the market already. Just slightly out of tune.

The sound of the piano is a classic upright piano sound. It is vintage, but does not sound vintage. It sounds like what it is - a good quality, large body upright piano with lots of character and intimate tone, for situations requiring realism and a genuine sounding instrument.

 

FEATURES

OF LIVINGROOM UPRIGHT PIANO

To accurately model the original piece in the digital realm over 4200 recordings were made in groups ranging from sustained notes to acoustical behavioral sounds and noises and played back through the advanced piano playback engine in the virtual piano.

 

Sustained note recordings - pedal on & off

Nuance and dynamic range through multiple sensitivity layers.

All keys of the piano were sampled/recorded 26 times in different groups. The main group is the sustained notes, the ones you hear while pressing down a key. Two sets of sustains were recorded in their full length, one with the pedal unpressed and another with the pedal pressed. The length and sound character is quite different between these and they play an important role in realistically reproducing any piano.
 

3 Close Stereo Microphone positions

The complete set of recordings were made in 3 separate simultaneous stereo microphone positions. The first from the front near the strings (the "player position"), the second one below the keyboard and the third on the rear of the piano body, where sound is let out through two openings. These positions are all close microphone positions that reflect that part of the piano body's most intimate sound. They differ quite a bit in tonality making the piano very versatile and adjustable and can easily blend into any sound or mix. Using the mixer of the virtual instrument you can adjust all components recorded independently for all three positions.

 

Dynamic Range control

An essential piece of a software piano, as opposed to the physical original, is the ability of adjusting the maximum difference between the strongest recording and the softest for each key. Through the Dynamic Range knob you can adjust this either explosive or seamless volume differences in between the recorded sensitivities, so your result matches your song or performance expectations. After all, the dynamic difference in volume is often compressed away, through a compressor or limiter, which many times make most piano tracks sound worse. This feature gets you quicker to your desired sound, circumventing excessive compression.

(features section continues after audio demos)

 

SOUND EXAMPLES MADE WITH THE PRE-BETA PIANO SOFTWARE

 

Demo 1 - Slow piano piece

Slow piano piece, as if composed for Film or TV, alternatively as stand-alone piano music. No effects or dynamic processing applied. This demo includes two examples, one without any acoustical layers, another one with all included. For this sound example the acoustical layers were slightly exaggerated so you can hear the difference.

Composed by Anders Eklöv. Made in Logic Pro with Kontakt 5.6 and LivingRoom Upright Piano Complete Edition, pre-beta.

  • Listen to demo 1 on SoundCloud - part 1  |  part 2

 

Demo 2 - Rhythmic - A sound-alike of a classic salsa song

A short demo of the Complete Edition as it would sound on Salsa or Merengue, demonstrating a combo of lower and upper ranges together in more rhythmic material.

Sound-alike of "El Preso" by Fruko y Sus Tesos. Made in Logic Pro with Kontakt 5.6 and LivingRoom Upright Piano Complete Edition, pre-beta.

  • Listen to demo 2 on SoundCloud

Demo 3 - Classical piano pieces

A short demo of the Complete Edition showing classical masterpieces. Here showing microphone position 1 and 2.

  • Listen to demo 1 on SoundCloud - song 1 (claire de lune)  |  song 2 (grande valse brillante)


__________

 

Acoustical modelling and detail


Releasing the key - String dampening and Key release sounds

Depicting acoustical behavior as the key is released.

When you release the key of a played note (without having pressed the sustain pedal) two things happen in a real piano. The key's mechanical parts give off a release noise and the damper will silence the played note, both of which were captured quite extensively for this product.

The dampening of the strings is an important thing in trying to mimic the sound of an acoustic piano. Depending on how long you hold the note and how hard you strike the key, the sound of your stings being dampened will change very much. A quick note has more of a harsh, explosive sound while a normal, longer note creates a less sharp and smoother dampening sound.

Both staccato (shorter) and normal longer held notes's dampening sounds were captured in multiple time intervals as well as velocity (strength), for a full sonic range. Through the piano playback engine the String Dampening sounds are selected polyphonically and follow both the strength of your playing and the time elapsed since you pressed the key. Tone, timing, AHDSR Envelopes and equalization is then applied for the closest match of the original piano's sound character.

The mechanical Key Release sounds follow the same principles but can also be adjusted to add or subtract from the Dynamic Range setting, which at high settings can make the sounds drop out entirely at soft key strokes.

Via the Release Length slider you can shorten the length of string dampening and mechanical noises, for more explosive or quicker playing styles. Both release sounds can be adjusted in the user interface of the virtual piano, for all three microphone positions.

 

String & Body Resonances

Modelling the original piano's internal acoustics.

The internal acoustics of the piano box/body was recorded using Impulse Response reverb technology, also called Convolution Reverb, which captures a resonance of an acoustical environment. Two separate resonances were captured, the piano box/body's internal reverb as a whole and a separate one recorded very near the strings, capturing the piano strings resonating. These are additions you can use in your own desired portion and can give a very nice addition of more overtones for wider sounds and more resonant sounding machinery, much like the original piano.

When connected to the sustain pedal actions, you will hear the same effect of the piano sound "swelling" as when you press the pedal on an actual piano. String Resonance gives you an added sense of the presence of the strings while the Body  Resonance adds more of the acoustics of the box.


Put a lid on it!

While the piano comes with an intimate sound character, the "Lids/Panels" (open/semi-open/closed) feature lets you encapsulate the sound for a less bright and sometimes more accurate experience, creating the natural sound of an upright piano with the panels attached, not removed/open as your would record it in most situations. Combined with the Body Resonance feature you can make a very resonant sounding piano and then close the lid on the sound, for that classic "boxy" upright sound, while placing your instrument as a whole in the desired environment in your mix.

 

Analog-style User Interface
with Performance and Mixer View

The performance view will give you all the control over the in-the-box adjustments you will need to adjust the intimacy or grandeur of your sound. Using custom volume adjustment for all sound and effect sources you can adjust the note fade-out / decay time, the string dampening and mechanical key release sounds and how they follow what you play. String and piano body resonances are adjusted for all 3 microphone positions on the main performance view and can either follow the actions of your sustain pedalling, or stay on all the time as an effect.
 

ADVANCED PIANO AUDIO
PLAYBACK ENGINE

Running it all is our custom coded audio playback engine for accurate reproduction of the piano recordings, currently in pre-beta development. A portion of the piano playback engine features include:

  • adjustable note decay time
  • custom realistic polyphonic voice blending and fade-out of repeated notes, for accuracy
  • Accurate String Dampening & Key Release sounds with time and velocity matrix
  • Authentic Pedal Behaviour - volume and accent follows your playing style
  • Impulse Response modelled Body & String Resonances with sustain pedal interaction


__________

 

WHO IS IT FOR?

  • Pianists, keyboardists, musicians & people learning to play the piano
  • Music producers, song writers and composers of all kinds
  • Film composers who need high quality alternative piano sounds
  • Producers working on records with lots of piano based songs, where diversity is desirable

 

HOW DO I USE IT?

SAMPLER FORMATS & PLATFORMS

As a finished software piano it will run in a sampler software on either Windows or macOS. Linux as well if you have the right tools. The sampler formats that are supported are the Native Instruments Kontakt sampler, SFZ & EXS24. The latter is the format used in Logic Pro X, GarageBand and MainStage and will include smart control patches. SFZ is an open source format that can be used in built-in samplers of many different DAWs, but no matter what music program you have you can always use Sforzando, a free sample player for macOS and Windows. While the entire set of sustained note recordings are available for all formats, the acoustical modelling is only fully realizable in Kontakt as a format, as it requires custom scripting to work properly.

What stuff do I need to be able to play the piano?

  • a computer, laptop or desktop, running Windows or macOS.
  • either a music program (DAW) or a sampler software of the supported type.
  • preferably a digital piano, stage piano , a synthesizer or a midi keyboard with either midi output or midi-over-usb to the computer to be able to play the instrument 'live'.

_______________________________________

System Requirements - formats & platforms

LivingRoom Upright will support

Read the full System Requirements at the top of the FAQ tab!

_______________________________________

 

The product - Complete & Intermediate Edition


LivingRoom Upright Piano - Complete Edition

This is the flagship fully-featured instrument containing all the parts mentioned in the features section and is the instrument playing all the audio demos. We offer this one in two separate forms. One digitally downloadable product and another physical package that ships to your house in a box containing a USB memory / flash drive with the files on. The physical box "perk" (read below) also includes the digital downloadable files and updates.

Select the perk ** Complete Edition - download ** to back this project and receive a downloadable version of this one!

As a backer of this project using the perk Complete Edition Packaged USB, you will receive the virtual instrument packaged and shipped right to you! We'll include a USB flash drive containing the instrument files. You will also get access to the downloadable files and just lifetime service and feature updates of the Complete Edition.

Select the perk ** Complete Edition Packaged USB ** to back this project and receive a physical box sent to you!

There is an additional shipping cost that varies slightly depending on your country of residence, but the norm of the shipping cost is around 22-26 euros, depending on your whereabouts.
 

LivingRoom Upright Piano - Intermediate Edition

The same great basic sound of the Complete Edition, but fewer sensitivity/velocity layers recorded and without the extra acoustic modelling or response technology. It consists of 4-5 sensitivity velocity layered instrument with the sound from microphone position 1 only, the player position. When used in Kontakt sampler, it also includes a user interface with some of the included parts of the complete edition, including dynamic range and note fade out time. You will also have access to lifetime service and feature updates of the Intermediate Edition and all future formats of it.
 
Select perk ** Intermediate Edition Download ** to back this project and receive a downloadable version of this one!

 

Backing our project: what´s a 'perk' and what am I getting?

A "perk" is an item or a set of items or rewards you will receive when you invest a certain predefined amount. Here on Indiegogo they are the same as a "Pledge" on Kickstarter projects. At the top-right you will see the alternatives available (on mobile: at the top, or as "select a perk" below).

Note: When a Perk sells out, the perk goes away and another may take it´s place, but the earlier you invest the less you will pay, as price goes up every time a tier sells out. Apart from these "perks" a backer can also choose to enter their own desired backing amount of their choice. Any backer who backs the project in between two perks pricing will be awarded all perks that are valued less than or the same as the amount entered. This will be handled manually and be delivered to the Indiegogo registered email upon completion of the project, at product delivery/ fulfillment.

For more questions, read through the FAQ section or message us via support@keypleezer.com.

 

DELIVERY DATES & FULFILLMENT

To see what your perks include you can read the description of the perk itself. For the delivery dates we set the following time tables.

  • Complete Edition Digital Downloads - Late June 2021 - early July 2021.
  • Complete Edition Physical USB package - early July 2021.
  • Intermediate Edition Digital Downloads - Late June 2021 - early July 2021.

We will update this information continuously and post updates on the circumstances of any changes in the "Updates" tab, the project progress blog.

 

DEVELOPMENT TIMELINE
 

 

 Challenges & Pitfalls

Kontakt Sampler as a format is our main focus at this point, since it has the most amount of complexity. SFZ and EXS24 are far easier formats to support and maintain and the output of these will be made to match the Kontakt instrument once that has been finished. Our prior experience with music instruments, such as the free edition of this upright piano product makes it easier for us to sketch up a timetable and plot out the difficulties and solutions of this more advanced instrument.

Digital downloads will take place through our online eCommerce platform. This solution is a part of our tech-stack already and we have the necessary web-technologies in place to handle demand of instrument downloads, which can be a both expensive and lengthy item to set up, especially for downloadable packages of 20GB size or more.

 

OUR USE OF YOUR INVESTMENT

We´re on a path of no return to make the best possible software product we can. Free of bugs and hick-ups. Your investment makes it a lot easier for us to make that happen in less time and with greater accuracy. Here´s a breakdown of our intended use of funds.
 

  • 30% of funds: Graphic Design / 3D design rendering & compositing.
  • 50% of funds: Code creation & enhancements of KSP Piano Playback Engine.
  • 15% of funds (or remaining funds): SFZ specific programming or consulting and format conversion tools needed to continuously make updates in all formats to be supported. Also digital delivery solutions and eventual web coding solutions, most of which have been pre-programmed and set-up in advance. 
  • For the Complete Edition Physical USB package, funds received from this tier will be reserved in part for a physical package creation and material costs, as well as USB memory storage devices for physical file delivery.


We want to make it clear that these are estimates and that we will use the funds to the components that have the highest priority for the reliability of the software instrument. If one component of the different tasks get done at an earlier date, we will shift funds towards the next or a parallel task.

 

 

HELP US REACH MORE FOLKS!

Please share this campaign with your family, friends and fellow musicians via FaceBook, Twitter, Instagram, direct email, Whatsapp, Telegram or Signal. Whatever floats your boat. Share it and help us reach our goals!

Your help is greatly appreciated.

 

 

We make virtual instruments from beautiful acoustic instruments for music producers, engineers, musicians, keyboardists & composers who want realistic and authentic sounding sounds representing their musical ideas.
story_txt:
LivingRoom Upright Piano
Complete & Intermediate Editions
Making a vintage character upright piano come to life in a virtual piano instrument for Mac & PC. 

 

WHAT IS theLivingRoom Upright Piano?
The LivingRoom Upright Piano - Complete Edition is a software model of a vintage character upright piano from the south of Sweden. The core of this software was made by recording the original piece thousands of times, in multiple ways and with multiple microphone recording positions to make a versatile, accurate and detailed virtual model of the real piano. 
 

 
What makes it special?
A few years ago I, Anders Eklöv, had a vision for making a software model of a piano that sounds like an upright piano does when used for a few years after tuning. When some of the strings in each key become slightly out of tune. A classic home piano sound, or if you will, a "living room upright piano" sound. So, prior to recording the sounds for this product, I had the piano tuned to that specific point and the result is a recorded piano with a very high sense of realism. Not nearly as out of whack to resemble a honky-tonk piano, nor as perfect as a pristine grand piano, which come in great supply on the market already. Just slightly out of tune.
The sound of the piano is a classic upright piano sound. It is vintage, but does not sound vintage. It sounds like what it is - a good quality, large body upright piano with lots of character and intimate tone, for situations requiring realism and a genuine sounding instrument.
 
FEATURES
OF LIVINGROOM UPRIGHT PIANO
To accurately model the original piece in the digital realm over 4200 recordings were made in groups ranging from sustained notes to acoustical behavioral sounds and noises and played back through the advanced piano playback engine in the virtual piano.
 
Sustained note recordings - pedal on & off
Nuance and dynamic range through multiple sensitivity layers.
All keys of the piano were sampled/recorded 26 times in different groups. The main group is the sustained notes, the ones you hear while pressing down a key. Two sets of sustains were recorded in their full length, one with the pedal unpressed and another with the pedal pressed. The length and sound character is quite different between these and they play an important role in realistically reproducing any piano. 
3 Close Stereo Microphone positions

The complete set of recordings were made in 3 separate simultaneous stereo microphone positions. The first from the front near the strings (the "player position"), the second one below the keyboard and the third on the rear of the piano body, where sound is let out through two openings. These positions are all close microphone positions that reflect that part of the piano body's most intimate sound. They differ quite a bit in tonality making the piano very versatile and adjustable and can easily blend into any sound or mix. Using the mixer of the virtual instrument you can adjust all components recorded independently for all three positions.
 
Dynamic Range control
An essential piece of a software piano, as opposed to the physical original, is the ability of adjusting the maximum difference between the strongest recording and the softest for each key. Through the Dynamic Range knob you can adjust this either explosive or seamless volume differences in between the recorded sensitivities, so your result matches your song or performance expectations. After all, the dynamic difference in volume is often compressed away, through a compressor or limiter, which many times make most piano tracks sound worse. This feature gets you quicker to your desired sound, circumventing excessive compression.
(features section continues after audio demos) 

SOUND EXAMPLES MADE WITH THE PRE-BETA PIANO SOFTWARE
 
Demo 1 - Slow piano piece



Slow piano piece, as if composed for Film or TV, alternatively as stand-alone piano music. No effects or dynamic processing applied. This demo includes two examples, one without any acoustical layers, another one with all included. For this sound example the acoustical layers were slightly exaggerated so you can hear the difference.

Composed by Anders Eklöv. Made in Logic Pro with Kontakt 5.6 and LivingRoom Upright Piano Complete Edition, pre-beta.
Listen to demo 1 on SoundCloud - part 1  |  part 2

 
Demo 2 - Rhythmic - A sound-alike of a classic salsa song


A short demo of the Complete Edition as it would sound on Salsa or Merengue, demonstrating a combo of lower and upper ranges together in more rhythmic material.

Sound-alike of "El Preso" by Fruko y Sus Tesos. Made in Logic Pro with Kontakt 5.6 and LivingRoom Upright Piano Complete Edition, pre-beta.
Listen to demo 2 on SoundCloud
Demo 3 - Classical piano pieces

A short demo of the Complete Edition showing classical masterpieces. Here showing microphone position 1 and 2.
Listen to demo 1 on SoundCloud - song 1 (claire de lune)  |  song 2 (grande valse brillante)

__________
 

Acoustical modelling and detail
Releasing the key - String dampening and Key release sounds
Depicting acoustical behavior as the key is released.
When you release the key of a played note (without having pressed the sustain pedal) two things happen in a real piano. The key's mechanical parts give off a release noise and the damper will silence the played note, both of which were captured quite extensively for this product.
The dampening of the strings is an important thing in trying to mimic the sound of an acoustic piano. Depending on how long you hold the note and how hard you strike the key, the sound of your stings being dampened will change very much. A quick note has more of a harsh, explosive sound while a normal, longer note creates a less sharp and smoother dampening sound.
Both staccato (shorter) and normal longer held notes's dampening sounds were captured in multiple time intervals as well as velocity (strength), for a full sonic range. Through the piano playback engine the String Dampening sounds are selected polyphonically and follow both the strength of your playing and the time elapsed since you pressed the key. Tone, timing, AHDSR Envelopes and equalization is then applied for the closest match of the original piano's sound character.
The mechanical Key Release sounds follow the same principles but can also be adjusted to add or subtract from the Dynamic Range setting, which at high settings can make the sounds drop out entirely at soft key strokes.
Via the Release Length slider you can shorten the length of string dampening and mechanical noises, for more explosive or quicker playing styles. Both release sounds can be adjusted in the user interface of the virtual piano, for all three microphone positions.
 
String & Body Resonances
Modelling the original piano's internal acoustics.
The internal acoustics of the piano box/body was recorded using Impulse Response reverb technology, also called Convolution Reverb, which captures a resonance of an acoustical environment. Two separate resonances were captured, the piano box/body's internal reverb as a whole and a separate one recorded very near the strings, capturing the piano strings resonating. These are additions you can use in your own desired portion and can give a very nice addition of more overtones for wider sounds and more resonant sounding machinery, much like the original piano.
When connected to the sustain pedal actions, you will hear the same effect of the piano sound "swelling" as when you press the pedal on an actual piano. String Resonance gives you an added sense of the presence of the strings while the Body  Resonance adds more of the acoustics of the box.

Put a lid on it!

While the piano comes with an intimate sound character, the "Lids/Panels" (open/semi-open/closed) feature lets you encapsulate the sound for a less bright and sometimes more accurate experience, creating the natural sound of an upright piano with the panels attached, not removed/open as your would record it in most situations. Combined with the Body Resonance feature you can make a very resonant sounding piano and then close the lid on the sound, for that classic "boxy" upright sound, while placing your instrument as a whole in the desired environment in your mix.
 
Analog-style User Interfacewith Performance and Mixer View

The performance view will give you all the control over the in-the-box adjustments you will need to adjust the intimacy or grandeur of your sound. Using custom volume adjustment for all sound and effect sources you can adjust the note fade-out / decay time, the string dampening and mechanical key release sounds and how they follow what you play. String and piano body resonances are adjusted for all 3 microphone positions on the main performance view and can either follow the actions of your sustain pedalling, or stay on all the time as an effect. 
ADVANCED PIANO AUDIOPLAYBACK ENGINE
Running it all is our custom coded audio playback engine for accurate reproduction of the piano recordings, currently in pre-beta development. A portion of the piano playback engine features include:

adjustable note decay time
custom realistic polyphonic voice blending and fade-out of repeated notes, for accuracy
Accurate String Dampening & Key Release sounds with time and velocity matrix
Authentic Pedal Behaviour - volume and accent follows your playing style
Impulse Response modelled Body & String Resonances with sustain pedal interaction


__________
 

WHO IS IT FOR?

Pianists, keyboardists, musicians & people learning to play the piano
Music producers, song writers and composers of all kinds
Film composers who need high quality alternative piano sounds
Producers working on records with lots of piano based songs, where diversity is desirable

 
HOW DO I USE IT?
SAMPLER FORMATS & PLATFORMS
As a finished software piano it will run in a sampler software on either Windows or macOS. Linux as well if you have the right tools. The sampler formats that are supported are the Native Instruments Kontakt sampler, SFZ & EXS24. The latter is the format used in Logic Pro X, GarageBand and MainStage and will include smart control patches. SFZ is an open source format that can be used in built-in samplers of many different DAWs, but no matter what music program you have you can always use Sforzando, a free sample player for macOS and Windows. While the entire set of sustained note recordings are available for all formats, the acoustical modelling is only fully realizable in Kontakt as a format, as it requires custom scripting to work properly.
What stuff do I need to be able to play the piano?

a computer, laptop or desktop, running Windows or macOS.
either a music program (DAW) or a sampler software of the supported type.
preferably a digital piano, stage piano , a synthesizer or a midi keyboard with either midi output or midi-over-usb to the computer to be able to play the instrument 'live'.

_______________________________________
System Requirements - formats & platforms
LivingRoom Upright will support

Read the full System Requirements at the top of the FAQ tab!
_______________________________________

This is the flagship fully-featured instrument containing all the parts mentioned in the features section and is the instrument playing all the audio demos. We offer this one in two separate forms. One digitally downloadable product and another physical package that ships to your house in a box containing a USB memory / flash drive with the files on. The physical box "perk" (read below) also includes the digital downloadable files and updates.
Select the perk ** Complete Edition - download ** to back this project and receive a downloadable version of this one!

We'll include a USB flash drive containing the instrument files. You will also get access to the downloadable files and just lifetime service and feature updates of the Complete Edition.
Select the perk ** Complete Edition Packaged USB ** to back this project and receive a physical box sent to you!
There is an additional shipping cost that varies slightly depending on your country of residence, but the norm of the shipping cost is around 22-26 euros, depending on your whereabouts.

The same great basic sound of the Complete Edition, but fewer sensitivity/velocity layers recorded and without the extra acoustic modelling or response technology. When used in Kontakt sampler, it also includes a user interface with some of the included parts of the complete edition, including dynamic range and note fade out time. You will also have access to lifetime service and feature updates of the Intermediate Edition and all future formats of it.
 
Select perk ** Intermediate Edition Download ** to back this project and receive a downloadable version of this one!

story:
Team

 

 

The Campaign is going to be continued in the following address: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/accento-musi...

 

Deutsch, siehe unten, Español, véase más abajo.

English

Short Summary

For every student-musician, the exercising period without the help of a teacher is by far the largest one. Depending on the learning level, practice takes between 70-95% of the total playing time. This overwhelming period is spent on his/her own.

However, all pupils invest a lot of growth potential in the exercise period, the progress stays small and stagnant. As a consequence, there is a lack of pleasure and exercise demolitions are not seldom.

As a solution, a software system is needed, which can transfer the quality of the lesson under the teacher’s control into the practicing period on alone.

The music software ACCENTO combines frequency, rhythm and timbre recognition techniques accompanied by a didactically built collection of music pieces. The students of all performance levels would be able to use the software, especially at home during the practice hours.

A musician plays the notes marked on the screen and receives feedback about the correctly or incorrectly played notes after it. In the second step, the program runs the appropriate exercises suggested and selected according to the student's errors to correct and practice them. All exercises are performed at appropriate speeds and small increases in tempo, so that at the end of the correction unit (2nd step) the play is guaranteed to be mastered.

The instrument educational material is designed by top musicians and consist of well-known and self-composed songs, exercises and etudes. The music pieces are integrated into the didactic learning concept and are coordinated with each other. The different levels of difficulty are combined with the different music styles so that one can choose from many different music sheets of different styles. Thus, the learning path is individually adapted to the needs of a student.

The quality and the intensity of personal instrumental lessons with a teacher are to be transferred to the exercise period. In this way, the musician has to be optimally looked after, especially during the practicing period - which takes more than 80% of the total playing time.

It is also very important to hold the body correctly while playing an instrument. Our program will also give feedback to the users according to their body position.

Two target groups will achieve significant benefits with the use of ACCENTO:

STUDENTS:

  • Students will increase learning speed.
  • Students will have fun with their instruments through permanent learning. The drop-out rate of the students will go down.
  • Through the interaction with the program and different tempos, a learner will have a constant metric guidance, which will develop an inner metric.
  • The musicians will learn and practice only the correct and necessary skills and won’t consolidate the wrong habits.

Students / parents will save time and money in the long term!

TEACHERS:

  • Teachers will teach more successfully.
  •  A student will develop an exercise discipline, which is designed by the trained instrument specialists.
  • He/she will be better prepared for the lesson, will not make unnecessary exercising and mistakes, which will simplify weekly exercises, since it will be possible to work on the music problems instead on the constant correction of the learnt habits.
  • Teachers' reputation will be enhanced by the successes of their students.

We are going to start with the following instruments: piano, guitar, flute and violin

The software is open, each user will be able to use his/her own music material.

Website: www.bacco.co.at/en

What you give us & what you get

The development of the software is going to be largely financed through the support of the Austrian Research Promotion Agency. We will still need additional capital, since the funding does not cover 100% of the costs. With your help, we will be able to fully cover the development costs as well as to ensure the market transition of the product.

The total cost for the first year is € 250000. The additional funds of the campaign will be invested in additional hardware, personnel costs, rent, as well as other incidental costs.

You will receive the product in different combinations (see Perks) for a reduced price.

The software will run on iOS, OSX, Android, Windows and Linux (Ubuntu and Fedora, other Distros on request) and it will run on PCs, tablets or mobile phones, in English, German, Spanish, Chinese and Korean (other languages on request).

For more than 100 prospective customers we will offer ACCENTO in other language ​​as well as other Linux distribution.

Android is supported since version 5.0.

Perks:

  • € 50, 1 license (3 devices, PC, tablet or mobile phone freely selectable) plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
  • € 100, 2 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
  • € 150, 3 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
  • Bronze Sponsor: € 500, your name will appear on our products in German, English and Spanish for 1 year. 4 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
  • Silver Sponsor: € 1000, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Spanish, Chinese and Korean for 1 year. 5 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
  • Gold Sponsor: € 2000, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Spanish, Chinese and Korean for 2 years. 6 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
  • Platinum Sponsor: € 5000, your name will appear on our products in English, German, Spanish, Chinese and Korean for 3 years. 7 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.

Deutsch

Kurzbeschreibung

Für jeden Musiker stellt die Übungszeit ohne Lehrer den weitaus größten Musizierzeitraum dar. Je nach Niveau nimmt die Übungszeit zwischen 70-95% der gesamten Spielzeit ein. Diese weitaus überwiegende Zeit verbringt der Musiker ohne seinen Lehrer, er/sie ist auf sich allein gestellt.

Allerdings verschenken Schüler in der Übungszeit sehr viel Entwicklungspotenzial, wodurch der Fortschritt kleiner ist, oder stagniert. Die Folge ist mangelnde Lust und nicht selten der Abbruch.

Als Lösung ist ein System notwendig, welches die Qualität des Unterrichts in die Übungszeit überträgt.

Die Musiksoftware ACCENTO kombiniert Frequenz,  Rhythmus und Klangfarbe-Erkennungs-Technik begleitet mit einem umfassend didaktisch aufgebauten System von Musikstücken. Musikschüler aller Leistungsstufen sollen die Software vor allem zu Hause in den Übungsstunden verwenden.
Der Musiker spielt die am Bildschirm/Display markierten Noten (Spielaufgabe) und erhält nach dem Spiel eine Rückmeldung über richtig und falsch gespielte Noten. Im zweiten Schritt durchläuft das Programm mit dem Schüler passende Übungen – vorgeschlagen vom Programm und je nach Fehlerstellen des Schülers vom Programm ausgewählt - um die gespielten Fehler zu korrigieren. Sämtliche Übungen erfolgen in passenden Spielgeschwindigkeiten und kleinen Temposteigerungen, sodass am Ende der Korrektureinheit (2. Schritt) die Spielaufgabe garantiert bewältigt wird.

 Das Notenmaterial wird von Spitzenmusikern konzipiert und besteht aus bekannten und selbst komponierten Liedern, Übungen, Etüden. Die Musikstücke sind in ein didaktisches Lernkonzept eingebunden und aufeinander abgestimmt. Verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade werden mit verschiedenen Musikstilen kombiniert, sodass auf jedem Niveau viele Musikstücke unterschiedlichster Art gewählt werden können. Somit wird der Lernweg individuell den Bedürfnissen des Schülers angepasst.

Die Qualität und Intensität des persönlichen Instrumentalunterrichts mit dem Lehrer soll auf die Übungszeit übertragen werden. Damit soll der Musiker vor allem in der Übungszeit - welche den weitaus größten Teil der gesamten Spielzeit ausmacht - optimal betreut werden.

Auch die Körperhaltung beim Spielen eines Instrumentes ist sehr wichtig, unser Programm wird auch ein Feedback  diesbezüglich den Benutzern geben

Zwei Zielgruppen erzielen mit der Verwendung von ACCENTO einen erheblichen Nutzen:

SCHÜLER:

  • Der Schüler steigert die Lerngeschwindigkeit.
  • Die Schüler haben durch dauerhafte Lernerfolge Spaß mit ihrem Instrument. Die Abbruchsquote der Schüler sinkt.
  • Die Schüler/Eltern sparen langfristig Zeit und Geld!
  • Durch die Interaktion mit dem Programm und den verschiedenen Tempos hat der Lernende eine konstante metrische Führung, wodurch dieser eine innere Metrik entwickeln kann.
  • Man lernt /übt nur die richtigen Fertigkeiten und man festigt nicht falsche Angewohnheiten.  

LEHRER:

  • Die Lehrer unterrichten erfolgreicher.
  • Die Reputation der Lehrer wird durch die Erfolge seiner Schüler gesteigert.
  • Der Schüler wird eine Übungsdisziplin entwickeln, welche speziell ausgebildeten Fachkräfte gestalten
  • Der Schüler kommt besser vorbereitet zur Stunde, macht weniger unnötige Fehler, was die wöchentliche Arbeit vereinfachen wird, da es möglich sein wird an den musikalischen Problemen zu arbeiten anstatt falsch gelernte Abläufe andauernd korrigieren zu müssen.

Wir beginnen mit folgenden Instrumenten: Klavier, Gitarre, Querflöte und Violine

Die Software ist offen, jeder Benutzer wird in der Lage sein sein eigenes Notenmaterial zu verwenden.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Die Entwicklung der Software wird sich großteils über eine Förderung der Österreichischen Forschungsförderungsgesellschaft finanzieren.Da die Förderung nicht 100% der Kosten abdeckt, benötigen wir weiterhin zusätzliches Kapital. Mit eurer Hilfe werden wir die Entwicklungskosten vollständig abdecken können, sowie auch den Marktübergang des Produktes absichern.

Die Gesamtkosten für das erste Jahr betragen €250000. Die zusätzliche Mittel der Kampagne werden in zusätzliche Hardware, Personalkosten, Miete, sowie weitere Nebenkosten investiert.

Ihr bekommt als Belohnung das Produkt in verschiedenen Kombinationen (siehe Perks)  gegen einen ermäßigten Preis.

Die Software wird für iOS, OSX, Android, Windows und Linux - (Ubuntu und Fedora, andere Distros nach Anfrage) -und es wird auf Computer, Tablets oder Handys laufen, vorerst auf Englisch, Deutsch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch (andere Sprachen nach Anfrage).

Bei mindestens 100 Interessenten können wir  in anderen Sprachen sowie andere Linux Distributionen anbieten.

Android wird ab Version 5.0 unterstützt.

Perks:

  • €50, 1 Lizenz(3 Geräte, PC, Tablet oder Handy frei wählbar) plus 1 major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
  • €100, 2 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
  •  €150, 3 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
  • Bronze Sponsor: €500, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch und Spanisch für 1 Jahr. 4 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
  • Silver Sponsor: €1000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 1 Jahr. 5 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
  • Gold Sponsor: €2000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 2 Jahre. 6 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
  • Platinum Sponsor: €5000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 3 Jahr. 7 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.

Español

Descripción

La práctica de un instrumento sin la compañía de un docente representa para cada músico el periodo más prolongado de la práctica musical. De acuerdo al nivel del instrumentista, la práctica individual representa entre el 70 y el 95% del tiempo total de ejecución. Durante todo ese tiempo cada músico ejercita su instrumento sin la presencia de su maestro, el/ella depende solo de si mismo.

No obstante la mayor parte de los estudiantes de música desperdicia una gran cantidad de potencial durante la práctica diaria, la evolución es mínima o en su defecto se produce un estancamiento. El resultado es insuficiente motivación y con mucha frecuencia el abandono de la práctica musical.

Como solución es necesario crear un sistema que traslade la calidad de las clases a la práctica diaria.

El Software ACCENTO combina el reconocimiento de la frecuencia, el ritmo y el timbre siendo acompañado por un sistema pedagógico de obras progresivas. Los estudiantes de todas las edades y niveles usarán el Software sobre todo en sus hogares durante la práctica de sus respectivos instrumentos. Los músicos tocarán las piezas mostradas en la pantalla de sus dispositivos, y una vez finalizada la ejecución tendrán la oportunidad de visualizar los errores realizados. A continuación el programa le sugerirá al usuario ejercicios técnicos para corregir los errores cometidos. Los ejercicios serán ejecutados con una aceleración gradual del Tempo, para garantizar de esta manera la culminación exitosa de la pieza correspondiente.

Las piezas de los métodos serán concebidas por renombrados pedagogos comprendiendo las obras más importantes de la literatura de cada instrumento, así como arreglos propios. Diferentes estilos y niveles de dificultad serán combinados de manera que en cada nivel sea posible escoger diferentes piezas, posibilitando de esta manera la elección de un recorrido individual que se adapte a las exigencias o problemas de cada alumno.

De esta forma la calidad e intensidad de las clases instrumentales serán trasladadas a la práctica diaria. Así será posible aprovecharla al máximo y acelerar considerablemente el aprendizaje musical.

La postura es también muy importante al tocar un instrumento. Nuestro programa también ofrecerá un  control sobre posibles errores de postura durante la ejecución.

Dos grupos de usuarios percibirán con el uso de ACCENTO enormes beneficios:

ESTUDIANTES

  • El estudiante podrá aprender con más rapidez     
  • A través de su mejoría le será posible disfrutar la actividad musical.
  • Los estudiantes / padres ahorrarán tiempo y dinero.
  • Desarrolla el pulso interno, ya que al interactuar con el programa y los diferentes metros el estudiante tendrá una guía métrica constante.
  • Habrá una supervisión constante del estudio diario, con lo cual será posible ahorrar el tiempo que se pierde cuando se aprende algo mal. Solo se aprenden lecciones positivas, de esta manera el aprendizaje no se construye en base a la corrección de malos hábitos.

DOCENTES

  • Los docentes podrán mejorar la calidad de su enseñanza. Finalmente será posible trabajar los aspectos importantes de las obras durante las clases.
  • Su reputación crecerá a través de los éxitos de sus alumnos.
  •  El alumno desarrollará una disciplina de estudio pre-estructurada por especialistas y vendrá a clase con un trabajo previo carente de errores. Esto le facilitará el trabajo y le permitirá concentrarse más en temas musicales que en solucionar problemas de solfeo.
  • Los primeros métodos de aprendizaje disponibles serán para piano, guitarra, violín y flauta traversa. El Software es de todas maneras abierto, cada usuario podrá usar su propio material.

El programa es abierto, o sea a cada usuario le será posible usar sus propias partituras, o confeccionar sus propios métodos de aprendizaje si así lo desea.

Web en español: www.bacco.co.at/es

Que es lo que nos das y que recibes

El desarrollo del programa se financiará mayormente sobre un subsidio del Österreichischen Forschungsförderungsgesellschaft (FFG). El subsidio no cubre el 100% de los costos, por ello realizamos esta campaña para asegurar el desarrollo del producto y la transición al mercado.

El monto total del los costos para el primer año es de €250.000. La ganancia adicional de la campaña será invertida en equipos extras de Hardware, expansión del personal, alquiler, así como otros gastos adicionales.

A cambio de vuestra contribución, vosotros recibiréis el producto en diferentes combinaciones (véase Perks) con un descuento aproximado del 44%

El Software será realizado para iOS, OSX; Android (Android 5 o más elevado), Windows y Linux (Ubuntu y Fedora, otras distribuciones bajo petición) y funcionará en computadoras, tabletas y teléfonos móviles. La primera versión será lanzada en inglés, alemán, español, chino y coreano (otros idiomas a petición).

A Partir de 100 personas interesadas podemos ofrecer otros idiomas así como otras distribuciones de Linux. En este caso comuníquese con nosotros.

Perks:

  • €50 1 licencia (3 dispositivos, PC, tableta y teléfono móbil) así como un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
  • €100 2 licencias y un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
  • €150 3 licencias y un Major Upgrade a Accento 2.0.
  • Bronze Sponsor: €500, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés y alemán por 1 año, además de ello recibirá 4 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
  • Silver Sponsor: €1000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 1 año, además de ello recibirá 5 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
  • Gold Sponsor: €2000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 2 años, además de ello recibirá 6 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
  • Platinum Sponsor: €5000, su nombre aparecerá en nuestros productos en español, inglés, alemán, chino y coreano por 3 años, además de ello recibirá 7 licencias y 1 Major Upgrade.
story_txt:
Team  The Campaign is going to be continued in the following address: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/accento-musi...
 Deutsch, siehe unten, Español, véase más abajo.EnglishShort SummaryFor every student-musician, the exercising period without the help of a teacher is by far the largest one. Depending on the learning level, practice takes between 70-95% of the total playing time. This overwhelming period is spent on his/her own.However, all pupils invest a lot of growth potential in the exercise period, the progress stays small and stagnant. As a consequence, there is a lack of pleasure and exercise demolitions are not seldom.As a solution, a software system is needed, which can transfer the quality of the lesson under the teacher’s control into the practicing period on alone.The music software ACCENTO combines frequency, rhythm and timbre recognition techniques accompanied by a didactically built collection of music pieces. The students of all performance levels would be able to use the software, especially at home during the practice hours.A musician plays the notes marked on the screen and receives feedback about the correctly or incorrectly played notes after it. In the second step, the program runs the appropriate exercises suggested and selected according to the student's errors to correct and practice them. All exercises are performed at appropriate speeds and small increases in tempo, so that at the end of the correction unit (2nd step) the play is guaranteed to be mastered.The instrument educational material is designed by top musicians and consist of well-known and self-composed songs, exercises and etudes. The music pieces are integrated into the didactic learning concept and are coordinated with each other. The different levels of difficulty are combined with the different music styles so that one can choose from many different music sheets of different styles. Thus, the learning path is individually adapted to the needs of a student.The quality and the intensity of personal instrumental lessons with a teacher are to be transferred to the exercise period. In this way, the musician has to be optimally looked after, especially during the practicing period - which takes more than 80% of the total playing time.It is also very important to hold the body correctly while playing an instrument. Our program will also give feedback to the users according to their body position.Two target groups will achieve significant benefits with the use of ACCENTO:STUDENTS:
Students will increase learning speed.
Students will have fun with their instruments through permanent learning. The drop-out rate of the students will go down.
Through the interaction with the program and different tempos, a learner will have a constant metric guidance, which will develop an inner metric.
The musicians will learn and practice only the correct and necessary skills and won’t consolidate the wrong habits.
Students / parents will save time and money in the long term!TEACHERS:
Teachers will teach more successfully.
 A student will develop an exercise discipline, which is designed by the trained instrument specialists.
He/she will be better prepared for the lesson, will not make unnecessary exercising and mistakes, which will simplify weekly exercises, since it will be possible to work on the music problems instead on the constant correction of the learnt habits.
Teachers' reputation will be enhanced by the successes of their students.
We are going to start with the following instruments: piano, guitar, flute and violinThe software is open, each user will be able to use his/her own music material.Website: www.bacco.co.at/enWhat you give us & what you getThe development of the software is going to be largely financed through the support of the Austrian Research Promotion Agency. We will still need additional capital, since the funding does not cover 100% of the costs. With your help, we will be able to fully cover the development costs as well as to ensure the market transition of the product.The total cost for the first year is € 250000. The additional funds of the campaign will be invested in additional hardware, personnel costs, rent, as well as other incidental costs.You will receive the product in different combinations (see Perks) for a reduced price.The software will run on iOS, OSX, Android, Windows and Linux (Ubuntu and Fedora, other Distros on request) and it will run on PCs, tablets or mobile phones, in English, German, Spanish, Chinese and Korean (other languages on request).For more than 100 prospective customers we will offer ACCENTO in other language ​​as well as other Linux distribution.Android is supported since version 5.0.Perks:
€ 50, 1 license (3 devices, PC, tablet or mobile phone freely selectable) plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
€ 100, 2 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
€ 150, 3 licenses plus 1 major upgrade to Accento 2.0.
Bronze Sponsor: € 500, your name will appear on our products in German, English and Spanish for 1 year. 4 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
Silver Sponsor: € 1000, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Spanish, Chinese and Korean for 1 year. 5 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
Gold Sponsor: € 2000, your name will appear on our products in German, English, Spanish, Chinese and Korean for 2 years. 6 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
Platinum Sponsor: € 5000, your name will appear on our products in English, German, Spanish, Chinese and Korean for 3 years. 7 licenses plus 1 major upgrade are also included.
DeutschKurzbeschreibungFür jeden Musiker stellt die Übungszeit ohne Lehrer den weitaus größten Musizierzeitraum dar. Je nach Niveau nimmt die Übungszeit zwischen 70-95% der gesamten Spielzeit ein. Diese weitaus überwiegende Zeit verbringt der Musiker ohne seinen Lehrer, er/sie ist auf sich allein gestellt.Allerdings verschenken Schüler in der Übungszeit sehr viel Entwicklungspotenzial, wodurch der Fortschritt kleiner ist, oder stagniert. Die Folge ist mangelnde Lust und nicht selten der Abbruch.Als Lösung ist ein System notwendig, welches die Qualität des Unterrichts in die Übungszeit überträgt.Die Musiksoftware ACCENTO kombiniert Frequenz,  Rhythmus und Klangfarbe-Erkennungs-Technik begleitet mit einem umfassend didaktisch aufgebauten System von Musikstücken. Musikschüler aller Leistungsstufen sollen die Software vor allem zu Hause in den Übungsstunden verwenden.Der Musiker spielt die am Bildschirm/Display markierten Noten (Spielaufgabe) und erhält nach dem Spiel eine Rückmeldung über richtig und falsch gespielte Noten. Im zweiten Schritt durchläuft das Programm mit dem Schüler passende Übungen – vorgeschlagen vom Programm und je nach Fehlerstellen des Schülers vom Programm ausgewählt - um die gespielten Fehler zu korrigieren. Sämtliche Übungen erfolgen in passenden Spielgeschwindigkeiten und kleinen Temposteigerungen, sodass am Ende der Korrektureinheit (2. Schritt) die Spielaufgabe garantiert bewältigt wird. Das Notenmaterial wird von Spitzenmusikern konzipiert und besteht aus bekannten und selbst komponierten Liedern, Übungen, Etüden. Die Musikstücke sind in ein didaktisches Lernkonzept eingebunden und aufeinander abgestimmt. Verschiedene Schwierigkeitsgrade werden mit verschiedenen Musikstilen kombiniert, sodass auf jedem Niveau viele Musikstücke unterschiedlichster Art gewählt werden können. Somit wird der Lernweg individuell den Bedürfnissen des Schülers angepasst.Die Qualität und Intensität des persönlichen Instrumentalunterrichts mit dem Lehrer soll auf die Übungszeit übertragen werden. Damit soll der Musiker vor allem in der Übungszeit - welche den weitaus größten Teil der gesamten Spielzeit ausmacht - optimal betreut werden.Auch die Körperhaltung beim Spielen eines Instrumentes ist sehr wichtig, unser Programm wird auch ein Feedback  diesbezüglich den Benutzern gebenZwei Zielgruppen erzielen mit der Verwendung von ACCENTO einen erheblichen Nutzen:SCHÜLER:
Der Schüler steigert die Lerngeschwindigkeit.
Die Schüler haben durch dauerhafte Lernerfolge Spaß mit ihrem Instrument. Die Abbruchsquote der Schüler sinkt.
Die Schüler/Eltern sparen langfristig Zeit und Geld!
Durch die Interaktion mit dem Programm und den verschiedenen Tempos hat der Lernende eine konstante metrische Führung, wodurch dieser eine innere Metrik entwickeln kann.
Man lernt /übt nur die richtigen Fertigkeiten und man festigt nicht falsche Angewohnheiten.  
LEHRER:
Die Lehrer unterrichten erfolgreicher.
Die Reputation der Lehrer wird durch die Erfolge seiner Schüler gesteigert.
Der Schüler wird eine Übungsdisziplin entwickeln, welche speziell ausgebildeten Fachkräfte gestalten
Der Schüler kommt besser vorbereitet zur Stunde, macht weniger unnötige Fehler, was die wöchentliche Arbeit vereinfachen wird, da es möglich sein wird an den musikalischen Problemen zu arbeiten anstatt falsch gelernte Abläufe andauernd korrigieren zu müssen.
Wir beginnen mit folgenden Instrumenten: Klavier, Gitarre, Querflöte und ViolineDie Software ist offen, jeder Benutzer wird in der Lage sein sein eigenes Notenmaterial zu verwenden.Was du uns gibst & was du bekommstDie Entwicklung der Software wird sich großteils über eine Förderung der Österreichischen Forschungsförderungsgesellschaft finanzieren.Da die Förderung nicht 100% der Kosten abdeckt, benötigen wir weiterhin zusätzliches Kapital. Mit eurer Hilfe werden wir die Entwicklungskosten vollständig abdecken können, sowie auch den Marktübergang des Produktes absichern.Die Gesamtkosten für das erste Jahr betragen €250000. Die zusätzliche Mittel der Kampagne werden in zusätzliche Hardware, Personalkosten, Miete, sowie weitere Nebenkosten investiert.Ihr bekommt als Belohnung das Produkt in verschiedenen Kombinationen (siehe Perks)  gegen einen ermäßigten Preis.Die Software wird für iOS, OSX, Android, Windows und Linux - (Ubuntu und Fedora, andere Distros nach Anfrage) -und es wird auf Computer, Tablets oder Handys laufen, vorerst auf Englisch, Deutsch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch (andere Sprachen nach Anfrage).Bei mindestens 100 Interessenten können wir  in anderen Sprachen sowie andere Linux Distributionen anbieten.Android wird ab Version 5.0 unterstützt.Perks:
€50, 1 Lizenz(3 Geräte, PC, Tablet oder Handy frei wählbar) plus 1 major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
€100, 2 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
 €150, 3 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade zu Accento 2.0.
Bronze Sponsor: €500, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch und Spanisch für 1 Jahr. 4 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
Silver Sponsor: €1000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 1 Jahr. 5 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
Gold Sponsor: €2000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 2 Jahre. 6 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
Platinum Sponsor: €5000, Ihr Name erscheint auf unseren Produkten auf Deutsch, Englisch, Spanisch, Chinesisch und Koreanisch für 3 Jahr. 7 Lizenzen plus 1 Major Upgrade sind auch dabei.
