story:
Plasma & Ferrofluid

Sound reactive wifi & bluetooth speaker


Plasma & Ferrofluid speaker will give you a truly unforgettable experience with a fascinating plasma arc and a mysterious ferrofluid!!  Also, two Hi/Mid speakers and one bass speaker let you dive into a rich and an attractive sound. You can simply choose Plasma speaker or Ferrofluid speaker for your visual satisfaction.


Stunning visual effects


Plasma speaker has a transparent cylinder at the top of the body and a fascinating plasma arc safely react to sound in the cylinder. You can see real plasma arc dancing in front of your eyes!!! 


Plasma speaker prototype test


Ferrofluid speaker has a same transparent cylinder with ferrofluid. This mysterious black liquid contains nano particles of a magnetic solid and react to sound. Since the Ferrofluid speaker shares the body and the sound board with the Plasma speaker, it is also on a final stage of making a prototype.


Ferrofluid inner structure



Bass-reflex enclosure design



_____________________________________________________________________________


Early development



_____________________________________________________________________________


Technical Background


Plasma

Plasma is one of the four fundamental states of matter, the others being solid, liquid and gas. A plasma has properties unlike those of the other states. 

A plasma can be created by heating a gas or subjecting it to a strong electromagnetic field applied with a laser or microwave generator. This decreases or increases the number of electrons, creating positive or negative charged particles called ions, and is accompanied by the dissociation of molecular bonds, if present.

The presence of a significant number of charge carries makes plasma electrically conductive so that it responds strongly to electromagnetic fields. Like gas, plasma does not have a definite shape or a definite volume unless enclosed in a container. Unlike gas, under the influence of a magnetic field, it may form structures such as filaments, beams and double layers.


Ferrofluid

A ferrofluid is a liquid that becomes strongly magnetized in the presence of a magnetic field. Ferrofluid was invented in 1963 by NASA's Steve Papell as a liquid rocket fuel that could be drawn toward a pump inlet in a weightless environment by applying a magnetic field.

A ferrofluid is a stable colloidal suspension of sub-domain magnetic particles in a liquid carrier. The particles, which have an average size of about 100Å (10 nm), are coated with a stabilizing dispersing agent (surfactant) which prevents particle agglomeration even when a strong magnetic field gradient is applied to the ferrofluid.

When a magnetic field is applied to a ferrofluid, the magnetic moments of the particles orient along the field lines almost instantly. The magnetization of the ferrofluid responds immediately to the changes in the applied magnetic field and when the applied field is removed, the moments randomize quickly.



Digital audio amplifier board : Texas Instruments' LM48901

Texas Instruments' LM48901 is a quad Class D amplifier that utilizes Texas Instruments’ proprietary spatial sound processor to create an enhanced sound stage for portable multimedia devices. The Class D output stages feature Texas Instruments’ edge rate control (ERC) PWM architecture that significantly reduces RF emissions while preserving audio quality and efficiency. The LM48901’s flexible I²S interface is compatible with standard serial audio interfaces. A stereo differential-input ADC gives the device the ability to process analog stereo audio signals.

Check out LM48901's specification

Spatial Sound

Spatial audio is a term applied to the reproduction of sound by electronic or mechanical methods that attempts to artificially re-create the real-world listening experience of sounds. Alternatively, it attempts to artificially alter reproduced sounds to create a perceived spatial environment that may not have originally existed.

The principle of spatial audio reproduction is simple: If the reproduced sound waves arriving binaurally at your eardrums are identical to those of the real audio source at a particular position, you will perceive the reproduced sound as coming from a source at that position. It does not matter whether the sound source originated at some other position. The sound data arriving at your ears is what the brain processes to ultimately characterize all aspects of the sound.

Generating spatial audio - Ken Boyce, Texas Instruments -May 10, 2012


apt-X technology

aptX® technology powers the pure, wireless sound behind many of the world’s finest smartphones, speakers, soundbars, headphones and tablets.

aptX® has been the best kept secret of the professional audio industry for many years. Now music lovers can enjoy the rich listening experience that only aptX® can deliver: pure wireless sound that doesn’t compromise on audio quality.

aptX® technology is at the heart of the best devices from leading brands such as Sony, Samsung, Vizio and Panasonic.


Support NFC


Bluetooth & Airplay

With the plasma & Ferrofluid speaker, you can choose and enjoy both audio connection - Airplay and Bluetooth.

Bluetooth is a universal wireless platform that is found in a wide range of electrical devices that includes mobile phones, laptops, cameras, printers, household items and even cars. Bluetooth speakers allow audio to be played wirelessly from one device to another connected device. 

AirPlay, on the other hand, is Apple’s own proprietary Wi-Fi dependant wireless platform, enabling users to stream digital audio or video content to other AirPlay-supported devices.

Bluetooth Pros:

One benefit of Bluetooth is its extremely wide application, working with a number of devices and operating systems. This is why you’ll find Bluetooth devices that run  Android or Windows Phone, not just those running Apple’s iOS software.

With Bluetooth it is possible to control only the volume of the original device that your music is streaming from, not the connected device (such as the wireless speaker).

Bluetooth is capable of sounding very good. The Minx Air range, for example, supports not only the Standard Bluetooth Codec (SBC), but also AAC and aptX. This means that if your phone, tablet or computer supports AAC or aptX, audio will be sent, received and processed using this higher grade codec than SBC.

Bluetooth Cons:

Unlike AirPlay, Bluetooth-connected devices need to be close proximity. This is typically 10 to 15m, compared to a potentially much large network with AirPlay.

Bluetooth streams in lossy compression, which is not as good as AirPlay’s lossless compression.

Airplay Pros:

AirPlay has the capability of playing across a much larger distance between devices than Bluetooth. This means that instead of a range of 10-20m between devices, distance is limited only by the reach of the Wi-Fi network over which it connects.

Furthermore, AirPlay uses lossless compression, but anything streamed over Bluetooth uses lossy compression.

AirPlay offers direct communication between the iOS device and the AirPlay speaker, including volume control.  When using AirPlay you’re actually capable of controlling the volume of the Airplay speaker (not just the volume of the iOS device).

Being on a home network generally offers a much better range than Bluetooth (which, a point-to-point wireless system has a range of 10 to 15 metres). This means that you can leave or walk about the room and your AirPlay speaker will keep playing as long as the AirPlay connected device is still within reach of the network.  When connected on a good solid network, AirPlay is very robust.

Airplay Cons:

One of the disadvantages of using AirPlay is that the products have to be networked – this varies in complexity, depending on the network and device, but is generally a relatively straightforward procedure that is not dissimilar to Bluetooth syncing.

AirPlay is only available on Apple and a small number of other certified devices.

Check more information about Bluetooth & Airplay on Cambridge Audio Homepage


Wifi Music Application Reccommendation - ShareOn

Plasma & Ferrofluid speaker support most of music applications on Apple & Android App store.


ShareOn Audio enables you to manage multiple devices from your phone by using DLNA. Also, you can use your iTunes library on your iPhone or Android phone.


Enjoy lossless music with DLNA supported speakers.

If you’ve ever felt that smartphones are not good enough to enjoy high quality music, it’s time to use ShareOn Audio with DLNA supported speakers.

Check more information about the ShareOn

Tech Specs



_____________________________________________________________________________


Team


_____________________________________________________________________________

In the Box


Plasma speaker

  1. Plasma wifi & bluetooth speaker
  2. Power adaptor
  3. USB magnetic cable
  4. Document pack


Ferrofluid speaker

  1. Ferrofluid wifi & bluetooth speaker
  2. Power adaptor
  3. USB magnetic cable
  4. Document pack

Support

  1. Support DLNA, Airplay, iPhone and Android phone with their own players
  2. Support audio specifications 32/44.1/48KHZ sampling rate; The highest bit rate of 320 KBPS; stereo
  3. Support audio output 16 bit DAC SNR105dB, THD + N - 95 db at 48 KHZ
  4. Compatible with WIFI 802.11 b/g/n standard 2.4 GHZ only

Support Bluetooth 4.0 

iPod touch, iPod nano (2nd generation or later), iPhone 3G or later.

iTunes, iPod touch (2nd generation or later), iPad, iPhone 3GS or later

For AirPlay, the SAPA must be connected to Wi-Fi with networked access to a Mac or PC running iTunes 10.1 or later; or an iPad, iPhone, or iPod touch running iOS 4.2 or later.

Click here for find out how to participate in the referral program

_____________________________________________________________________________

Free Shipping Worldwide

The Plasma & Ferrofluid speaker will be shipped to worldwide for free!!

_____________________________________________________________________________

Why We Need Your Help

Veranek Sound has been recently separated from the parent company and trying to stand alone as a professional speaker manufacturer. We have a lot of great ideas and concept sketches of speakers which never been designed before and can't wait to introduce them to world. Your perk will boost our production process and eventually be a power for the next project.

Your support will help our great ideas and passion turn to real products. Thank you!
story_txt:
Plasma & Ferrofluid


Sound reactive wifi & bluetooth speaker



Plasma & Ferrofluid speaker will give you a truly unforgettable experience with a fascinating plasma arc and a mysterious ferrofluid!!  Also, two Hi/Mid speakers and one bass speaker let you dive into a rich and an attractive sound. You can simply choose Plasma speaker or Ferrofluid speaker for your visual satisfaction.


Stunning visual effects


Plasma speaker has a transparent cylinder at the top of the body and a fascinating plasma arc safely react to sound in the cylinder. You can see real plasma arc dancing in front of your eyes!!! 


Plasma speaker prototype test

Ferrofluid speaker has a same transparent cylinder with ferrofluid. This mysterious black liquid contains nano particles of a magnetic solid and react to sound. Since the Ferrofluid speaker shares the body and the sound board with the Plasma speaker, it is also on a final stage of making a prototype.


Ferrofluid inner structure



Bass-reflex enclosure design









_____________________________________________________________________________
Early development










_____________________________________________________________________________
Technical Background


Plasma


Plasma is one of the four fundamental states of matter, the others being solid, liquid and gas. A plasma has properties unlike those of the other states. 
A plasma can be created by heating a gas or subjecting it to a strong electromagnetic field applied with a laser or microwave generator. This decreases or increases the number of electrons, creating positive or negative charged particles called ions, and is accompanied by the dissociation of molecular bonds, if present.
The presence of a significant number of charge carries makes plasma electrically conductive so that it responds strongly to electromagnetic fields. Like gas, plasma does not have a definite shape or a definite volume unless enclosed in a container. Unlike gas, under the influence of a magnetic field, it may form structures such as filaments, beams and double layers.





Ferrofluid


A ferrofluid is a liquid that becomes strongly magnetized in the presence of a magnetic field. Ferrofluid was invented in 1963 by NASA's Steve Papell as a liquid rocket fuel that could be drawn toward a pump inlet in a weightless environment by applying a magnetic field.
A ferrofluid is a stable colloidal suspension of sub-domain magnetic particles in a liquid carrier. The particles, which have an average size of about 100Å (10 nm), are coated with a stabilizing dispersing agent (surfactant) which prevents particle agglomeration even when a strong magnetic field gradient is applied to the ferrofluid.
When a magnetic field is applied to a ferrofluid, the magnetic moments of the particles orient along the field lines almost instantly. The magnetization of the ferrofluid responds immediately to the changes in the applied magnetic field and when the applied field is removed, the moments randomize quickly.







Digital audio amplifier board : Texas Instruments' LM48901


Texas Instruments' LM48901 is a quad Class D amplifier that utilizes Texas Instruments’ proprietary spatial sound processor to create an enhanced sound stage for portable multimedia devices. The Class D output stages feature Texas Instruments’ edge rate control (ERC) PWM architecture that significantly reduces RF emissions while preserving audio quality and efficiency. The LM48901’s flexible I²S interface is compatible with standard serial audio interfaces. A stereo differential-input ADC gives the device the ability to process analog stereo audio signals.



Check out LM48901's specification



Spatial Sound



Spatial audio is a term applied to the reproduction of sound by electronic or mechanical methods that attempts to artificially re-create the real-world listening experience of sounds. Alternatively, it attempts to artificially alter reproduced sounds to create a perceived spatial environment that may not have originally existed.

The principle of spatial audio reproduction is simple: If the reproduced sound waves arriving binaurally at your eardrums are identical to those of the real audio source at a particular position, you will perceive the reproduced sound as coming from a source at that position. It does not matter whether the sound source originated at some other position. The sound data arriving at your ears is what the brain processes to ultimately characterize all aspects of the sound.



Generating spatial audio - Ken Boyce, Texas Instruments -May 10, 2012



apt-X technology

aptX® technology powers the pure, wireless sound behind many of the world’s finest smartphones, speakers, soundbars, headphones and tablets.
aptX® has been the best kept secret of the professional audio industry for many years. Now music lovers can enjoy the rich listening experience that only aptX® can deliver: pure wireless sound that doesn’t compromise on audio quality.
aptX® technology is at the heart of the best devices from leading brands such as Sony, Samsung, Vizio and Panasonic.


Support NFC



Bluetooth & Airplay
With the plasma & Ferrofluid speaker, you can choose and enjoy both audio connection - Airplay and Bluetooth.
Bluetooth is a universal wireless platform that is found in a wide range of electrical devices that includes mobile phones, laptops, cameras, printers, household items and even cars. Bluetooth speakers allow audio to be played wirelessly from one device to another connected device. 
AirPlay, on the other hand, is Apple’s own proprietary Wi-Fi dependant wireless platform, enabling users to stream digital audio or video content to other AirPlay-supported devices.

Bluetooth Pros:
One benefit of Bluetooth is its extremely wide application, working with a number of devices and operating systems. This is why you’ll find Bluetooth devices that run  Android or Windows Phone, not just those running Apple’s iOS software.
With Bluetooth it is possible to control only the volume of the original device that your music is streaming from, not the connected device (such as the wireless speaker).
Bluetooth is capable of sounding very good. The Minx Air range, for example, supports not only the Standard Bluetooth Codec (SBC), but also AAC and aptX. This means that if your phone, tablet or computer supports AAC or aptX, audio will be sent, received and processed using this higher grade codec than SBC.
Bluetooth Cons:
Unlike AirPlay, Bluetooth-connected devices need to be close proximity. This is typically 10 to 15m, compared to a potentially much large network with AirPlay.
Bluetooth streams in lossy compression, which is not as good as AirPlay’s lossless compression.


Airplay Pros:
AirPlay has the capability of playing across a much larger distance between devices than Bluetooth. This means that instead of a range of 10-20m between devices, distance is limited only by the reach of the Wi-Fi network over which it connects.
Furthermore, AirPlay uses lossless compression, but anything streamed over Bluetooth uses lossy compression.
AirPlay offers direct communication between the iOS device and the AirPlay speaker, including volume control.  When using AirPlay you’re actually capable of controlling the volume of the Airplay speaker (not just the volume of the iOS device).
Being on a home network generally offers a much better range than Bluetooth (which, a point-to-point wireless system has a range of 10 to 15 metres). This means that you can leave or walk about the room and your AirPlay speaker will keep playing as long as the AirPlay connected device is still within reach of the network.  When connected on a good solid network, AirPlay is very robust.
Airplay Cons:
One of the disadvantages of using AirPlay is that the products have to be networked – this varies in complexity, depending on the network and device, but is generally a relatively straightforward procedure that is not dissimilar to Bluetooth syncing.
AirPlay is only available on Apple and a small number of other certified devices.
Check more information about Bluetooth & Airplay on Cambridge Audio Homepage

Wifi Music Application Reccommendation - ShareOn
Plasma & Ferrofluid speaker support most of music applications on Apple & Android App store.


ShareOn Audio enables you to manage multiple devices from your phone by using DLNA. Also, you can use your iTunes library on your iPhone or Android phone.

Enjoy lossless music with DLNA supported speakers.
If you’ve ever felt that smartphones are not good enough to enjoy high quality music, it’s time to use ShareOn Audio with DLNA supported speakers.

story: N/A

Control more than music

With AMAS Home you can not only stream music in HD quality. With the remote control you can additionally control your home entertainment system. Have the allround living room experience: control music and the TV. All components are connected wirelessly, so you can simply hide the system behind cupboards. AMAS Home is a soundbar alternative: Simply connect it to your TV and have the perfect sound experience while watching movies.

 

A unique way to control music and more

The m:remote can not only send commands, but also receive status information. Its shows playing information like the album cover, artist and album name, as well as other details when streaming music. Via the m:streamer you can control the music flow, create playlists, or set groups to use the multiroom function (multiple streamers needed). It supports RF and infrared, which lets you manage additionally home entertainment devices like your TV, stereo system, or DVD player. A quick-access bar on the bottom of the display gives you access to your favorite devices at any time.

 

Music streaming made easy: The m:streamer

The m:streamer communicates with your home network via Wifi or Ethernet so you can stream your own music from a NAS drive. You have also access to a broad variety of music streaming services like Deezer, or Tidal and thousands of online radio stations as well as podcasts. The m:streamer has an analog as well as digital in- and output, so you can connect a TV, an exisiting stereo and other devices. All these options support HD audio (24Bit/96kHz and 24Bit/192kHz) and gapless playback for the best sound experience.

Optional you can control the m:streamer with your smartphone or tablet (Android and iOS). The m:app is optimized for music streaming and gives you full control:

  • Change sources of a specific m:streamer (audio server, music streaming service, Online Radio/Podcast, USB, Bluetooth)
  • Stream songs stored on your phone/tablet
  • Add songs to the queue
  • Create and edit playlists
  • Group streaming clients to use the multiroom function
  • Change volume of devices seperately
  • Change system settings

 

Excellent sound - wirelessly

The "Blue Aura WS80i" speakers have an integrated 45 Watt amplifier. The active speakers with an elegant black faux leather cover communicate via RF with the m:streamer so there is no wired connection needed. A stylish look and stunning sound to support your sound experience with AMAS Home.

 

Wireless speakers + m:streamer = Soundbar alternative

Connect the TV with a digital or analog audio cabel to the m:streamer and enjoy sound in HD quality. AMAS Home is an alternative to an expensive soundbar and supports more than only TV sound. It integrates thus all living room components: Control the TV with the m:remote and listen to high quality sound with the m:streamer and the wireless speakers. Since all connections are wireless, you can hide the m:streamer in one of your cupboards.

 

Why AMAS Home?

There are a lot streaming solutions out there, misusing terms like "multiroom", comparing Wifi with Bluetooth, focusing only on one way to connect, or hyping their app. We don't want to be another brand like that. Our believes are different:

We are convinced that an app is not enough! Just have a look at the following situation: "Can you turn down the volume a little bit?" "Yeah sure, let me just get my phone, search the app on the screen, open it, click on the volume button and turn it down". Having an app is nice, but does not fully satisfy the consumer's needs. That is why developed the m:remote. Colored display with self-updating information like an app, fast response like a remote.

The room with most of the home entertainment devices is the living room. TV, DVD-player, stereo system - you name it. And every single device has its own remote control. But the m:remote is not just one of them. You can control all your home entertainment devices with it. So, get rid of all the rest. The quick access allows you to switch to your favorite device with one click. We think that an allround experience is important and that includes more than just the music itself.

We think there should be no compromises when it comes to connectivity. Have a look at the big streaming brands: They mostly focus on Wifi. But what if you want to connect your existing stereo system you bought years ago and which sound still fascinates you? Oh, yeah now you have to buy a separate device. What if you want to use your new streaming-enabled wireless speaker as a TV sound system? You realize the speaker doesn't provide a line-in option, so you have to buy an expensive soundbar additionally. We don't do compromises: Digital, analog, line-in, line-out, USB, Wifi, Ethernet, Bluetooth, UPnP - we have it all. So why buying two seperate devices? With AMAS Home you have all-in-one.

 

You love music in the kitchen? Then keep on reading ...

AMAS Home Kitchen provides you with the best sound in the kitchen. This solution comes with the m:streamer plus, which includes all m:streamer and AMAS Home features as described above and additional an integrated amplifier with 2x50 Watt and 1x100 Watt power. The "Canton CD 150.2" passive speakers fit perfectly above your kitchen cupboards and the 100 Watt Subwoofer behind the skirting board of a standardized kitchen. Listen to high-quality sound without seeing any speakers or the stereo system. Enjoy an invisible sound system!

 

 

Hands on: Main functions of the m:remote

The following video shows you how to:
  • select sources
  • browse through libraries
  • stream music
  • use the multiroom function
  • change the hotkey (quick access) configuration
  • change system and device settings

 

More than music: Create your own functions with the configuration tool

Once you decided to support us we will provide you with a free configuration tool to individualize your m:remote. With this tool you can:

  • add your home entertainment devices to the m:remote
  • configure and change functions of the buttons for each device
  • create and edit macros

 

Choose and add your IR device: Select your device from the extensive database of home entertainment devices.

Configure your IR device: the main functions of all IR devices are preset, but you can add new buttons and assign functions to different buttons.

Create and edit macros: Configure what actions will take place when pushing a button. You can, for example, assign for "Watch TV" the actions "pause the m:streamer", "turn on the TV", and " turn on the tuner".

 

Specifications

 

 

Rewards

 

Stretch Goals

 

Meet the Team

We are passionate about music since over twenty years. It all started when we developed one of the first portable MP3-Players. Since then, we built up an international team of 20 enthusiastic people of whom every single one is dedicated to constantly improve the Audivo Multiroom Audio System (AMAS) at our headquarter located in the south of Germany. Numerable brands in the high-end hifi sector are our customers already and rely on our powerful streaming platform.

 

 

Timeline

Why Crowdfunding?

We believe that an app is not enough. But we also believe that the user should see up-to-date information on display of a remote. That's why we combined both in the m:remote. It is a unique device that brings the user interface right infront of you. And this is not limited to music streaming.

As a small company we don't have money for big agencies to advertise our product, but we are deeply convinced that there are people out there that share our believes and are ready to support us.

Spread the Word

 

FAQs

In which countries is AMAS Home available?

We ship worldwide. Please be aware that shipping fees and taxes vary across countries.

Is there a warranty?

There is a limited warranty of all products for one year.

How do I set up the AMAS Home system?

Setup is easy and done with three steps:

1. Connect the power supply to the outlet and the m:streamer

2. Start the pairing process on the m:remote (go to System-Settings by pressing the gearwheel button and select "Start Pairing")

3. To establish a connection to your home network (and the internet)

3a. Connect an ethernet cable to the m:streamer or

3b. Connect the m:streamer to your wifi.

Which music services are supported?

Services that will be integrated for sure are: Deezer, Tidal, and Qobuz. If the first stretch goal is reach, we will be able to integrate additionally Spotify and QQ Music.

How can I listen to my own music?

AMAS Home supports UPnP. Connect your NAS drive with the network and your music server will pop up in the "select source" list. You can use an USB drive as well. Just plug it into the m:streamer and select USB from the source list.

My m:streamer stopped working. What should I do?

Plug off the m:streamer, wait 5 seconds and plug it in again. If this doesn't help, write as an email.

Can I control the TV and home enterainment devices with the m:app?

No, smartphones usually do not support RF or Infrared, so controlling home enterainment devices is only possible with the m:remote.

I want to have combination of products which is not listed in the "Perks" section. Is there anything I can do?

If you have special requests, send us an email and we will create you an individual package. Please be aware that extra costs might appear.

Standardized kitchen. What does that mean?

Standardized kitchens have a gap of 100mm to 150mm between the floor and the bottom of the lower cupboard, so you can hide subwoofer and m:streamer plus behind the skirting board on the floor of your kitchen.

I have further questions. Who should I contact?

If you have further questions write us an email: info@audivo.com.

 

 

 

Photo Credits:

© Bogdan Rosu - flaticon.com

© Dave Gandy - flaticon.com

© Freepik - flaticon.com

© Icon Works - flaticon.com

© Lucy G - flaticon.com

© Madebyoliver - flaticon.com

© Matt Mügler - thenounproject.com

© Minh Hoang - flaticon.com

© Vectors Market - flaticon.com

© SimpleIcon - flaticon.com

© Gregor Cresnar - flaticon.com

Which music services are supported?
Services that will be integrated for sure are: Deezer, Tidal, and Qobuz. If the first stretch goal is reach, we will be able to integrate additionally Spotify and QQ Music.
How can I listen to my own music?
AMAS Home supports UPnP. Connect your NAS drive with the network and your music server will pop up in the "select source" list. You can use an USB drive as well. Just plug it into the m:streamer and select USB from the source list.
My m:streamer stopped working. What should I do?
Plug off the m:streamer, wait 5 seconds and plug it in again. If this doesn't help, write as an email.
Can I control the TV and home enterainment devices with the m:app?
No, smartphones usually do not support RF or Infrared, so controlling home enterainment devices is only possible with the m:remote.
I want to have combination of products which is not listed in the "Perks" section. Is there anything I can do?
If you have special requests, send us an email and we will create you an individual package. Please be aware that extra costs might appear.
Standardized kitchen. What does that mean?
Standardized kitchens have a gap of 100mm to 150mm between the floor and the bottom of the lower cupboard, so you can hide subwoofer and m:streamer plus behind the skirting board on the floor of your kitchen.
I have further questions. Who should I contact?
If you have further questions write us an email: info@audivo.com.

story:
What is Text-To-Speech?

Text-to-speech (or TTS, for short) is a type of speech synthesis, which is an artificially constructed voice created from snippets of human voice segments stringed together to create infinite number of sentences. It is called "text-to-speech" because the program can then convert what is typed into a computer into spoken language. Speech synthesis itself is the process of creating this functionality. It is what programs like Google Voice, Siri or Cortana or Echo use to communicate with the users. 

What is TTS Yorùbá?

TTS in Yorùbá is a program to be created for the purpose of turning written Yorùbá text into spoken word/utterances.

Why Hasn't This Been Done Before?

There have been lots of research and activity on Speech Synthesis for Yorùbá but not many have been successful in being both intelligible and natural: two components that a good synthetic voice must have to be usable. According to Dr. Túndé Adégbọla, the director of the African Language Technology Initiative (ALT-I), in collaboration with Dr. Odetuji Odejobi in OAU Ife, they have "achieved appreciable levels of intelligibility of synthesized Yorùbá and we are still making good progress with naturalness." This is good news.

But the big commercial corporations with means to fund research into synthesis have only done it for the large 'marketable' languages, so Yorùbá and other "smaller" languages have been left behind.

How will it be done?

Our purpose for this project is to synthesize Yorùbá for words alone. And so, we would need a   voiceover talent (VT) and a software development team.

This is what Dr. Adégbọlá of ALT-I has to say about our work: "With more than 5000 names already available on-line at the Yoruba names dictionary project web site, the idea of a narrow domain Yoruba names speech synthesizer is a most welcome next step, which will increase the functionality of the dictionary in quanta.  It will turn the dictionary into a must-consult material for people all over the world who may need to find out the proper pronunciation of Yoruba names.  I see it becoming a broadcasters' delight!" 

Dr. Túndé Adégbọlá is the Director of the African Language Technology Initiative at ALT-I.org 
 

Can YOU do it?

Yes, we can. When we launched the project in 2015, one of the element we spent time working on was this audio element. We have figured out the path to success, but we got stuck due to lack of funding and manpower. You can read more about that process in this blog post from 2015. You can also try out the result of that elementary attempt by clicking on these examples: Débọ́lá, Túndé, Folú, etc. You can also change the name on the web address to try out your own examples. They are not perfect yet but we know that we can get it right this time.

Why is this project important?

First, we need to create this software so as to convert all the names in the  YorubaName.com Dictionary into audio. This way, users who do not speak Yorùbá but are interested in learning how to pronounce the names will be able to just click on the audio symbols and hear the pronunciation.

The only other way to convert all the 5000+ names in the dictionary into audio format is to have a human being pronounce them all. This is impractical for reasons of cost, time, and most importantly because of the dictionary's open-ended nature, which ensures that there is no upper limit to the number of names it will contain.

But we are considering research into many more ways in which this software can function in other domains in the future. Here are a few:

  1. Accessibility applications
    Users who can understand spoken Yorùbá but can't read it - users who are not literate in Yorùbá, blind and visually impaired people, people with other disabilities and young children - will be able to merely input the text into the machine and have it read out to them. TTS can be helpful to open up access to novels (audio books), scripture, text messages, and other texts for this demographic.
  2. ATM services
    ATM machines around Nigeria today only offer an English interface. A program like this can be incorporated in the software of ATM machines' artificial intelligence to serve customers in their mother tongue. If it can be done for Yorùbá, it can be done for other languages too.
  3. Educational applications
    As the synthesizer will be programmed to work only with the correctly-placed tone marks, this TTS software can be used in educational contexts to teach both orthography and pronunciation. This can have a net positive effect on the sustenance of the language.
  4. Next step: automatic speech recognition
    The converse side of this project is something called ASR (automatic speech recognition). If we can successfully train the computer to pronounce Yorùbá words properly from reading a text, then we might also be able to train it to understand Yorùbá speech and convert it to text. This will help in the areas of text dictation, and other AI situations like accessing phone or computer functionalities in Yorùbá (and other languages). See this in action at Mark Zuckerberg's house.
  5. Expansion of multilingual tech applications
    Availability of an innovative project usually spurs many other related ideas that can help create more innovations. The Nigerian space is in need of new ideas in language technology, and this project could be a trendsetter.

How Much Do We Need?

We are raising $4000 for this purpose, broken down as follows:

  1. $1500 for recording sessions (to include payment of voice-over talent, studio direction and post production)
  2. $1500 for software development to turn audio data into TTS program.
  3. $1000 any other unforeseen costs.

As usual, if we do not raise the complete amount, we will make do with whatever we get.

If you can help us in other ways, including but not limited to volunteering (especially with skills in software programming and architecture), please reach out at project@yorubaname.com with "TTS-Yorùbá" in the subject.

Can we donate in Naira or Paypal?

Yes, you may. Please send an email to project@yorubaname.com and we'll send you the appropriate bank account number for naira, and email address for PayPal contributions.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this link in your networks and ask your friends to support us by donating.
  • Volunteer your technical know-how, especially if your competence is in speech technology or artificial intelligence.
  • Connect us with grant-making organisations that can make it easier and faster for us to achieve this aim without having to raise money online.

Thank you very much!

_______

About Us

YorubaName.com is a research and documentation project which you can read more about here. The current effort is led by Kọ́lá, with support from Laila, and Victor. Meet the rest of the YorubaName team here.

story:
HOW WE GET HERE

We are very happy to present you all our very first product:

THE DONKEY SPEAKER 

COLLABORATORS

Coco Salado

Alejandra partnered with other friends in her village to start the “Coco Salado” project, the first and only community radio of El Salado. After they went back to the village, following the nonsense war initiated by groups outside the law, they took a donkey and placed speakers on its back to spread village’s news. Alejandra decided to share their initiative to us, and we created a product based on this amazing story. Without her story, we wouldn’t have designed a donkey speaker.

Houd Sound

To make the donkey speaker a reality, we decided to initiate a chain of collaborators by establishing alliance with independent entrepreneurs. First of all, we contacted Houd Sound, a high quality design company based in Colombia that manufactures acoustic speakers made out of wood.

Albaricoque

Then we contacted Albaricoque libros, a Colombian publishing house that seeks to let discover the sweet taste of books to children and adults. They were in charge of illustrating and narrating our "coco salado" story.

A HAPPY NEWSPAPER

A happy newspaper (un periódico feliz) is born thanks to the desire of telling amazing stories hidden behind human cruelty. We want to be the voice and the support for initiatives “under the shade”. We are convinced that we can find more happy stories than the sad ones we watch daily in the news. Behind the bitterest events, we have discovered the bravest people who, through determination and creativity, bring light and hope to their communities. Besides carrying happy news, we also desire helping independent entrepreneurial projects through the finalization of our products. We dream of a different world, and for that, we made the decision of taking action and BE THE CHANGE.

Un periódico feliz is a foundation aiming at immortalizing and materializing amazing stories around the world, and turn them into objects charged with meaning and design. We couldn't be happier to begin with this story found in El Salado, Bolivar in Colombia. Watch the video and help us develop and share "Un periódico feliz". Follow us on instagram @unperiodicofeliz.co, facebook /unperiodicofeliz.co and twitter @1periodicofeliz.

VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL

CÓMO LLEGAMOS AQUÍ

Estamos muy felices de presentar nuestro primer producto:

EL BURRÓFONO

* El video del producto lo puedes encontrar en la versión en inglés. 

COLABORADORES

COCO SALADO

Alejandra reunió a algunos jóvenes del pueblo para comenzar el proyecto “COCO SALADO”, la primera y única radio comunitaria del Salado. Después de recuperar el pueblo de una guerra sin sentido iniciada por grupos por fuera de la ley, ellos tomaron un burro y colocaron unos parlantes en su espalda para difundir las noticias del pueblo. Alejandra compartió esta iniciativa con nosotros, y nosotros creamos un producto basándonos en esta increíble historia. Sin Coco Salado no se hubiera diseñado el burrófono acústico de madera.

*El video de la historia de Alejandra lo puedes encontrar en la versión en inglés.

HOUD SOUND

Para realizar el burrófono, decidimos iniciar una cadena de colaboradores, estableciendo alianzas con emprendedores independientes. Primero que todo contactamos a Houd Sound, una compañía de diseño de alto nivel que desarrolla parlantes acústicos de madera. Ellos fueron los encargados del diseño del producto.

*El video de la historia de Houd Sound lo puedes encontrar en la versión en inglés.

ALBARICOQUE

En segunda instancia, decidimos contactar a Albaricoque libros, una editorial colombiana independiente que busca traer el dulce sabor de los libros a niños y adultos. Ellos se encargaron de ilustrar y narrar nuestra historia de Coco Salado.

*El video de la historia de Albaricoque la puedes encontrar en la versión en inglés.

UN PERIÓDICO FELIZ

Un periódico feliz (A happy newspaper) nace gracias al deseo de contar historias increíbles escondidas detrás de la crueldad humana. Queremos ser la voz y  ayuda de aquellas iniciativas bajo la sombra. Estamos convencidos de que son más las historias felices que las violentas y tristes que vemos a diario en las noticias mundiales. Hemos descubierto que detrás de los sucesos más amargos están esos valientes que por medio de la lucha, la determinación y la creatividad traen luz y esperanza.

No sólo queremos ser portadores de estas noticias felices, sino también apoyar proyectos independientes para la realización de nuestros productos. Deseamos un mundo diferente y por eso tomamos la decisión de accionarnos a SER EL CAMBIO.

Un periódico feliz es una fundación que pretende inmortalizar y materializar historias increíbles alrededor del mundo a través de objetos cargados de significado y diseño. No podríamos estar más felices de comenzar este proyecto con esta historia encontrada en El Salado, Bolívar en Colombia. Mira el video y ayúdanos a desarrollar y compartir Un periódico feliz. Síguenos en instagram @unperiodicofeliz.co, en facebook /unperiodicofeliz.co, y en twitter @1periodicofeliz.

story:
"Can't believe the sound stage and stereo imaging [I'm] getting with these tiny wireless Helix M speakers!"
            - @geekyranjit, Youtube Product Reviewer

"Very impressive new speakers from Y Audio! These thing get LOUD - loving them so far!"
          - @raystrazdas, Youtube Product Reviewer

"The imaging and clarity is beautiful!"
          - Joe Barsuglia, Music Industry Veteran/Jazz Musician

"They sound much bigger than they are!"
          - Nathan Wilmarth, Musician/Composer

"I'm really impressed. I love them. It's just awesome that you can hook up to sixteen of these things."
          - Josh Jeffers, Musician/Audio Engineer


Video Reviews




Helix M Series
The World's First DECT Wireless Speaker System




Different than Bluetooth or WiFi, they are designed for people who love their music and...



... engineered from the ground up to give you the best wireless listening experience possible, through...


True Stereo Image
Hear the full dimension of your music. Perfectly synchronized left and right channels offer an unbelievable stereo experience where you can "see" every member of the band on the stage. 

Real HD Audio Resolution 
Hear the finest detail in your music. Send HiFi lossless audio at 96KHz/24bit, twice the resolution of all other wireless portable speakers. When playing compressed MP3s, they will be normalized and up-sampled, making them sound even better.

Pristine Clarity 
Hear you music, and only your music. The all digital path and high power efficiency of our technology reduce electromagnetic interference and microphonic pickup, resulting in extremely pure audio. 

Sound that Surrounds 
Hear your music they way you want. Connect up to 16 speakers to a single sound source to fill out a large space or bring music to multiple rooms. Craft the perfect soundscape for any space and be surrounded by your music.

True Plug & Play
Simply plug in the USB transmitter into your smart device or computer and play your music as you usually would. No special apps or internet connection to worry about. It simply works every time, everywhere. 


Simple Computer & Smart Device Setup
The first video below shows how to connect to a computer for the first time. The second video show how to connect to a smart phone using an OTG cable. It's really easy and simple.


The Power of Our USB Transmitter
To engineer the best wireless listening experience possible, we needed to go beyond Bluetooth and WiFi to a technology that could deliver HiFi wireless audio in a portable system. This technology is DECT and was developed to broadcast audio, something neither Bluetooth or Wifi were originally designed to do. We took DECT and innovated its multi-channel synchronization capability, which can now send perfectly synchronized audio to 16 speakers at once. Since a DECT transmitter isn't build into computers or smart devices yet, we designed a simple and sleek solution, the Helix USB Transmitter, to bring the best wireless listening experience to everyone.

30 Hour Battery Life
Listen to your music longer and have piece of mind that your speakers won't die on you when you need them the most. From a single 6 hour charge, your Helix M Series speakers will have enough power to continuously play for 30 hours. 


Longer Transmission Range
Spread out your speakers to truly fill the space. Indoors, you can place your speakers up to 75 feet away from your transmission source, and outdoors, you can place them up to 150 feet away. 


Sustainable & Stable
DECT operates on its own 1880-1980Mhz connection so your audio doesn't put further strain on your limited WiFi bandwidth, nor will your audio cut in and out when your WiFi bandwidth is clogged. Your Netflix binge watchers will thank you!

So Why Use DECT Instead Of  Bluetooth Or WiFi?


The simple answer: It just does what they can't. To get into more detail, here's a list of the pains we've felt with the conventional technologies and how DECT makes those pains disappear.

Double Compresses Audio
Your audio sounds less clear and lower quality. Some manufacturers try to hide this lower quality audio by lifting the low frequencies, giving the impression of more bass. DECT up-samples your audio to 96KHz/24bit delivering beautiful clarity. We don't try to cover up anything. We want to hear all of our music. We think you will too.

Not True Stereo
Your music sounds one dimensional. DECT enables multichannel synchronization so you can have a truly independent left and right speaker to give an amazing stereo image.

Limited Device Connectivity
It's difficult, if not impossible, to play through multiple speakers at the same time. With DECT you can connect up to 16 speakers to a single sound source.

Short Transmission Range
You have less freedom in how you set up your system. DECT gives you greater freedom with a 75' indoor / 150' outdoor transmission range.

Short Battery Life
If there's no more power, there's no more music. DECT gives you an industry leading 30 hours of continuos play time on a 6 hour charge.

Internet Dependent
If your internet connection goes down, so does your music, even with local audio files. DECT creates a closed network between your music source and your speakers. Your internet, cable, and cell phone service could all go down, but your music will still be playing.

App Download Required
A proprietary app needs to be downloaded, which gives you one more thing you need to sign into and learn how to use. DECT doesn't need a special app. It works with everything you already know and use.

Complicated Setup
Setup can take up to 30 minutes before you can listen to your music. DECT is super simple to set up. Just plug in the USB transmitter, turn on your speakers and you have amazingly beautiful audio in seconds. 

Limited to in App Play
You can only play your music through the WiFi speaker manufacturer's proprietary app which only works with services it recognizes. DECT lets you play your music from your media library, any streaming service, or wherever you like. Basically, if it makes a noise, your Helix M Series speakers can play it.

Not Truly Portable
You can only listen to your music in a place that offers a reliable WiFi connection. DECT lets you play your music anywhere you like.

The World's First DECT Wireless Speaker System!



Helix M Series Specs
Category: Portable Wireless Speakers
Finish:  White shell with light gray front / Black shell with dark gray front
Cabinet:  Gasket sealed molded polymer shell
               

Product Specification
Transmission channel : DECT 
Drive: 2.72in/68mm woofer and .79in/20mm titanium tweeter
Dimension: 5.5 x 3.3 x 4.7in / 140 x 85 x 120mm (H x W x D)
Weight:  2.2lbs / 1kg per speaker
Play time: 30 hours  
Charge time: 6 hours (5V 1A USB adaptor)      
Power input: Internal rechargeable battery (2600mAH), or USB power
Power output: 9W per pair
Connection: USB audio from PC, iOS, Android, Set-top-box

Audio Specification
Audio quality: 96KHz/24bit
Room size: 70 - 180 square ft. per pair.
Frequency response: 75-28000Hz
Configuration:  Stereo 2.0, Speaker network (up to 16 speaker)
For more technical information, please download our Technical Write-Up PDF.
Balancing the Volume for a Multi-Speaker System
Charging Your Speakers

Get Even More Out Of Your Listening Experience



Carry Case for your Helix M Series
Made from durable materials and reinforced construction, this case is perfect for carrying your pair of Helix M Series speakers around. The case features mesh side panels that allow you to easily play your music on the go.

Lightning On-The-Go Cable
Use this cable to connect your USB transmitter to any Lightning enabled iOS device. Just plug it in and you're ready to play. No special apps to download, settings in your phone to change, or devices to pair to. It just works! 
A micro USB OTG cable for Android devices is included for free with each pair of speakers. We wanted to also include a free Lightning OTG cable, but Apple controls the prices of legitimate Lightning cables. We refused to go with a cheaper less reliable cable just so we could give it to you for free.


About Us


Y Audio
We're an international brand who's team members have over 25 years experience engineering and manufacturing products for the telecommunications industry. We're excited to bring our passion and know-how together to help everyone have the best wireless listening experience possible.

Status of Production
Over the past 18 months we've engineered a new wireless speaker system from the ground up that we're incredibly proud of. We refused to cut any corners while maintaining our singular focus of bring the best wireless listening experience to our customers. We've finished with development and have manufacturing and fulfillment ready to spin up. We'll be fulfilling orders starting Dec. 2015 through Feb 2016.


Join Us


Become a Backer
Become a backer and order your own Helix M Series wireless speaker system. Choose your color and whether you want 1 to 3 pairs. Each pair of speakers will come with one USB transmitter, one micro USB charging cord, and one Android OTG cable. You can also pick up a Lightning OTG Cable for your iOS device and a Helix M Series Carry Case for the ultimate portable system! 

As a backer you'll also get all of our backer exclusive updates and surprises, which will include discounts on future orders and first looks at future products. 

Join our Community
Join us on Facebook and Twitter. With the goal of being helpful to our community, we love posting interesting articles about how to make your listening experience even better. We also strive to provide excellent customer support through our social media channels, so if you ever need anything or have a question, just reach out! We're always happy to hear from you and to help!

Happy Listening!


Download our brochure
Media kit available here
story_txt:
"Can't believe the sound stage and stereo imaging [I'm] getting with these tiny wireless Helix M speakers!"            - @geekyranjit, Youtube Product Reviewer
"Very impressive new speakers from Y Audio! These thing get LOUD - loving them so far!"          - @raystrazdas, Youtube Product Reviewer
"The imaging and clarity is beautiful!"          - Joe Barsuglia, Music Industry Veteran/Jazz Musician
"They sound much bigger than they are!"          - Nathan Wilmarth, Musician/Composer
"I'm really impressed. I love them. It's just awesome that you can hook up to sixteen of these things."          - Josh Jeffers, Musician/Audio Engineer



Video Reviews















Helix M SeriesThe World's First DECT Wireless Speaker System





Different than Bluetooth or WiFi, they are designed for people who love their music and...





... engineered from the ground up to give you the best wireless listening experience possible, through...




True Stereo ImageHear the full dimension of your music. Perfectly synchronized left and right channels offer an unbelievable stereo experience where you can "see" every member of the band on the stage. 








Real HD Audio Resolution Hear the finest detail in your music. Send HiFi lossless audio at 96KHz/24bit, twice the resolution of all other wireless portable speakers. When playing compressed MP3s, they will be normalized and up-sampled, making them sound even better.








Pristine Clarity Hear you music, and only your music. The all digital path and high power efficiency of our technology reduce electromagnetic interference and microphonic pickup, resulting in extremely pure audio. 







Sound that Surrounds Hear your music they way you want. Connect up to 16 speakers to a single sound source to fill out a large space or bring music to multiple rooms. Craft the perfect soundscape for any space and be surrounded by your music.







True Plug & PlaySimply plug in the USB transmitter into your smart device or computer and play your music as you usually would. No special apps or internet connection to worry about. It simply works every time, everywhere. 




Simple Computer & Smart Device SetupThe first video below shows how to connect to a computer for the first time. The second video show how to connect to a smart phone using an OTG cable. It's really easy and simple.







The Power of Our USB TransmitterTo engineer the best wireless listening experience possible, we needed to go beyond Bluetooth and WiFi to a technology that could deliver HiFi wireless audio in a portable system. This technology is DECT and was developed to broadcast audio, something neither Bluetooth or Wifi were originally designed to do. We took DECT and innovated its multi-channel synchronization capability, which can now send perfectly synchronized audio to 16 speakers at once. Since a DECT transmitter isn't build into computers or smart devices yet, we designed a simple and sleek solution, the Helix USB Transmitter, to bring the best wireless listening experience to everyone.












30 Hour Battery LifeListen to your music longer and have piece of mind that your speakers won't die on you when you need them the most. From a single 6 hour charge, your Helix M Series speakers will have enough power to continuously play for 30 hours. 








Longer Transmission RangeSpread out your speakers to truly fill the space. Indoors, you can place your speakers up to 75 feet away from your transmission source, and outdoors, you can place them up to 150 feet away. 







Sustainable & StableDECT operates on its own 1880-1980Mhz connection so your audio doesn't put further strain on your limited WiFi bandwidth, nor will your audio cut in and out when your WiFi bandwidth is clogged. Your Netflix binge watchers will thank you!




So Why Use DECT Instead Of  Bluetooth Or WiFi?The simple answer: It just does what they can't. To get into more detail, here's a list of the pains we've felt with the conventional technologies and how DECT makes those pains disappear.


Double Compresses AudioYour audio sounds less clear and lower quality. Some manufacturers try to hide this lower quality audio by lifting the low frequencies, giving the impression of more bass. DECT up-samples your audio to 96KHz/24bit delivering beautiful clarity. We don't try to cover up anything. We want to hear all of our music. We think you will too.
Not True StereoYour music sounds one dimensional. DECT enables multichannel synchronization so you can have a truly independent left and right speaker to give an amazing stereo image.

Limited Device ConnectivityIt's difficult, if not impossible, to play through multiple speakers at the same time. With DECT you can connect up to 16 speakers to a single sound source.
Short Transmission RangeYou have less freedom in how you set up your system. DECT gives you greater freedom with a 75' indoor / 150' outdoor transmission range.
Short Battery LifeIf there's no more power, there's no more music. DECT gives you an industry leading 30 hours of continuos play time on a 6 hour charge.
Internet DependentIf your internet connection goes down, so does your music, even with local audio files. DECT creates a closed network between your music source and your speakers. Your internet, cable, and cell phone service could all go down, but your music will still be playing.
App Download RequiredA proprietary app needs to be downloaded, which gives you one more thing you need to sign into and learn how to use. DECT doesn't need a special app. It works with everything you already know and use.
Complicated SetupSetup can take up to 30 minutes before you can listen to your music. DECT is super simple to set up. Just plug in the USB transmitter, turn on your speakers and you have amazingly beautiful audio in seconds. 
Limited to in App PlayYou can only play your music through the WiFi speaker manufacturer's proprietary app which only works with services it recognizes. DECT lets you play your music from your media library, any streaming service, or wherever you like. Basically, if it makes a noise, your Helix M Series speakers can play it.
Not Truly PortableYou can only listen to your music in a place that offers a reliable WiFi connection. DECT lets you play your music anywhere you like.
    The World's First DECT Wireless Speaker System!

story:
What does “Dramatized” mean?
Multiple voiceover artists will represent different characters, and each will narrate their parts. They will narrate an English translation of the Quran without adding or changing a single word.
Then their voices will be synthesized with appropriate audio effects and delightful background sounds.
The result will be an incredibly vivid audio version of the Quran people will enjoy listening and understanding!
We invite you to check out our website at www.dramatizedquran.com and listen to a short demo.

Why is it important?
Many people have not had a chance to read the Quran and understand it. The Dramatized Quran will enhance the experience by the use of art and drama. Hence, it will have the potential to attract multitudes of people to listen it.
The more people are educated about different religions, the more they can understand each other.
 

Who will benefit from this?
Both Muslims, and non-Muslims who are interested to know more about the Quran will find this very useful and valuable. It will also help to clear out some misconceptions that might be around the Quran.

How?
The length of the final audio for the entire Quran will be around 20 hours. However, it will take months of production and other ancillary work to carry out this great project. We are certain that with your help and support the Dramatized Quran will be available soon.

Where and When?
The vision for this project is that it will be readily available mostly through the online channels. Once released, our well-planned advertising campaigns can create waves of awareness about the Dramatized Quran, and in different phases it will reach to the worldwide audience.

story:
Please visit us here for more details:

https://www.bursonaudio.com/products/play/

Play Music: 

Crisp, dynamic and musical, the Play is a top class DAC with 32bit / 384khz, DXD and DSD256 playback capacity. Pairing effortlessly with Windows, OSX, iOS, and Android systems, its SABRE32/ESS9018 DAC chip and Xmos USB receiver are benchmarks in the industry and our pure Class A circuitry unleashes their full potential.

With a 70W power supply outputting 2Watts per channel, the Play is one of the most powerful headphone amplifiers in the world. Regardless of headphones, you can feel the power and accuracy at any volume levels.

Pure Class A with no ICs on the signal path, the Play is a remote controlled preamp that teams perfectly with any power amp or active speakers.

By changing opamps, you can even tailor its sound to suit your preference.

The Play is peerless!

Play Opamps

Opamp rolling is a major part of the audiophile hobby. There are countless online discussions dedicated to it. And why not? it offers the opportunity to compare and appreciate different sonic performance in your own comfort zone and it is a valuable opportunity to develop listening preference and taste.

A fully discrete circuitry operating in pure Class-A, the Play is the ultimate opamp rolling platform.

The Play is fun!

Game Play

Film and game producers know the importance of music and sound in their work. It can turn any ordinary experience into a spiritually enriching one. In fact, audio in gaming is even more vital. Apart from the passive cinematic scores, games rely on interactive sound and music during gameplay to engage with gamers. To become successful, games today need to invest millions and work with top composers to develop their scores and sound effects.

Sadly, PC gamers are denied of audio performance that does their gaming justice. None of the “high-end” sound cards feature advanced DAC chips. They all have high distortion IC based output stages and they all use very noisy Class-D power supplies. The most powerful soundcard outputs less than 100mWatt (0.1 Watt) into headphones. Such soundcards not only degrade the whole gaming experience but also affect the gamers ability to respond to situations crucial to the success of their campaign.

The Burson Play features the SABRE32/ESS9018 DAC chip and Xmos USB receiver chip. Both are technological benchmarks in the audiophile industry. To minimise distortion, the Play is tuned to operate in pure Class-A. Outputting 2000 mWatt per channel, it is over 20 times more powerful than the next best soundcard. To top it off, the Play features a high-performance mic input and fits into any PC case elegantly.

The Play is the missing piece for any gaming PC!

Play with Audeze planar magnetic headphones: 

We are again teaming with Audeze, the premium US based planar magnetic headphone maker, to deliver the best value-for-money Perks for fellow headphone audio enthusiasts.  Since 2008, the two companies work closely on research and development and our products sound perfect together.

story:
✅ Brand New Bluetooth 5.0

✅ Dual Transmission

✅  Ipx7 Waterproof, 30cm Waterproof

✅  20H Long Battery Lifespan

✅  High Fidelity HIFI Sound Quality

✅ NaturalEar Curve

The majority of wireless headsets in the market are single-track Bluetooth transmission with 260ms delay, and the recognition tosound delay of mankind is about 90ms. Our OVEVO earbuds realize the dual-track Bluetooth simultaneous transmissionwithout priority or secondarybetween two ears, reducing the delay to 60ms.The gamesound is more instantand exciting. In order to be more comfortable, the designer gives them a more precise circuit board and more rigorous structure, eventually making them the world's narrowest cross section even if your ear canal is very narrow, you can also wear them very comfortable. Inspired by the shape of water drop, this headset is designed to achieve a perfect curve shape with a two-way chain hinge for a comfortable feel and a small and interesting shape.

Dual-channel Bluetooth transmission allows the headphone to have no main and auxiliary ear,
and the left and right headphone functions are the same.

 

 

What does OVEVO Q80 say：

 

The newly developed Bluetooth chip can transmit signal to both sides of earbuds at the same time, reducing the sound delay to 60ms.The data transmission rate is increased to 2 times compared with the previous generation, and the connection is faster and more stable. When listening game the experience is smoother.

In order to adapt to different ear types, we design a more precise circuit board, more rigorous
structure, and develop the world's narrowest cross section, even if your ear canal is very small
to wear very comfortable.pe.

Customized large/medium/small crescent ear flaps, the ear flaps are made of custom soft rubber; if the ear canal is narrow, you can also remove the ear flaps and use the bare earphones directly.

HIFI moving iron version uses the top equipment in the field of speaker unit: full-frequency moving iron speaker, with dual-track Bluetooth 5.0 chip, making Q80's tri-band resolution reach HIFI level, bringing you the immersive sound quality experience.

 

 It adopts a 6mm diameter moving ring horn, specially designed with long sound cavity, and then optimized by the tuner to make the middle and low frequency  powerful, melody belt, showing a clear and transparent sound quality.

The Bluetooth 5.0 chip has a built-in high-resolution decoder, which is supplemented by high-audio encoding technology. It has more powerful high-speed transmission, and the resolution
distinguishes each individual sound so that you can fully enjoy the different pleasure of various style of music or games.

With TWS technology of the binaural split design, the customer can enjoy true freedom without limitation of the cable. The pleasure of melody and rhythm of music can be yours by anytime and anywhere.

 

A new generation of Bluetooth 5.0 technology upgraded overall performance, realizing long-
distance transmission with low power consumption. The stronger anti-WIFI signal interference
capability and optimized antenna design make the sound smoother and clearer, bringing you to a more enjoyable listening and watching experience.

Tested by life-grade waterproofing, nano-scale anti-sweat testing, support for rainy days, swimming and other outdoor sports, free your movements from now on.

 

The earbuds can play 5 hours of music separately, the charging compartment can charge the
earbuds for 3 times, and the charging compartment can play 20 hours (in the case of the mobile phone 60% of the playback volume data).

 

After the headset is placed back in the charging case, the internal magnetic design allows the
earbuds to be easily attached to the charging case and get charged.

 

In order to achieve the perfect shape of the water drop, the two-way chain hinge design allows the small shaft to be built into the bin, which not only realizes the comfortable feeling of opening and closing, but also does not affect the perfect appearance. The design is simple and exquisite, and it is pleasing to the eye like a artwork.

Use your fingertips to lightly tap or tap the touch panel on the earbuds, double-click the right ear— the next song; double-click the left ear—the previous one; click to hang up/answer; three hits can start siri or voice.

 

 

 Q80 adapts Taiwan's dual-channel chip technology which has obtained US patent certification.

About US

OVEVO team focuses on sports music products development and manufacturing for ten years, and devotes itself to creating music products more suitable for sports.

story:
The patent pending Hygien-E Virtual Caregiver is the best tool to improve the performance and reduce the stress associated with the activities of daily living for anyone with special needs. It is a fun and engaging program utilizing groundbreaking technology based on the latest research into cognitive impairment. 

For more information about HygienE: The Virtual Caregiver, please visit our website at www.hygien-e.com
